Name: Data Analyst
Description: At Northwestern Mutual, we believe relationships are built on trust. That our lives and our work matter. These beliefs launched our company nearly 160 years ago. Today, they're just a few of the reasons why people choose to build careers at Northwestern Mutual. We're strong and growing. In a company with such a long and storied history, this may be the most exciting and important time to be a part of Northwestern Mutual. We're strong, innovative and growing. We invest in our people. We provide opportunities for employees to grow themselves, their career and in turn, our business. We care. We make a positive difference in our communities. Nationally, thousands have benefitted from our support of research and programs to fight childhood cancer. Each year, our Foundation, employees and financial representatives donate time, talent and financial support to causes they're passionate about. We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristic protected by law.What's the role?The Data Analyst consultant leads the design and development of research, reports and models required to help evaluate strategic changes in business direction and to provide meaningful results needed to consult with client areas. Using broad and deep knowledge of data sources and technical resources for assigned areas, the consultant leads and mentors team members through participation in a variety of projects. The consultant has a lead role in building appropriate systems and reports. The consultant independently researches new technologies and recommends potential implementation.    Bring Your Best! What this role needs: Proven ability to design and build reports and provide analysis in an understandable format, as generally evidenced by 5-7 years of programming, analysis and project work.Bachelor’s Degree with an emphasis in MIS, Business or related field required.Demonstrated experience leading financial modeling, research and reporting projects.Strong analytical and problem solving skills, including the ability to create solutions to complex and/or loosely defined assignments.Strong written and presentation skills, especially in communicating complex technical information to non-technical audiences.Seasoned expert in advanced features of a variety of programs which may include Excel, Access, SQL, Visual Basic, Business Objects, SAS, JCL, and Business Intelligence tools.Must be able to learn new technology quickly to assess current systems against new software and determine best solutions for providing results.Demonstrated ability to build rapport at all levels.Strong organizational skills including managing multiple projects and priorities.Must be able to carry out diverse assignments in a fast paced environment.Self-starter with ability to work independently with minimal direction and supervision.Proven ability to apply business consulting and project management skills to meet required outcomes.Req ID: 24362 Position Type: Regular Full Time Education Experience: Bachelor's Required Employment Experience: 6-8 years Licenses/Certifications: Not Applicable FLSA Status: Exempt Posting Date: 11/29/2018

Identify, transform, update, and verify data  Summarize in dashboards  Manage end-user access  Assist users, providing individual assistance and training documents  Expedite data verification and maintenance requests from multiple campuses through multiple functions  Maintain complex, data-based SharePoint lists QUALIFICATIONS: Required-  Fluency in SQL (Structured Query Language) using Microsoft Access, or commensurate application to connect to data sources, identify and transform data, and append, update, or delete fields as required.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office productivity applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word), with emphasis on repeatable data analysis practices (ODBC and other data calls)  Demonstrated ability to create documented, repeatable processes and educate end-users; create and distribute process maps, instructions and job aids  Demonstrated ability to engage stakeholders in a variety of functions and geographic locations  Preferred-  Expertise in Microsoft SharePoint list creation and management  LSS Green Belt training, certification  Experience with corporate compliance auditing procedures and activities  Familiarity with Microsoft PowerBI content creation  Previous experience in a design and manufacturing environment a plus

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionRefinitiv Global Wealth Management provides innovative solutions for retail and institutional brokerage firms, financial advisors and individual investors. Our powerful, scalable productivity and decision support tools enable our clients to grow relationships, offer personalized service and increase assets under management.  We are looking to fill a Business Analyst position within the Refinitiv development team. The Business Analyst will be involved in all phases of the System Development Life Cycle utilizing the Scrum methodology. This individual will be responsible for business requirements gathering, functional design, test plans, test scripts, functional testing, providing support of user acceptance testing, and project implementation. The Business Analyst will serve as the liaison between our development staff and client firms/project stakeholders. He or she will also interact with all levels of the organization to ensure timely completion with the highest degree of quality of industry, regulatory and client initiatives.  The Business Analyst will be involved in daily Scrum meetings and will require heavy collaboration, so a consistent presence in the Brookfield, WI office is absolutely necessary to be successful in the position. Responsibilities:Gather user requirements from external \ internal clients via User Requirements Documentation and\or end-user interviewsParticipate in project estimation processAlong with stakeholders and technical development staff create functional design documents based upon user requirementsDevelop a strong test plan to ensure project qualityDevelop test scripts for functional testing, ensuring that all identified requirements have been thoroughly testedExecute test scripts; document and manage all test resultsProvide on-going project support for regression and system testingLiaison between development staff and use communityProperly document all defectsReport project status to stakeholders as well as Project Management or Senior ExecutivesProvide support, answer user questions during User Acceptance TestingDevelop a professional rapport with the project stakeholders and maintain an excellent level of client satisfactionEffectively research product questions within an area of expertiseDevelop Implementation Plans and validate the successful implementation of projectsQualifications:BS/BA, preferably in Computer Science, MIS, Mathematics, Finance, Business, or a combination of equivalent education and experienceExperience in the brokerage or financial sector is a huge plusAbility to understand and communicate simple to somewhat involved technical concepts is criticalMust have excellent analytical problem solving skillsStrong team player with an entrepreneurial, collaborative spiritPrior experience in a Business Analyst role is highly desiredStrong experience in Software Development Life Cycle(s) is nice to haveExperience in or understanding of Agile practices is a plusExcellent organization, interpersonal, & communication skillsDemonstrated ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment The Financial and Risk Business of Thomson Reuters is now Refinitiv. Refinitiv equips the financial community with access to an open platform that uncovers opportunity and catalyzes change. With a dynamic combination of data, insights, technology, and news from Reuters, our customers can access solutions for every challenge, including a breadth of applications, tools, and contentall supported by human expertise. At Refinitiv, we facilitate the connections that propel people and organizations to find new possibilities to move forward.  As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. Therefore we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the worldregardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Refinitiv is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.  Intrigued by a challenge as large and fascinating as the world itself? Come join us.Locations Brookfield-Wisconsin-United States of America

Name: Business Analyst - Entry Level
Description: GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES - Business Analyst, Entry Level Role • Performs analyses of the business goals, objectives and needs of the general business environment for appropriate FIS segment, division, group or line of business. • Performs research and analysis to support business operations and presents findings to manager or project leader. • Plans and designs business processes and make recommendations and changes in order to improve and support business systems and activities and/or to deliver greater effectiveness and efficiency. • Utilizes systems and data to resolve business issues in the most effective and productive manner. • Identifies and implements best practices and suggests how to improve current practices. • Calculates/estimates costs and benefits of alternative actions or solutions to establish their viability/return on investment. • Develops recommendations to solve problems and issues related to business operations. • Analyzes and documents business processes and metrics and identifies improvement opportunities. • May train internal employees on changes to business practices, processes or procedures. • May perform special projects upon request and on occasion. • May provide coaching and/or guidance to less experienced Business Analysts. • Other related duties assigned as needed. EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s degree in business administration, finance, computer science or information systems.  GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES • Knowledge of the business goals, objectives and business operations for the appropriate FIS organization • Knowledge of financial services industry • Knowledge of basic financial analysis principles and ratios • Proficiency in standard office software, such as MS Office, Visio, MS Access, etc. • Proficiency in industry-standard process methodologies, e.g., Six Sigma, LEAN, ISO, CMM, etc. • Excellent verbal and written communication skills to audiences of various levels in the organization, e.g., executive, management, individual contributors • Willingly shares relevant knowledge and expertise to other resources • Excellent analytical, decision-making, problem-solving, interpersonal, team, customer service, negotiation, conflict management and time management skills • Ability to persuade and influence others on the best approach to take • Ability to estimate work effort for project sub-plans or small projects and ensure the project is successfully completed • Is resourceful and proactive in gathering information and sharing ideas

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Position Description  Exempt  Title: Business Analyst Grade: E-4  Location: Milwaukee Travel: 10%+  Supervised By: Lead Business Analyst Supersedes: Date: None  GENERAL PURPOSE: The primary responsibility of this role is to formulate and define system scope and requirements through research and discussions with customers combined with an understanding of applicable business systems and industry standards.  RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES: Analyzes the needs of business and user; translates issues between business and technical teamsElicits and documents business and system requirementsResearches and assists with the design process for software and / or hardware implementationsIdentifies key development resources based on project scope and gathers project estimatesAssist the development team throughout SDLC with defining use cases, creating test data, clarifying requirementsReviews and participates in the development of QA testing strategy and plansWorks with project manager to coordinate project tasksDocuments training materials and demonstrates new functionality to customers using professional presentation tools and conceptsAnalyzes and routes system defects to appropriate team for resolutionProvides customer support related to projects, defects, implementation, etc. REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, MIS, or related field, or commensurate experienceMinimum two years’ experience working in software development with focus on web-based and/or mobile user interfacesTravel & Hospitality, Service, or Manufacturing industry experience preferred SKILLS Technical writingApplication of project management concepts to software engineering projectsHow software worksWebsite and/or mobile user interfacesSoftware development lifecycle (preferably Agile/SCRUM methodology)Ability to influence and persuade to achieve desired outcomesStrong analytical, problem solving, and negotiation skillsExcellent oral and written communication skillsWillingness to travelExcellent organizational, planning, and prioritization skillsExcellent interpersonal skills Blue7 Solutions is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment background checks.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: About us: Insurity is one of the largest property and casualty insurance technology and services providers with more than 700 employees and 250 clients. With more than 30 years of domain expertise, we have combined a deep understanding of the insurance business and technology expertise into a singular focus: empowering our clients with innovative and flexible technology that allows them to meet their business goals and offer a simplified insurance experience.  We are currently looking to fill the following position in our Hartland, WI office: Business Analyst The Business Analyst is responsible for eliciting, analyzing and documenting requirements and/or functional specifications as needed, including determination of regulatory impact and system impact.  Participate with customers and internal functional areas as appropriate throughout the development, testing, and installation processes. Research and evaluate alternative approaches and recommend efficient and cost effective solutions. The individual contributes to activities to improve quality and advance the overall analysis practice throughout the organization. The Business Analyst may provide coordination for small initiatives.  The ideal candidate must possess a strong desire to develop technical and business knowledge relative to implementation of insurance processing. What you’ll be doing:Partnering with customers to define business needs and elicit business requirementsProducing artifacts that accurately depict customer needs for enhancement, problem and support requests, such as:Business requirementsFunctional specificationsProcess flow diagrams and other diagramsAssisting in the facilitation of requirements and design discussionsProviding research and analysis in support of proposed solutionsParticipating in peer reviews/inspections for requirements, estimates, and specificationsAssisting in the development of supporting documentationProviding support as needed to internal and external customersDeveloping a working knowledge of Insurity's software applications, data structures, architecture, and processing capabilitiesDeveloping working knowledge of Property/Casualty InsuranceAssisting in the facilitation of estimating discussions and coordinating work effortsAccurately estimating analyst work effortsProviding support for testing activitiesPerforming other duties as assignedWhat you’ll need:Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experienceExcellent verbal and written communication skillsCandidate must be self-motivated, detail-oriented and organizedAbility to thrive in a fast-paced environmentBasic knowledge of the System Development LifecycleBasic knowledge of project management principlesAbility to travel to customer locations: up to 25%Experience with Property/Casualty Insurance preferredWhat you’ll get:Cool Environment | Collaborative Culture | Competitive SalariesFlexible Hours | Growth Opportunities | Generous Time OffDay 1 Health Insurance Coverage | 401k Match | Great Location Does Insurity sound like the right place for you? If yes, then submit your application today for immediate consideration. Thank you for your interest in Insurity; only those candidates selected will be contacted. Insurity is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Business Analyst
Description: For over 37 years Kracor Rotational Molders, a Division of Yamaha Marine Systems Company, Inc., has manufactured high quality rotationally molded plastic products for national and international markets with parts for the recreational marine, industrial, agricultural, waste, lawn and garden, medical and others.  Yamaha-Kracor has an excellent opportunity for a Business Analyst to join our Marine Group in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.The Business Analyst will assist with financial analysis and reporting requirements for the organization. He or she will also provide support in accounting, purchasing, shipping, and planning activities. Specific duties include, but are not limited to:Preparation of weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual reports.Assist with developing and maintaining all sales and financial reporting systems.Maintain JSOX compliance as per our internal processes.Provide financial oversight and recommendations to the Kracor management team.Provide custom ad-hoc financial reports as needed.Perform periodic reviews (e.g., daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual) to ensure that all KPIs are performing as per management direction.Perform research and analysis as requested.Analyze financial information to produce forecasts of business, industry, and economic conditions.Prepares charts and diagrams showing prior, current, and projected revenues and expenditures to provide a basis for comparison and evaluation.Assists in analyzing periodic reports that are distributed to executives and managers with a written explanation of the highlights of each report and trending patterns. Provide an explanation of the driving forces behind significant variances.Monitors daily reports to identify operational trends.Drafts comprehensive monthly financial package for distribution to senior management, including YMUS Marine management.Support accounting activities such as invoicing, month-end close, and maintaining list of fixed assets.Support purchasing and shipping activities such as MRP, ordering (inventory items), and processing export documentation.Oversee production scheduling processes.Performs monthly cycle counts to reconcile inventory on hand with financials.Assists in performing physical inventories.Perform other duties as assigned Requirements:BA / BS in Business, Accounting and / or Finance is required.2 - 3 years’ experience in financial or sales analysis, preferably in a Manufacturing environment.Knowledge of MRP/ERP Systems.Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Excel.Strong written and oral communication skills.Strong planning and organizational skills.Able to work effectively in a team environment.Ability to travel up to 15%.  #LI-KB1

Name: Business Analyst
Description: As the Business Analyst at Concurrency, you will consult with our clients to understand their current business problems, define a future state solution and align it to their business goals via a world class, scalable solution. The Business Analyst is the strategic advisor within a project to ensure People, Process and Technology are all embedded within our overall solutions.ResponsibilitiesWorks with clients to understand their business problems, generate business cases, and assist in setting solution scopeConsult with client teams to not only collect requirements, but challenge and lead them to a higher state of maturity aligned to their business goalsParticipates in pre-sales activities to scope engagements with clientsLeads internal and external customers through current state/future state gap analysis and executes directed design workshops to build an agreed upon set of functional requirementsConstructs a test plan involving use/test cases required to facilitate QA activities and to validate the technical solutions built to satisfy the clients functional requirementsFacilitate organizational change management processes within each project to ensure users are properly trained and communicated withAssist in post-rollout user adoption activities ensuring the solution is fit for function and operating as expectedFacilitates the operational turnover of solutions from the project team into the customers operational environment or to a Concurrency Managed Service offeringBuilds, reviews, and analyzes process flows, use cases, activity diagrams, interface designs etc. as required for the given projectBuilds and manages synergistic relationships with relevant business partnersQualificationsBachelors Degree with a business or IT emphasis, MBA PreferredSignificant and tangible experience conducting business/systems analysis and design efforts using the system development lifecycle methodologyExperience conducting business/system analysis on projects supporting both business and IT operationsAbility to engage customers at all levels of the organization, from the C-suite to the newest intern, and meet them where they are to assist in fulfilling their business needsStrong analytical and product management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirementsExperience leading and executing within an Agile project methodologyExtremely influential with a proven track record of successfully navigating organizations through change effortsAbility to quickly establish relationships and earn the trust/respect of clients.Strong leadership attributes with a fearless approach to ambiguous situations, able to mediate conflicts -recognize options - propose and implement solutionsBusiness Analysis certification and IT Service Management experience a plusProcess improvement/optimization experience or certificates a plusEncouraging a healthy work/life balance and providing our colleagues great benefits are just part of what makes Concurrency a great place to work. Concurrency full-time employees receive complete and competitive benefits. We offer a collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, generous work/life opportunities and an comprehensive benefits package that includes paid time off plus holidays. In addition, all colleagues are eligible for a number of rewards and recognition programs, excellent training program and bonus opportunities.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: As a Business Analyst at Advicent, you will assist Product Management with information gathering, research and analysis to be used when bringing new capabilities for the market. This includes performing deep dive investigation on critical subject areas and then reporting back to stakeholders with informed guidance that will shape product requirements and go-to-market planning in a manner that will allow Advicent to deliver best in class business solutions to our partners. Duties Assisting Product Management & Market Research teams with business case development and roadmap planning.Research features, functions and capabilities of the U.S. financial planning market that are essential to delivering a best in class experience for our partners, advisors and their clients.Keep current on industry and technology trends including but not limited to tax code updates and regulatory changes, and share this information with the Business Analyst team.Assist product management to understand how industry trends, competitive headwinds, and adjacent market dynamics impact the advisor experience using Advicent products.Leading product feature discussions with users of the software in conference settings, tradeshows, and other industry events and one-on-one settings.Communicate project information to internal stakeholders (Product Director, management) ensuring the business and user needs driving the release are understood and prioritized appropriately.Gather and possess knowledge of competitors as applicable by product to help identify opportunities and threats.Identify project impacts to internal business processes and strategic initiatives, not just the current project plan.Effectively communicate (verbal and written) and interact professionally with all members of project teams building strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders (customers, project team, PSO department, management).Present requirements using a variety of techniques as appropriate.Assist with vendor and tool analysis to recommend new technology solutions.Demonstrate strong prioritization skills and ability to multi-task between multiple projects.Work as a liaison between technical and business stakeholders to elicit, analyze, communicate, and validate requirements for changes to Advicent products and business processes.Collaborate with both the product development team, business units, and customers to translate business requirements into artifacts used to drive conceptual designs and development of application solutions.Support all of the functions of the Business Analyst position including participating in development projects as a business analyst when needed. Skills/Requirements Bachelor's degree in business, computer science, information science, information systems, or related area, or equivalent experience in a Business Analyst roleAt least 2 plus years of experience in a Business Analyst role with various types of projects resulting in success.Finance industry experience preferableStrong interviewing, analytical, and facilitation skillsSolid understanding of all phases of the software development cycleStrong analytical skills with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasksStrong verbal and written communication skillsSolid understanding of requirements gathering best practicesAbility to actively listen to business needs and translate them into specifications for customers in the insurance industryExcellent oral communications and interpersonal skills and a strong desire to learn and grow, both professionally and personally in ways that will enhance job performanceFamiliarity with the .NET application development platform and project management skills, a plusFamiliarity with SCRM Agile development practices is a plus.

Name: Supply Chain Business Analyst
Description: What you will love about Johnson Controls: We've been dedicated to protecting the environment since our invention of the electric thermostat in 1885, which provided a fundamental shift in the energy efficiency of buildings. Now, all over the world, our products and services employer customers and communities to consume less energy and conserve resources.Global, innovative, industry leader#70 on Fortune’s most admired companies listEmbraces diversityGrowth opportunities abound Fast paced, evolving company, always learning, always adaptingGreat benefits; including Healthcare related wellness discounts, great 401k match, company funded retirement program, vacation, sick time, floating holidays and national holidayWhat you will do:Supports the Fire Suppression Products Materials and Planning Organization to acquire and standardize data, develop and generate managerial reports, and functions as the key user for ERP, Business Intelligence, Forecasting, and Collaboration tools.Process lead for tools and systems supporting the planning and execution of Supply Chain activities within Fire Suppression Products. In addition to specific processes, the Supply Chain Business Analyst supports coordination of data mapping from MRP and Advanced Planning Systems/Forecasting tools and will be a contact point with IT on the business process adherence for system enhancements. How you will do it:Under general direction, provides technical expertise for overall data and analytics as well as relevant IT Systems and modules to support business processes to help meet target customer service levels and optimize inventory levels and delivery performance for the PBU. Support standardization for Delivery and Inventory processes with standardized best practices and tools. Supports overall multi and single site efforts to assure consistent, economical, and timely flow material to support the manufacturing efforts.Lead definition of business processes and tools to acquire and manage relevant Supply Chain data. Normalizing, aggregating, disaggregating, and prorating data from multiple ERP and source systems into standardized reports and downstream tools. Determine critical materials data capabilities needed to support business objectives in the area of Materials and Planning; and define processes required to enable those capabilities. Responsible to drive standardization of those processes across multiple plants and businesses. Objective is optimize inventory, delivery, and planning while meeting customer service levels, balanced with efficient manufacturing operations. Engage key subject matter experts across the business from other disciplines to ensure defined business processes meet the needs of each organization. Identify and secure approval of key business leaders and stakeholders for business processes and scope of work.Interact with Sales & Operations Planning team members to review interaction with other key processes that interact with production scheduling and supplier scheduling, including demand management/forecasting, customer order management, and other applications.Document business processes, including guidance required to ensure a consistent application across the global business. Develop material to support training. Define specific business roles that require training. Train business leaders and super users on business processes, ensuring use of standard processes. Support IT colleagues in development of material to effectively train business users.Ability to interact with global teams to develop data analytics and facilitate interaction with business teams within a supply chain.Maintains effective working relationship and communication with plant personnel, and operations support organization.Travel up to 10> of the timeWhat we look for:Bachelor’s degree (preferably in supply chain management, industrial engineering, or computer science) with three (3) to six (6) years experience in a manufacturing environment or a supporting role for Materials, Manufacturing, or Distribution (e.g., materials management, scheduling, continuous improvement, warehousing). APICS CPIM Certification preferred from individuals taking this role.Understanding of manufacturing operations, MRP systems and the data to drive change in a manufacturing environment, across levels in the organization and extending to internal and external partners, is critical. Ability to understand and clarify business needs and develop processes that achieve business objectives is a must. Proficient knowledge of MRP, Advanced Planning Systems, Business Intelligence tools, and Database Systems is required. Experience helping design and document processes, including implementing supporting IT tools, preferred. Experience in Materials Management or Production Scheduling from manufacturing perspective preferred. Knowledge of and experience working with multi-site operations also preferred. Johnson Controls is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information, please view EEO is the Law. If you are an individual with a disability and you require an accommodation during the application process, please visit www.johnsoncontrols.com/tomorrowneedsyou.

Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: Baird Position Title: IT Business Analyst  28-Oct-2018 Department IT-Project Services  {"QuestionName":"Job Description","AnswerValue":"Are you driven to build a reputation as a trusted IT advisor working closely with the entire organization? To drive mission critical business processes and decisions? Want to contribute to a growing financial services firm who values IT as a partner to the business? Keep reading…  As we continue to grow and add top talent to the Baird IT family, we are always looking for talented Business Analysts to join our team in our downtown Milwaukee headquarters. Our Business Analysts work collaboratively with cross-functional team members to perform analysis around/for projects and serve as a conduit in delivering quality results. We offer a collaborative culture with a continuous learning, agile/lean environment and adding value to the Baird business. We typically have a variety of BA openings across our portfolios, and are always looking for talented team members. As an IT Business Analyst, you will: Analyze and Develop Solutions – think about it! Independently elicit requirements by the use of interviews, workflow analysis, requirements workshops, and surveys to provide business process descriptions, business requirements, use cases, and user stories.Collaborate with project team members (developers, architects, product owners) to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.Perform analysis of potential solutions against business requirements and financial impact to identify the best solution for the business.Actively engages with the client community (internal and external) throughout all stages of project lifecycle, including business requirement elicitation through implementation. Test and Troubleshoot – focus on quality! Supports quality assurance through test plan and/or script creation, QA team collaboration, and project team validation.Act as a facilitator for UAT (User Acceptance Testing) with the client, third party vendors or other testers that use the product, leveraging acceptance criteria defined with the business partner. Collaborate - build relationships! Consult and develop relationships with all client personnel that foster closer ties between the business and Information Technology department.Continually seeks opportunities to increase client satisfaction and deepen client relationships. Project Execution – get it done! Assists project managers in defining project milestones, based on business need, requirements, and defined solution.As needed, facilitates project management role on small projects, ensuring the right capabilities are encompassed in the project team and scope.What makes this opportunity great:Ability to work on critical projects with a variety of teams and leaders, proving your ability to influence and make business impact through providing technology solutionsInformation technology is a core part of Baird’s business strategy and plays a critical role in the growth and transformation of the firm.Computer World Best Company to Work For with collaborative culture that values diverse backgrounds and perspectives while emphasizing teamwork and a strong sense of partnership.Team of associates passionate about achieving great results for clients and give back to the communities where we live and workWhat we look for:A minimum of five (5) years of prior IT experience, including at least three (3) years related BA experience.A college degree, ideally a B.S. in Computer Science, MIS, Business Administration, or Finance is preferred, but equivalent experience is considered too.Experience, comfort level and success working in agile environmentStrong experience with writing business requirements, use cases and user storiesThorough working knowledge of Microsoft Office is required.Strong communication and collaboration skills, ability to influence without authority.Detail oriented and possess exceptional organizational, time management, and problem solving skills.Motivated by small quick wins and process improvementWho we are: Baird is an employee owned, international wealth management, capital markets, private equity and asset management firm with more than 100 offices in the United States, Europe and Asia. Established in 1919, Baird has over $200 billion in client assets and more than 3,400 associates serving the needs of individual, corporate, institutional and municipal clients.  Baird has built an environment of trust, respect and teamwork, where associates are our greatest asset. As stated in our Associate Promise, we are passionate about how we achieve great outcomes together for our clients, communities and each other. Committed to being a great place to work, Baird ranked No. 12 on the Fortune magazine 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2018, our fifteenth consecutive year on the list.Baird has also received a perfect score on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation’s 2018 Corporate Equality Index. To learn more about Baird’s culture, click here.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob #: 913658  Our great Fortune 500 client has an immediate opening for a Business Analyst within Milwaukee, WI. Interested candidates should apply with updated resume to dlindstrum@apexsystems.com Job Summary:  Conduct various types of research and analysis to support business operations of an internal business segment, division, group or line of business. Assist management in resolving business issues in an effective and productive manner. Design, document and re-engineer business processes and publish business metrics results. Strong financial industry experience required. General Duties & Responsibilities:Performs analyses of the business goals, objectives and needs of the general business environment for appropriate segment, division, group or line of business.Performs research and analysis to support business operations and presents findings to manager or project leader.Plans and designs business processes and make recommendations and changes in order to improve and support business systems and activities and/or to deliver greater effectiveness and efficiency.Utilizes systems and data to resolve business issues in the most effective and productive manner.Identifies and implements best practices and suggests how to improve current practices.Calculates/estimates costs and benefits of alternative actions or solutions to establish their viability/return on investment.Develops recommendations to solve problems and issues related to business operations.Analyzes and documents business processes and metrics and identifies improvement opportunities.May train internal employees on changes to business practices, processes or procedures.May perform special projects upon request and on occasion.May provide coaching and/or guidance to less experienced Business Analysts.Other related duties assigned as needed. EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: A Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, Information Systems or the equivalent combination of education, training, and work experience. GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:Knowledge of financial services industryKnowledge of basic financial analysis principles and ratiosProficiency in standard office software, such as MS Office, Visio, MS Access, etc.Excellent verbal and written communication skills to audiences of various levels in the organization (e.g., executive, management, individual contributors)Willingly shares relevant knowledge and expertise to other resourcesExcellent analytical, decision-making, problem-solving, interpersonal, team, customer service, negotiation, conflict management and time management skillsAbility to estimate work effort for project sub-plans or small projects and ensure the project is successfully completedIs resourceful and proactive in gathering information and sharing ideas EEO EmployerApex is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at 844-463-6178A Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, Information Systems or the equivalent combination of education, training, and work experience. GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES: * Knowledge of financial services industry * Knowledge of basic financial analysis principles and ratios * Proficiency in standard office software, such as MS Office, Visio, MS Access, etc. * Excellent verbal and written communication skills to audiences of various levels in the organization (e.g., executive, management, individual contributors) * Willingly shares relevant knowledge and expertise to other resources * Excellent analytical, decision-making, problem-solving, interpersonal, team, customer service, negotiation, conflict management and time management skills * Ability to estimate work effort for project sub-plans or small projects and ensure the project is successfully completed * Is resourceful and proactive in gathering information and sharing ideas

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Duration: 12months Description: Job Description - Princpal Duties: Utilize requirements and system analysis techniques to evaluate business problems (i.e. interviews, workshops, site visits, shadowing, requirements elicitation sessions, etc.).  Facilitate and provide leadership during requirements elicitation & validation sessions, in conjunction with appropriate partners such as: Product Managers, User Experience, etc.  Manage the real needs of the project stakeholders, including customers and end users.  Define, develop, and manage the needed collateral and artifacts (such as workflows, use cases, user stories, business rules, etc.) for the team to consume during product development.  Ensure the "right amount of detail is provided for the "What's to maximize the Business Value delivered by the SCRUM Team(s). Understand and effectively communicate the "Why's behind the "What's to provide the context for the requirements and facilitate better decisions.  Identify requirement dependencies between Products/Features.  Work collaboratively with Architects, Engineering Technical Leads, Project Teams, and the Business to evaluate technology solutions, and to ensure conceptual solutions meet all requirements and desired outcomes.  Help outline acceptance tests and measurements for 'done-ness'.  In collaboration with necessary partners such as: Engineering Technical Leads, and Architecture, assist in the identification of the necessary Architecture Epics, Non-Functional Requirements (NFR), and Technical Debt needed to enable the success of the Product/Feature. Ensure alignment of the Technical and Architectural runway with the Product/Feature vision/roadmap.  Identify requirement dependencies between Products/Features.  Ensure the Products/Features meet the business needs and requirements (Acceptance Test). Desired Skills and Experience - Qualification: Bachelor Degree in Engineering, or a closely related discipline to be determined by business needs or equivalent technical experience.  Current technical knowledge and skills relative to business requirements and state of the art information technologies.  Excellent analytical, interpersonal, and communication skills with strong problem solving abilities; ability to work effectively with people even under difficult circumstances. Proven ability to work with employees at all levels.  Follows through on commitments.  Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment and the ability to work collaboratively with user, development, and support groups. Builds collaborative relationships and contributes to the efforts and accomplishments of individuals and teams throughout the JCI organization  Skill 1 : PTC Windchill, PTC Inservice  Skill 2: Agile/Requirements Management  Key Skills: PTC Windchill, PTC Inservice, Agile/Requirements Management

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Company Description:Rite-Hite is the global leader in the manufacture and distribution of industrial loading dock and door equipment. Our innovative products and world class sales organization ensure solid, consistent growth, both for our company and our staff. We are always looking ahead to develop innovative new products and services to improve our customers' safety, security, and productivity. To continue our growth, we have an excellent opportunity for an Business Analyst at our Corporate office in Milwaukee, WI. Job Description is attached below.Job Description:As a Rite-Hite Business Analyst, be the lead and subject matter expert on one assigned business process area within the global ERP team. This may include manufacturing, distribution, or financial processes on our global Oracle JD Edwards EnterpriseOne platform. The foundation of this position is to be the subject matter expert for the assigned system applications area, as well as ancillary supporting software and integration thereof. This includes providing a thorough and solid understanding of the system's capabilities, features and functionality, and staying abreast of additional features and functionality of the software as new releases are introduced. You will facilitate the development of a project plan, business cases, and functional design specifications in conjunction with the V.P. Information Services, business unit staff, and IT staff assigned to projects, contributing to measurable benefits and ensuring that implementations do not disrupt ongoing business activities.Position Requirements:This position requires a 4-year degree in business, IT, or a related field, and a minimum of five year's experience; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.Experience with Oracle JD Edwards EnterpriseOne platform greatly preferred. The incumbent must possess excellent analytical skills in addition to excellent verbal and communication skills, as well as the ability to manage your time effectively. Some (up to 10%) domestic and international travel may be required.We Offer:In return for your skills and hard work, Rite-Hite offers competitive pay with annual merit reviews, a comprehensive benefits program (medical, dental, vision, disability and life coverage), and a retirement program with a 401(K) that includes a company match and profit sharing. We also provide excellent continuing education and ample opportunity for advancement.  Rite-Hite is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer offering a drug free workplace for our customers and employees.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Description: The primary responsibility will be to define, document, implement new processes, complete critical work already in progress related to new projects and to support the transition of workload to other staff members.  AMI Operations Business Process Analysts are responsible for providing analytical support within AMI Operations and Meter to Bill Process by executing tactical and strategic goals, supporting changes in policy, regulation and strategy and for being the change agent for process, procedure, and/or program modifications.  The Business Process Analyst is a leadership role that provides support, leadership, direction and assistance to junior staff. Lead process improvement efforts. Ensure projects/efforts are properly administered.Approach assignments from a system perspective by evaluating the effect of an initiative not only from AMI operations perspective but utilizing knowledge and experience of Customer Service, Regulatory, other business units and supporting computer systems (i.e. systems thinking approach).Understand data flows and how multiple systems are configured and work together to support business processes end to end.Create supportive document and training materials to be used as an aid during transition of support of processes.Participate in the development, maintenance, communication and execution of the Meter to Bill Process plan.Act as PMO Liaison to specific assigned projects to help ensure success Provide mentoring and oversight to certain project roles (e.g., Project Manager, Business Analyst, Testing Coordinator) Evaluate and interpret new or revised regulation in the form of tariffs, contracts, or rules and regulations issued by the PSC Wisconsin, PSC Michigan or FERC as well as other legal regulations issued by state or federal government. Identifies and communicates the process, procedure, policy and/or program changes necessary to implement new regulation.Utilize Continuous Improvement, Resource Planning and Training to acquire metrics and to determine best format/methodologies to improve efficiencies of teams and control work.QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS Bachelor's degrees – Business/accounting, MIS or related field and 3-5 years' experience in an occupation requiring analysis of process, procedure, and/or systems including at least 2 years' experience in Customer Service. Previous experience leading diverse teams of people with increasing level of responsibility in the past few years and the ability to anticipate and understand needs of internal as well as external customers. Knowledge of gas, electric and steam utility industry. PREFERRED SKILLS Candidates must possess proven project management, communication, planning and organizing, budgeting and business acumen skills; as well as problem solving leadership and decision making abilities. Understanding of CS software applications and system development is preferred. Experience using standard desktop tools, Outlook, Intranet, Internet and Microsoft products suite is also required.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: My Client in the greater Milwaukee, WI area is currently looking for a Business Analyst to join their team. Candidates must be able to interview in person in the Milwaukee, WI area and have experience with Property and Casualty insurance experience. Business Analyst This team is responsible for system enhancements to their current mainframe and web-based applications. The business analyst will work with the project team to capture and clarify requirements, assist with testing as needed, and manage and facilitate user acceptance testing with business users. ResponsibilitiesUnder minimal supervision, perform business analysis efforts including eliciting, analyzing, documenting and communicating the business needs based on input and direction from subject matter experts.Works with leadership to create buy-in on the deliverables and approach.Works collaboratively with project team to effectively support delivery of quality solutions.Plans and facilitates BA requirement review sessions.Interacts with architecture, security, infrastructure, developers and testing team members to provide requirements clarifications throughout project lifecycleWork with testing team members to ensure requirements coverage within test cases and plan model office testing of impacted processes.Assists with testing as needed.Participates in the resolution of defects.Facilitates user acceptance testing and defect management process.Required Skills & QualificationsExcellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skillsMust be able to work independently and effectively with limited guidanceMust also be able to work within a defined team structure that requires consistent communication4 - 7 years of relevant BA experienceStrong problem management, facilitation and organizational skillsExperience in crafting and eliciting measurable requirementsBachelor's degreeExperience executing medium to large complex projects on BA activities Beacon Hill Staffing Group is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: We are hiring a Business Analyst (3-5 years experience) to join our team. The Business Analyst will work within a single project team alongside other various roles (Consultant, Solution Architect, Developer, Project Coordinator, etc.). Your main tasks will include performing detailed requirements analysis, documenting business or technical processes, and performing system testing. You will also liaise with the project team and customers to ensure requirements understanding and transparency. To succeed in this role you should have a natural, analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users and should possess strong previous business and project management background, and have sufficient IT background to understand technology and the customers environmentPrimary Responsibilities: Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement. Performing requirements analysis. Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts. Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management. Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings. Working closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff. Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements. Creating test plans and performing baseline quality assurance testing for customers. Updating, implementing and maintaining procedures. Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements. Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users. Managing competing resources and priorities. Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion. Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems. Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies. All other duties as defined and assignedCandidate Profile:Personality: Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, subject matter experts, and developers Energetic self-starter who is able to work well both in a small team and independently Ability to work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment Willingness to take and be accountable for risks Ability to think analytically and solve problemsSpecific Job Skills:Working knowledge of CRM applications, such as Salesforce (3+ years) A solid understanding of project and software development lifecycles, including software development methodologies (e.g., Kanban). A familiarity with, and understanding of, popular software issue tracking systems, such as Atlassian JIRA. Ability to collaborate with multiple different business units within an organization, document the requirements of each unit, and produce a plan for successful project delivery.Qualifications: Preferred Bachelors degree coupled with 2+ years of business analysis experience, or equivalent software experience Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills. The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions. Excellent documentation skills. Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills. Competency in business applications including Word, Excel, and Visio. A track record of following through on commitments. Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.

Name: Business Process Analyst 1
Description: Job DescriptionAt IQVIA, we look for the very best people, and then give them meaningful work to do. We don’t simply think about careers, we think about contributions.  Those who choose to work with us are joining a recognized global leader — a company uniquely positioned to help clients make the most of market opportunities and respond to challenges that affect global healthcare. We’re committed to blending industry expertise and advanced technology to deliver the most accurate perspectives and in-depth analytics on healthcare dynamics.  To join IQVIA means you’ll be part of a worldwide organization where one person can make a difference, and where collaboration and innovation rule. Our people are creative and client-focused. They are among the best and brightest in the industry. And they bring a broad range of expertise to the table. Our people are analysts, statisticians, software engineers, consultants, sales leaders, marketing and product managers, and more. The key to our success is our people, whose experience, talent, commitment and diversity set the standard for the health information industry. Role Summary: In this role you will develop the skills necessary to complete the evaluation and validation of data, calculate rebates, and quantify your findings. You will also build and enhance your interpersonal skills that are necessary to build effective business relationships with your clients. Those skills are pertinent because as an analyst, you will be responsible for multiple accounts and processes and be responsible for the quality and efficiency of complex tasks. Responsibilities: Evaluates data by searching for trends and understanding the financial terms of the contracts.  Analyze contracts and other documents, perform quality assurance checks on data, and communicate effectively both orally and in writing with a customer.  Research and resolve Chargeback claims.  Ensure accurate and appropriate responses to disputes.  Validate appropriate data from internal and third-party systems and ensure appropriate course of action is being pursued.  Track job completion and manage deadlines.  Provides support to team members.  Assists with training projects.  Minimum Education, Experience, & Specialized Knowledge Required:  Bachelor Degree in finance, business, statistics, math or related area or equivalent work experience required (1-2 years).  Possess strong computer capabilities including word processing, spreadsheet and database entry. (Word, Excel, SQL)  Possess strong inter-personal communication skills, both verbal and written.  Possess strong analytical, organizational and problem solving skills.  Participates productively as a member of team and completes tasks beyond general support level.  Identifies, prioritizes and resolves issues independently, and escalates more complex questions or issues appropriately.  Ability to manage tasks and assignments without detailed direction.  Complies with contract requirements, business unit rules and related and legal regulations  Experience with the following is preferred but not required:  Chargeback Adjudication  Membership and Eligibility determinations  Prescription Rebate Processing  Pharmacy Benefit Management  Managed Health Care  Medicaid Drug Rebate Program  Why join the IQVIA team?  Comprehensive Benefits and Perks - health, dental, vision, HSA, PTO and paid holidays, flexible scheduling, 401K employer match, casual dress, free covered parking, free coffee and tea beverages.  Company Culture – Collaborative and innovative environment where you are recognized for your performance.  Professional Development - onboarding training, advancement potential, cross-functional project opportunities, tuition reimbursement  IQVIA is an EEO Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled  We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve human health outcomes.  Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there!  We invite you to join IQVIA™.  #LI-AW1

Name: Business Analyst Intern
Description: Summer Intern Program - June 3 through August 9What is the position?FIS is looking for a Business Analyst to join our community core Professional Services team. This is an exciting opportunity for someone who likes to contribute new ideas and is willing to put in the work to build their career. While desired, previous business analyst experience is not required. What is required is a “can do” attitude and enthusiasm. If you have banking and/or analyst experience this is a great opportunity to put that to work implementing products and services for FIS.This individual will work to implement various core ancillary products for FIS clients. The candidate must be comfortable working independently and in a team environment. The analyst in this position works closely with project managers, programmers and other team members to implement the various products and services that FIS offers. The ideal candidate:Is looking to join our team and build a long-term career with FIS.Has excellent written and verbal communication skills.Implements projects delivered on time and within budget.Enjoys collaborating with others.Understands the banking industry.Pursuing a bachelor’s degree from a 4yr accredited universityGP 3.0+Rising senior graduating in December 2019 through May 2020General duties and responsibilities:Formulates and defines system scope and objectives through research and fact-finding combined with an understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements.Includes analysis of business and user needs, documentation of requirements, and translation into proper system requirement specifications.Collaborates with business partners and service providers across multiple business units in FIS.Analyzes marketplace, industry, company, technology trends and best practices, vendor products and services, etc.Analyzes and documents business processes and metrics, identifies improvement opportunities.Calculates/estimates level of effort and costs for custom project work.Writes test plans and test cases to ensure changes which are made to the application meet client needs and that application integrity is maintained.Conducts a variety of tests such as system, integration, readiness, and acceptance tests. Ensures that the changes made by programmers are correct. Conducts tests using client data to be certain client needs will be met. Verifies through testing that changes made by programmers to one part of the application do not impact other parts. Reports and reviews testing results.Trains internal employees or external clients on changes, new systems or new procedures.May mentor, guide, advise and or check the work of less experienced analysts.Considers the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment.Performs other related duties as required.What we expect from you?You learn quickly. You gather requirements, analyze data, and create clear specifications for our programming team for custom development projects.You know how to plan your time wisely, work efficiently and hold yourself to a high-quality standard, striving to turn over error-free projects.As part of our professional services team, you will work with experienced professionals to analyze, test and install FIS products and services.If you enjoy learning from a variety of team members, developing new ways to enhance existing processes, are driven by real-world applications and are looking for a great place to grow your career - we want to hear from you! We are looking for smart, driven and dedicated team members to join our team.What can you expect from us?At FIS we value new ideas and we pride ourselves on providing a wide-range of opportunities for professional growth in a face-paced environment. FIS offers an open minded collaborative culture with enthusiastic technologists. A true partner. We are dedicated to our team members and our customers equally. We strive to create an environment to help you succeed. We also offer continued education on the banking industry, the latest in banking technology, host systems and other related areas.
