Name: Business Analyst - Physician Compensation
Description: How You'll Make a Difference: This role is an integral part of our growing Physician Compensation team. This position will provide technical database management to improve and streamline processes; as well as improve operational functions. Will help facilitate needed change to improve accuracy and efficiency. Major Responsibilities • Participate in the administration of physician compensation including contract administration, compensation calculations and payroll related compensation administration. Assists in the preparation of physician compensation calculations, accrual and budget reports.  • Assists in the design and preparation of monthly accruals, annual budget, forecasts, variances and proformas, adhering to the department standards for productivity and quality.  • Lead in the development and maintenance databases for all areas of physician compensation; including the creation of tables, forms, queries, reports, and modules.  • Partner with department managers and analysts to collaborate on physician compensation suggesting and implementing process improvements.  • Partner with department managers and analysts to implement internal controls necessary to ensure the integrity of physician compensation data.  • Document new processes and procedures and train end users. What it Will Take:Licenses & Certifications None Required. Degrees Bachelor's Degree in Business or related field. Required Functional Experience Typically requires 3 years data management experience, including project management; health care or related industry experience preferred. Advanced skills in ACCESS table, query, form and report design, VBA, SQL and Excel is required. General knowledge of electronic health record such as Epic is a plus. Prior experience working with large amounts of highly matrixed data highly preferred. Must be organized and possess time management skills. Ability to prioritize and manage workload and meet all scheduled deadlines. Excellent listening, verbal, and written communication skills. Ability to communicate with all levels within the organization; including senior management, physicians, administrators, managers and peers. Ability to work both independently and as part of a team. Scheduled Hours: 1st Shift Department: Medical Group Physician Comp Location Address: 7800 N 113th St  Milwaukee, WI  53224-3136  Milwaukee At Aurora Health Care: We pride ourselves on taking care of our people. And not just our patients—we mean you, too. We help each other live well. When you work at Aurora, you get the chance to work with a dedicated team that’s as passionate about the work as you are. Here, you’ll find limitless opportunities for ongoing learning, career advancement, competitive compensation and a stable work environment. But more than that, you have the opportunity to change lives—including your own.  Diversity and inclusion matters at Aurora. We celebrate our differences and nurture an environment where everyone feels included. We know that when we reflect the communities we serve, when we embrace differences and bring our whole selves to work every day, we are working as one to build a healthier tomorrow for everyone. Aurora supports a safe, healthy and drug-free work environment through criminal background checks and pre-employment drug testing. We maintain a smoke-free environment at all our locations. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Business Analyst II
Description: Responsible for working with clients and vendor to gather business requirements and translating those into system requirements that can be implemented by the technical team. Validating updated system to ensure requirements were implemented correctly. Following up on issues reported to determine if they are defects or enhancement requests and documenting the changes needed appropriately. Ideally need a candidate with IBS experience but not mandatory  Conducting system demos for prospective and existing clients to communicate system capabilities and support sales activities. Participation in trade shows to support sales activities may also be required.  Conduct various types of research and analysis to support business operations of an internal business segment, division, group or line of business. Assist management in resolving business issues in an effective and productive manner. Design, document and re-engineer business processes and publish business metrics results.  Note: Please check this job carefully to ensure it is the appropriate match. Assign employees who provide business systems analysis for internal or client-facing projects to the Business Systems Analyst job. Assign employees who conduct software quality assurance/testing to the Software Quality Analyst. Assign employees who provide product support to the Product Support Representative job. This job should be used for employees who support general management for an FIS business segment, division, group or line of business.  General Duties & Responsibilities  • Performs analyses of the business goals, objectives and needs of the general business environment for appropriate FIS segment, division, group or line of business.  • Performs research and analysis to support business operations and presents findings to manager or project leader.  • Plans and designs business processes and make recommendations and changes in order to improve and support business systems and activities and/or to deliver greater effectiveness and efficiency.  • Utilizes systems and data to resolve business issues in the most effective and productive manner.  • Identifies and implements best practices and suggests how to improve current practices.  • Calculates/estimates costs and benefits of alternative actions or solutions to establish their viability/return on investment.  • Develops recommendations to solve problems and issues related to business operations.  • Analyzes and documents business processes and metrics and identifies improvement opportunities.  • May train internal employees on changes to business practices, processes or procedures.  • May perform special projects upon request and on occasion.  • May provide coaching and/or guidance to less experienced Business Analysts.  • Other related duties assigned as needed.  Educational Requirements  Bachelor’s degree in business administration, finance, computer science or information systems or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.  General Knowledge, Skills & Abilities  • Knowledge of FIS’ products and services  • Knowledge of the business goals, objectives and business operations for the appropriate FIS organization  • Knowledge of financial services industry  • Knowledge of basic financial analysis principles and ratios  • Proficiency in standard office software, such as MS Office, Visio, MS Access, etc.  • Proficiency in industry-standard process methodologies, e.g., Six Sigma, LEAN, ISO, CMM, etc.  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills to audiences of various levels in the organization, e.g., executive, management, individual contributors  • Willingly shares relevant knowledge and expertise to other resources

Name: Jr. Business Analyst
Description: Role: Junior Business AnalystJob Summary One of our highly respected client is currently seeking a highly motivated and qualified Business Analyst to join a dynamic team responsible for ensuring the quality of important and highly visible projects. Helps implement customer-centric solutions (web, mobile and call center applications) in a cost-effective way by learning and comprehending business process, eliciting and documenting requirements, and communicating clearly to business and technology. This role requires a level of energy and assertiveness to drive work with multiple groups in a complex, busy environment. The successful candidate will possess experience with full life-cycle application development along with exposure to evaluating, coordinating and creating deliverables; meeting with customers and resolving issues. The role works across functional boundaries to connect-the-dots between IT department products and services. Responsibilities:Support the design and development of both custom and core product features.Understand the business need & gather requirements from clients.Analyze requirements and prepare different use cases and user stories.Develop one or more solution alternativesReview of solution(s) with stakeholders.Prepare Requirement & Solution DocumentExplain requirements to technical teamAssist in UAT.Travel to work at client sites.Skills Required:This person should have technical experience / Knowledge in API Mapping and Design.Knowledge/experience with Confluence, JIRA, technical writing, diagramming, SQL, and XML.Strong communication skills, must be able to communicate with technical and non-technical parties.Ability to work independently as well as collaborate with others.Strong project and time management skills.Ability to analyze current systems/requirements and develop strategies for systems development.Can assist in defining projects, effort and staff requirements.Technical Skills:Experience using Axure Pro/ MS Visio/ Pencil to prepare Wireframes.Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams.Basic Requirement:Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams

Name: Business Analyst/Product Manager
Description: Job DescriptionBUSINESS ANALYST / PRODUCT MANAGER - MIDWHO IS SPR? SPR is a digital technology consultancy that develops elegant solutions to transform the way people do business. We’re 300+ strategists, developers, designers, architects, consultants, thinkers, and doers in Chicago and Milwaukee. We work with 160 clients in 10 unique industries – everything from corporate finance and global logistics to local breweries and Chicago startups.  We think about the end users and rigorously apply the latest technologies and frameworks to address our clients’ needs. We enable companies to do more with data, engage with other people, build disruptive solutions, and operate productively. To do this, we hire smart technologists and sharp business leaders who are excellent communicators and have an interest in working on multiple projects across industries.  SPR offers a great environment for employees to learn, to build systems that make an impact, and to tackle exciting challenges. With our office’s “Maker Space”, you can explore your IoT side and develop fun projects with 3D printing and CNC machining. We operate in a fun, casual work environment and have great benefits including: competitive salary, bonuses, generous vacation time, big fitness incentives, and medical/dental/vision insurance.  By joining the SPR team, you’ll be using your brain, working hard and making an impact through your projects – and you’ll be rewarded for it. WHAT IS THE POSITION? The Business Analyst/ Product Manager - Mid is one who is passionate about building the products customers love and the client is proud to own and market. As the business analyst/product manager, you will be interfacing with the client stakeholders, users and engineers and be the one who knows the clients’ business problems inside and out. Understand the business the client is in and figure out what works and what needs improvementUnderstand the user needs and figure out how to incorporate the user feedback into the business prioritiesAssist senior BA/POs and Designers with facilitating workshops needed to gather requirements, performing user research, and conducting backlog prioritizations to drive towards a common solutionCreate the models and artifacts needed by designers, engineers, and stakeholders to foster shared understanding of the problems and the solutionsTransform the business requirements to a set of actionable user stories for development to consumeBe the trusted partner of the product owner or product manager from the client sideEDUCATION & EXPERIENCEBachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Library Science, History, Anthropology or related field or over 2-3 years’ experience as a Business Analyst, Product Owner, Product Manager or Solutions ArchitectExperience working in environments with competing priorities and agendasShould be a strong communicator and delivery masterAbility to show empathy and be an active listenerStrong problem solverSkills on various business process modelling tools, wireframing tools that are needed to get the job doneExperience in Consulting is a plusExperience on SharePoint, O365, SQL or Power BI projects is a strong plusCompetence with Agile methodology and Agile Analysis/Lean requirements If this sounds like the kind of challenge you would be up for every day, we would love to hear from you.

Name: Business Analyst - ERP Implementation
Description: Job Description We have a local opportunity for a consultant to help our clients HR department with multiple HR module implementations on their NEW ERP suite. The ideal candidate would have a deep track record with HR software platform implementations; full cycle, from vendor interface, to team assignments, to tweaking of the user interface, to production of learning collateral. This role reports to the Human Resources Leadership team and is the technical point-of-contact and business consultant to assist HR subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, design and development of dashboards and reports, report writing and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities. Job Duties/Responsibilities: Participate in the development of overall strategic plan for HR systems,  Serve as 'point person' for the HR divisions on the ERP/HRIS-related project: helping to prioritize, develop, and refine business requirements,  Ensure that all projects are delivering on their stated objectives on time and on budget,  Co-lead with subject matter experts on implementation of new system’s features such as Employee/Manager Self Service, Talent Acquisition, Succession Planning, Performance Management, LMS,  Partner with Vendor Implementation team/IT to troubleshoot and correct system or process issues,  Continually monitor processes and develop appropriate metrics to reflect accuracy and efficiency  Partner with HR Management to continually refine and improve HR system processes in order to maximize efficiency, cost savings, and enable new HR initiatives,  Help manage ERP/HRIS vendor relationships to ensure the services that Milwaukee County receives meet our needs and provide excellent value,  Communicate system changes as needed to ensure all are implementing policies and procedures consistently,  Provide training to Human Resources employees in regards to ERP/HRIS systems and policies and procedures  Develops, monitors, and executes 'ad hoc' and ongoing requests for data to ensure that the workload is appropriate and that the reports are meeting the business needs,  Create 'ad hoc' custom reports based on HR and other departments' needs,  Use experience and best practices to suggest new reports that may be of interest to HR staff and management,  Assure accuracy of all reported data coming out of new systems set-up,  Help troubleshoot issues i.e.: weekly file transfers, unemployment, benefits, and various other vendors  Performs other duties as required and/or assigned  Infor ERP experience is highly desirable, but will accept in-depth knowledge of implementing, optimizing and configuring HR software platforms Required Job Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in related field and minimum 5-7 years of related HR work experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities  Advanced knowledge of and ability in using various software applications  Knowledge of HR principles, practices, and systems  Experience with system configuration, testing, implementation, and administration of HR software platforms  Advanced reporting and analytics experience - provided by Dice  Analyst, Business Analyst, Business Requirements, Development, ERP, Manager, Management, Metrics, Project, Testing, User Interface

Name: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Elavon provides end-to-end payment processing services to merchants and financial institutions in the United States, Brazil, Canada, Mexico, Puerto Rico, and throughout Europe. Our payment products are supported by the most reliable network in the industry and include credit and debit card processing, electronic check services, gift cards, dynamic currency conversion, multi-currency support, and cross-border acquiring. We handle every aspect of the acquiring relationship?transaction processing, risk and underwriting, settlement, equipment deployment, chargeback management, reporting, and customer service. Our customers can also count on us to keep their payment processing compliant with changing payment security requirements.  Elavon employs about 3,600 people located worldwide. Together, we support more than one million clients spread among the retail, restaurant, hospitality, government, healthcare, education, and e-commerce sectors. Elavon utilizes a white-label branding model, and we work with strong partners to market our services through a variety of sales channels, including large financial institutions, community banks, trade associations, government agencies, and ISOs/MSPs. We are the:  + \#1 airline processor  + \#2 hospitality processor  + \#4 U.S. acquirer, based on bank card volume  + \#6 European acquirerElavon?s Global Acquiring Solutions organization is part of U.S. Bank?s Payment Services division. U.S. Bancorp is the fifth-largest commercial bank in the United States.Elavon is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst who enjoys solving business problems. He/she will interact with business stakeholders and technology teams to define requirements, mine data, and provide insights and business recommendations. This role will be measured by timeliness, frequency, and accuracy of insights delivery and their impacts on Elavon business stakeholders assigned. Main responsibilities include:  + Develops executive-level reports and presents complex, customized analytic findings to senior leadership team;  + Delivers actionable and measurable insights that drive business for the organization;  + Analyzes customer behavior and business performance data; and  + Assists in streamlining and broadening the access of analytics to strategic decision makers  + Motivated by driving revenue through data based analytics  _Your Career is Here._ *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications** + Bachelor?s degree in accounting, finance, statistics, engineering, or equivalent experience  + 5 years in an analytical role  + Possess great communication skills and a passion for analysis  + Ability to articulate how data and analysis relates to Key Performance Indicators  + Communication and persuasion skills at the executive level  + Excels at bridging between the customer, relationship management and data  + Understanding of what can be improved by better data and analysis  + Ability to provide stewardship/ evangelism to drive standardization, adoption, and acceptance on an ongoing basis  + Ability to navigate, extract, explore, qualify, and analyze diverse internal and external data  + Experience building multidimensional analysis models  + Experimental/R&D based mindset  + Ability to self-govern Business Intelligence content and analytic environment  + Ability to train and educate others *Preferred Qualifications** + SQL Experience  + Tableau Experience  + Statistical modeling experience in regression, forecasting, and segmentation  + Extensive knowledge of financial analysis concepts and methodologies  + Excellent financial analysis, forecasting, and planning skills *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** Minnesota-MN-Minneapolis*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180042354*Other Locations:** United States U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.  U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: Entry level business analyst
Description: The Business Analysts role is to assist with the plan, design, develop, and launch efficient information systems and operations systems in support of core organizational functions. Using both business and technical skills, the Business Analyst works directly with customers to identify business requirements with sufficient detail and clarity to proposals for solutions. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate and resolve systems issues to maximize the benefit of IT systems investments.  FOR MORE INFORMATION PLEASE CALL: 773 770 6307  Email: denver@staffigo.com  Job Description/Responsibilities:  Learn business processes related to complex accounting application  Gather business and technical requirements for application modifications and enhancements  Assist in testing process through development of test cases and data  Document business process and/or program changes  Works on multiple applications.  Develops innovative and creative output based on interpretation and analysis.  Provides design and documentation at an application or function capability level.  Identifies/documents how applications and systems interact to support business processes.  Assesses, applies and projects the impact of system changes on users and internal and external clients or stakeholders.  Uses knowledge of systems and industry requirements to develop or modify complex information systems.  Writes test plans and test cases to ensure changes which are made to the application meet client needs and that application integrity is maintained.  Conducts a variety of tests such as system, integration, readiness and acceptance tests. Ensures changes made by programmers are correct.  Conducts tests using client data to be certain client needs will be met.  Qualifications:  Masters Degree in Information Technology.  Must have good knowledge in Finance, Banking, Insurance, Retail or Healthcare and/or benefit administration is a plus.  Excellent writing/documentation, communication, analysis and organizational skills required.  Strong aptitude in both business and technology.  Self-starter with excellent organizational and time management skills.  Fast learner, quality consciousness and committed to deadlines.

Name: Federal - Technical Business Analyst
Description: Job descriptionOrganization: Accenture Federal Services  Location: Annapolis Junction, MD Accenture Federal Services, a wholly owned subsidiary of Accenture LLP, is a U.S. company with offices in Arlington, Virginia. Accenture's federal business has served every cabinet-level department and 30 of the largest federal organizations. Accenture Federal Services transforms bold ideas into breakthrough outcomes for clients at defense, intelligence, public safety, civilian and military health organizations.  We believe that great outcomes are everything. It’s what drives us to turn bold ideas into breakthrough solutions. By combining digital technologies with what works across the world’s leading businesses, we use agile approaches to help clients solve their toughest problems fast—the first time. So, you can deliver what matters most. Count on us to help you embrace new ways of working, building for change and put customers at the core. A wholly owned subsidiary of Accenture, we bring over 30 years of experience serving the federal government, including every cabinet-level department. Our 7,200 dedicated colleagues and change makers work with our clients at the heart of the nation’s priorities in defense, intel, public safety, health and civilian to help you make a difference for the people you employ, serve and protect.Our customer is currently defining their enterprise solution within AWS GovCloud and is looking for top talent to help them design, implement, and sustain a world class environment to support the critical mission. If you like to work with a team, in a fast paced environment, working on new technology at the forefront of cyber security, this is the role for you. AFS is looking for individuals to join us to enable our critical customer to exceed their mission goals with a scalable architecture that will support them wherever the fight takes them.  The Technical Business Analyst will be responsible for: Providing technical business analyst support to the development of the core and common services for the client's AWS architectureDocumenting component requirements and designsParticipating in testing of solution componentsWriting security documentationWorking directly with the client to resolve outstanding issues+ Basic qualificationsBasic Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or other technical discipline3 years of IT experienceUS CitizenshipPreferred Qualifications:AWS Certification/ExperienceOther cloud experience such as Azure An active security clearance or the ability to obtain one may be required for this role. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status). Accenture is a Federal Contractor and an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities. Equal Employment Opportunity All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

experience working with CRM systems  + 3-5 years? experience with system testing *Preferred Qualifications** + Excellent analytical, quantitative, and problem solving skills with the proven ability to communicate and influence effectively at various levels of the organization  + Proven leadership skills and ability to lead others in defining requirements and identifying solutions  + In depth knowledge of business operations and processes for multiple businesses  + Sharp focus on achieving results; persists at completing tasks despite challenges; ability to achieve results and navigate through ambiguity  + Well-organized; plans activities and consistently follows up  + Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment  + Proficient in MS Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint  + Salesforce Administrator Certification (or ability to obtain within one year)  + Project management  + Agile methodology  + Sales processes and methodologies  + Six Sigma or other process improvement methodologies  + Financial services industry experience *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** United States*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180038418*Other Locations:** Minnesota-MN-Richfield U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Senior Business Analysts are responsible for interfacing with our clients to define business requirements, work with a technical team to design solutions, and execute the quality assurance and delivery of each solution. This client-facing position will be an integral part of a growing sector in our business, and will play a key role in a variety of projects. Within our organization, Senior Business Analysts are integral members of the solution delivery team, working very closely with the Clients, Product Owners and the Development team to ensure the delivery of a solution that is aligned to the business needs and goals. QUALIFICATIONS:A minimum of ten years overall information technology experience with at least seven years of increased responsibilities within the role of a Business Analyst. Excellent working history with business areas to discover and develop functional and technical requirements for custom application development or business intelligence projects for large custom development initiatives. Ability to develop and document project estimates and assist in budget development.Strong working history of being a key contributor in a Business Analyst role on several robust (10 or more sprints, or project longer than 6 months) greenfield development initiatives. Participated in the full-life cycle of the development initiative. Experience utilizing multiple elicitation processes to document, verify and confirm development requirements.Strong background in aligning functional requirements to technical solutions.Substantial knowledge of use cases development and requirements documentation skills.Understanding and appreciation for the core role quality assurance plays in the Business Analysis process. Strong experience in developing test plans and scripts. Strong requirements gathering and elicitation skills using a variety of methods. Outstanding leadership capabilities. Working knowledge of tools such as Visio, UML or Enterprise Architect is desired. Experience using a project management methodology a plus such as Waterfall, Agile, SCRUM, KANBAN, SAFe.Thorough technical knowledge to enable the development of technical diagrams and source to data maps. Strong background in developing user stories, documentation of happy path and acceptance criteria. Superior communication and analytical skills. Knowledge of Project Management tenants. Experience working with a variety of source control tools such as TFS, JIRA or Subversion. EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATIONS:Candidates should possess a minimum of an Associated Degree, but a Bachelor's is desired.Certifications such as CBAP, Scrum Master, Scrum Product Owner or other agile based certifications is a plus. Senior Business Analysts should possess strong industry domain knowledge in one of the following areas: Healthcare, Financial, Consumer Products or Government, in addition to technical knowledge in the areas of custom application/software product development or Business Intelligence/Information Management.

Name: OEM Business Analyst
Description: Description:Derco Aerospace, Inc., a Lockheed Martin Company, is an industry-leading aerospace distributor of spares, components, and services. Derco is seeking an experienced and self-motivated OEM Business Analyst who is looking for a challenging work environment. Selected individual will be responsible for being the interface between Sales/Business Development and the OEM to promote products and sales initiatives. Daily responsibilities include becoming the primary point of contact for OEMs as well as managing the strategic needs and business opportunities for our OEM partners. The role requires the successful establishment of positive and productive working relationships with assigned OEMs and fostering an environment where Derco is viewed as a progressive, responsive and capable organization in developing new business. The position will demonstrate high levels of integrity and capability consistent of the Derco core values and principles, involve domestic travel and is based at Derco Headquarters, located in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.Founded in 1979, Derco Aerospace, Inc. is a world leader in providing aircraft spares, services, and solutions to customers around the globe. Through solid relationships with premier original equipment manufacturers (OEMs), Derco maintains one of the largest and most diversified aircraft spares inventories in the world. Today, Derco is a full-service logistics and solutions provider, supporting military and commercial fleets in more than 65 countries. Derco is a wholly owned subsidiary of Sikorsky Aircraft Corporation, a subsidiary of Lockheed Martin Corporation (NYSE:LMT) of Bethesda, MD, a Fortune 100 company.  Specific responsibilities include Primary OEM point-of-contact for relationship developmentProduct specialist with technical knowledge to support the OEM/Customer interfaceOEM sales ownerStrategic development of existing OEMsProduct promotion both internal and external stakeholdersContract negotiationMarketing plan managementBCA development for vetting new OEMs or future OEM opportunitiesInternal Sales/Business Development/Supply Chain interface to promote OEM products and sales initiatives Derco is a diverse, forward-thinking, employee-oriented company that promotes personal development and a work life balance. Derco offers a generous compensation package including: competitive pay, bonuses, health, dental, 401K with company match, and continuing education incentives with full tuition reimbursement. Basic Qualifications: Candidates must have a minimum of 7 years experience in the areas of logistics, sales or program management in the aviation industry, specifically in supporting products and services.  Education Requirements: Bachelor of Science degree Desired Skills: Strong leadership and organizational skills Motivated self starterAdvanced data analysis skillsExcellent analytical and presentation skillsExcellent communication skills, both written and verbalAircraft support background and technical understanding of OEM productsAbility to manage multiple prioritiesAttention to detailMicrosoft Office proficiencyAbility to operate in a team environmentExperience in TableauBASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. Theyre dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.  As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Experienced Professional

Name: Business Analyst II-Corporate Intelligence
Description: Associated Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We support a work environment where colleagues are respected and given the opportunity to perform to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors. Applicants with a disability who need assistance applying for a position with Associated Bank are asked to email: colleaguecare@AssociatedBank.com or call: (800) 878-3282. Job Summary Under the general direction of the Business Analyst Manager - Corporate Intelligence, the Business Analyst II - Corporate Intelligence is responsible for partnering with the lines of business to support their reporting, analytical and informational needs. Responsibilities include working directly with colleagues in the business lines to determine requirements, create approved solutions including reports, data analysis, data quality assurance, etc. and maintain ongoing support for those solutions. Additional responsibilities include working with the Corporate Intelligence infrastructure team of Business Intelligence Developers for obtaining required information needs and following the standards and procedures of the Corporate Intelligence department as a whole.  In addition to the above, the Business Analyst II - Corporate Intelligence will be expected to recommend and justify information solutions to all levels of colleagues including senior executives. Additionally, the BA II will go beyond basic report creation and delivery with the ability to analyze large amounts of data and information to determine meaningful insights and professionally communicate those insights to our business partners.  The difference between a technology business analyst and this role is the additional responsibility to take the analytical responsibility further to include implementation of the reporting and analysis of the data back to the business line to drive decisions. Compliance Statement Operates in full compliance with internal policies and procedures as well as applicable regulations and laws, including but not limited to Bank Secrecy Act/Anti-Money Laundering requirements. Responsible to report any procedure or process that doesn’t meet regulatory requirements including fraud, whether suspected or confirmed, to management. This reporting can be done directly to any member of management, including Human Resources or Corporate Security, or can be reported through Associated’s anonymous Ethics Hotline. Key Result AreasInternal Consulting/Facilitation Collaboration Analysis Other Technical skills Communication Special Projects Decision Making Problem Solving Job AccountabilitiesInterface with business line to determine reporting and analytical requirements for assigned work. Document business requirements and process workflow diagrams. Develop information, reporting and analysis to business lines as defined by agreed requirements. Includes creating stored procedures and data sets in SQL, developing report and dashboards following departmental standards and presenting information solution to business users. Partner with Corporate Intelligence infrastructure team to provide requirements for data models and automations to continuously improve the self service business intelligence approach. Discover and communicate meaningful insights in the data and communicate with the line of business users. Develop and present business intelligence insights using variety of tools including Power Point, Tableau, Cognos, etc. Assess impact of larger bank projects on existing Corporate Intelligence outputs by reviewing third party system specifications or requirements changes. Create, execute, document test cases and update reporting to minimize business line impacts.EducationBachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience Financial services industry, Computer Science, Business, Required Experience2-4 years Experience working in a BA or reporting analyst type role., Required 4-7 years 4 years experience providing Business Intelligence and information solutions to senior level management., Preferred SkillsAbility to Multi Task and Prioritize , Intermediate Analytical , Intermediate Computer Systems (specify) SQL, Cognos, Tableau, MS Office, Intermediate Verbal Communication , Intermediate Written Communication , Intermediate Other: Requirements gathering and documentation, Intermediate Other: Relationship building, Intermediate Other: Data Quality Assurance Review, Intermediate General Physical ConditionNo unusual physical effort, strain, or discomfort

Name: Commercial Lending Credit Analyst II
Description: What you should know about the role This position is responsible for evaluating the financial statements and condition of individual and commercial loan members applying for credit. Analyzes complex personal and corporate loan portfolio financial statements for loan risk rating and monitoring purposes on a single loan or relationship basis. Performs timely and accurate annual reviews to monitor credit quality and early identification of deterioration of credit quality. Analyzes such items as income, quality of management, market share, potential risks and collateral appraisal. Prepares loan presentations, which includes credit analysis and a summary of the loan request. What you should know about Advia Advia is a fast growing Credit Union that is positioned in the top 3% of credit unions across the United States with nearly 2 billion in assets. We offer very similar product and services as the big banks with a focus on saving our members money while providing financial advantages. We are rooted in our communities and believe we have a responsibility to give back outside of our four branch walls through volunteering and charitable donations. The work environment at Advia is fast-paced, performance based and fun infused. We certainly live by the saying “work hard, play hard.” As an employee of Advia, you can expect regular and constructive feedback, development opportunities, great benefits, excellent co-workers and engaged managers. As a Commercial Lending Credit Analyst II, you will have opportunities to:Be an important part of a fun, friendly and fast-paced team.Have a variety of responsibilities and projects to keep the job interesting.Be in a position to really help people and make an impact on their lives.Periodically accompany Commercial Lenders on meetings with Commercial Members or at other business development events.Assist in the department in training and sharing knowledge with Commercial Credit Analyst I team members.Assumes responsibility for establishing and maintaining effective communication, coordination, and working relations with Credit Union personnel and with management. This may include coordinating functions with related departments, providing support as needed, keeping management informed of area activities and of any significant problems, attending and participating in meetings and committees as required and completing required reports and records.Assumes responsibility for establishing and maintaining effective and professional business relations with members and trade professionals. Answers questions and resolves requests. This may include assisting department personnel with administrative tasks as needed, and maintaining and protecting the Credit Union’s professional reputation.Utilizes and maintains credit analysis software.Reviews and ensures commercial loan policy compliance throughout the commercial lending process, including the review of various reports and loan approval conditions.Assesses collateral offered and its marketability to make certain the credit relationships meet internal policy guidelines and regulation standards.Underwrites existing and prospective commercial client requests. Tasks consist of analytical review of all financial statements, comparison of the client’s historical financial performance with industry and competitor trends.Works closely with commercial lenders to fully understand the request, establishing and defining credit requirements and risk mitigation to make credit recommendations to the appropriate individual or committee based on credit analysis.Must comply with applicable laws and regulations, including but not limited to, the Bank Secrecy Act, the Patriot Act, and the Office of Foreign Assets Control.Physical Requirements Perform primarily sedentary work with limited physical exertion and occasional lifting of up to 10 lbs. Must be capable of climbing / descending stairs in emergency situation. Must be able to operate routine office equipment including telephone, copier, facsimile, and calculator. Must be able to routinely perform work on computer for an average of 6-8 hours per day, when necessary. Must be able to work extended hours whenever required or requested by management. Must be capable of regular, reliable and timely attendance. Working Conditions Must be able to routinely perform work indoors in climate-controlled shared work area with minimal noise. Mental and/or Emotional Requirements Must be able to perform job functions independently or with limited supervision and work effectively either on own or as part of a team. Must be able to read and carry out various written instructions and follow oral instructions. Must be able to speak clearly and deliver information in a logical and understandable sequence. Must be capable of dealing calmly and professionally with numerous different personalities from diverse cultures at various levels within and outside of the organization and demonstrate highest levels of customer service and discretion when dealing with the public. Must be able to perform responsibilities with composure under the stress of deadlines / requirements for extreme accuracy and quality and/or fast pace. Must be able to effectively handle multiple, simultaneous, and changing priorities. Must be capable of exercising highest level of discretion on both internal and external confidential matters. Acknowledgement Nothing in this position description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This job description is not a contract and should not be construed as a guarantee of employment for any specific period of time. Experience Three to five years of Credit Analysis Experience. Minimum two years of Commercial Lending Experience. Knowledge of Credit Union lending and collections programs, policies, and procedures. Familiarity with property management and maintenance procedures. Suntell credit analysis software experience preferred. SBA experience preferred. Understanding of financial analysis and determination of credit worthiness. The candidate should have a clear understanding of general accounting principles as well as general knowledge of business and economics. An advanced knowledge and understanding of multiple balance sheets and corporate entities with the ability to interpret all forms of financial data and instruments is needed for this role. Strong analytical abilities. Education/Certifications/Licenses Bachelor’s degree in business or a related field, or an equivalent combination of training and work experience. Interpersonal Skills Courtesy and tack are essential elements of the job. Name: Financial Analyst- FP&A
Description: As a Financial Analyst, you will be primarily involved with illuminating business performance implied by financial/quantitative metrics and ad-hoc data analyses and helping establish new, actionable, operating metrics and reports. These core objectives will be met by executing various financial/data analyses and reporting activities at both the business unit and corporate levels. assist them, in conjunction with the Operations team, to develop and measure actionable plansProactively analyze the financial stability (profitability) of individual accounts (clients), identify drivers and make recommendationsSupport business unit managers in developing financial information for RFP & Pricing submissionsAssist in establishing and maintaining various reusable reporting templatesTake an active role in further developing TMPs Financial Reporting and Analysis policies and procedures, producing high quality documentation as neededExecute ad-hoc financial/quantitative analysis and various reporting requests in support of business unit and corporate managersMaintain a working knowledge of current principles and methodologies in financial reporting; profit planning, cost accounting and profitability analysis best-practices as they apply to service organizations Requirements for ConsiderationBS in Finance, Accounting, or related field; an MBA is preferred4-6 years of finance experience, preferably in a services organizationStrong data analysis skills; financial/business modeling experience a plusHigh proficiency in MS Office, particularly with Excel, Access and PowerPointFunctional knowledge of financial reporting systems and methodologies such as Essbase and OracleEffective oral and written communication skills with a strong ability to efficiently communicate financial results to both financially and non-financially oriented personsInitiative; originate productive actions without specific instructions; generate new ideas, processes and approaches to meet business needsWe are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.#GDAccounting

Name: Healthcare Business Analyst
Description: Company Description Integrated Medical Partners (IMP) is a full-service provider of profit-improvement solutions for medical practices. With a nationwide network of practice clients and experience, IMP is an organization that offers a fully integrated suite of business services to its clients, including: revenue cycle management (RCM); analytics & decision support; managed imaging workflow; and strategic positioning & consulting. Position Summary The Healthcare Business Analyst is a customer-facing role which supports IMPs Collaboration Initiative as well as its Revenue Cycle Management operation through data analysis and reporting. The Business Analyst is responsible for supporting standard and custom client data and reporting needs, internal reporting projects and requests, providing training and support for the client reporting application, and engaging with clients and internal users to correctly assess and fully support their current and future Analytics needs. Additionally, the Business Analyst will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of RCM and medical billing, charging, payment and insurance policies and practices. ResponsibilitiesProvide support for both internal and external clients through data analysis and report development/creationSupport Analytics Manger in the development and execution of internal Analytics projectsEngage in interactive conversation with clients to ensure their data/report requests are met in a timely mannerAct proactively to promote additional reporting/data solutions for clients to drive efficiencyDemonstrate understanding of medical billing, charging, payments and insuranceCreate and maintain strong process documentation around reporting solutionsProvide training and support for a team of 100 internal clients and external clients as needed to support the growth of IMPHelp internal clients understand how to use analytics and reporting to drive efficiency and client satisfactionHandle ad hoc client requests which may require importing information outside of Revenue Cycle Management dataSupport business initiatives through new client installations and project plan managementActively participate in daily team meetings providing updates and feedback which contribute to the overall success of the teamFinancial Analysis Support for Executive TeamAdditional Job Duties as assignedBasic Qualifications1-2 years experience in analysis of Revenue Cycle Management financial metrics and forecasting1-2 years experience in a position which required constant client contactExperience working with medical billing, insurance or related fieldStrong presentation skills including verbal and written communicationStrong analytical and problem solving skillsDemonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office suite and ability to learn new technology/applications quicklyDemonstrated organizational and time management skills4-year College Degree or equivalent Ability to work independently with minimal guidance **CANDIDATE MUST BE LOCATED IN THE MILWAUKEE, WI AREA**

Name: Finance Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionA BETTER FUTURE Everything begins with passion, a legacy from the Saputo family, which offered tasty and quality cheeses to its community. Today, after more than 60 years, the company employs more than 12,500 dedicated employees, proud of their role, who work day after day to deliver quality products to customers and consumers.  Saputo is the second largest dairy processor in the US and one of the top ten dairy processors in the world but our people are at the core of everything we do. We promote their growth and well-being through our values: Efficiency through Simplicity, Family Environment, Ownership, Hands-On Approach, and Passion for our work. At Saputo, we hire for careers, not jobs and we strategically place individuals within the organization and provide opportunities for growth across different functions. In addition, promoting healthy lifestyles and community engagement through financial and product contributions, as well as through volunteer hours is core to who we are. But dont take our word for it hear it from our employees. RESPONSIBILITIES:Build and maintain master files of items manufactured and converted for integration into SAP system.Perform cost analysis on various products and labor to ensure pricing accuracy.Various projects to assist the Sales Team in ensuring company profitability.Develop and present costing and pricing analysis to senior leadership.Maintain and manage dairy market distribution.SKU rationalization.Work directly with integration team on pricing and costing for new business.Perform other duties or projects as assigned.Company DescriptionOVERVIEW  Cheese Division (USA)  Through the Cheese Division (USA), Saputo produces, markets and distributes in the USA a variety of cheeses, including a broad line of mozzarella, American-style and specialty cheeses, such as ricotta, provolone, blue, parmesan, goat cheese and romano.  The Company also converts, markets and sells a broad range of specialty cheeses and, moreover, holds an important portfolio of import licences for specialty cheeses manufactured abroad.  Saputo is among the top mozzarella, string cheese, and domestic blue cheese producers in the USA.  As well, Saputo produces, markets and distributes in the USA and on the international market dairy ingredients, including whey powder, whey protein concentrates, lactose and dairy ingredient blends. Products are sold under a variety of the Company’s brand names, as well as under customer brand names.

Name: Business Process Analyst 2
Description: Job DescriptionAt IQVIA, we look for the very best people, and then give them meaningful work to do. We don’t simply think about careers, we think about contributions.  Those who choose to work with us are joining a recognized global leader — a company uniquely positioned to help clients make the most of market opportunities and respond to challenges that affect global healthcare. We’re committed to blending industry expertise and advanced technology to deliver the most accurate perspectives and in-depth analytics on healthcare dynamics.  To join IQVIA means you’ll be part of a worldwide organization where one person can make a difference, and where collaboration and innovation rule. Our people are creative and client-focused. They are among the best and brightest in the industry. And they bring a broad range of expertise to the table. Our people are analysts, statisticians, software engineers, consultants, sales leaders, marketing and product managers, and more. The key to our success is our people, whose experience, talent, commitment and diversity set the standard for the health information industry. Role Summary: In this role you will develop the skills necessary to complete the evaluation and validation of data, calculate rebates, and quantify your findings. You will also build and enhance your interpersonal skills that are necessary to build effective business relationships with your clients. Those skills are pertinent because as an analyst, you will be responsible for multiple accounts and processes and be responsible for the quality and efficiency of complex tasks. Responsibilities: Evaluates data by searching for trends and understanding the financial terms of the contracts.  Analyze contracts and other documents, perform quality assurance checks on data, and communicate effectively both orally and in writing with a customer.  Research and resolve Chargeback claims.  Ensure accurate and appropriate responses to disputes.  Validate appropriate data from internal and third-party systems and ensure appropriate course of action is being pursued.  Track job completion and manage deadlines.  Provides support to team members.  Assists with training projects.  Minimum Education, Experience, & Specialized Knowledge Required:  Bachelor Degree in finance, business, statistics, math or related area or equivalent work experience required (1-2 years).  Possess strong computer capabilities including word processing, spreadsheet and database entry. (Word, Excel, SQL)  Possess strong inter-personal communication skills, both verbal and written.  Possess strong analytical, organizational and problem solving skills.  Participates productively as a member of team and completes tasks beyond general support level.  Identifies, prioritizes and resolves issues independently, and escalates more complex questions or issues appropriately.  Ability to manage tasks and assignments without detailed direction.  Complies with contract requirements, business unit rules and related and legal regulations  Experience with the following is preferred but not required:  Chargeback Adjudication  Membership and Eligibility determinations  Prescription Rebate Processing  Pharmacy Benefit Management  Managed Health Care  Medicaid Drug Rebate Program  Why join the IQVIA team?  Comprehensive Benefits and Perks - health, dental, vision, HSA, PTO and paid holidays, flexible scheduling, 401K employer match, casual dress, free covered parking, free coffee and tea beverages.  Company Culture – Collaborative and innovative environment where you are recognized for your performance.  Professional Development - onboarding training, advancement potential, cross-functional project opportunities, tuition reimbursement  IQVIA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We cultivate a diverse corporate culture across the 100+ countries where we operate, celebrating and rewarding teamwork and inclusiveness. By embracing our differences, we create innovative solutions that are good for IQVIA, our clients, and the advancement of healthcare everywhere #LI-AW1

Name: Data Analyst

This individual will focus on improving and supporting the efficiency and effectiveness of the audit process through ongoing design, development and implementation of methods and techniques focused on the extraction, collection and analysis of Company (as well as external) data. Required skills and qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or related field is preferred, a minimum of two to four years related IT or business related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.SQL experience required (T-SQL, Microsoft Business Intelligence, Oracle, SQL Server Analysis and Reporting Services preferred).Experience using Golden query and scripting toolBusiness Analytics experience using Tableau, Microsoft Power Business Intelligence or other Data Visualization software required.Experience in delivering high quality data analysis and data-related results is required. The Business Intelligence Analyst is proficient with analytical and reporting tools, database development, ETL processes, query languages, and database and spreadsheet tools. Four (4) year of experience in Business Intelligence Analyst role; Proficient in query language. Name: Business Intelligence Visual Analyst
Description: Do you have experience working with very large data sets? Are you highly interested in Business Intelligence, and seeking an important role that allows you to supply trends and analysis to key stakeholders in the business? Do you want to make an impact and believe data can be used to tell a story?  We have just the opportunity for you! The RPO Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for supporting the design and maintenance of Business Intelligence deliverables including Target Performance, Customer Alignment and Predictive Analytics of limited complexity to enhance client business decision making capabilities.  Results  • Create visualized dashboards that tell the story of the RPO data  • Ensures data quality and consistency, managed across the RPO Data Warehouse, and completed in a timely and accurate manner.  • Provides status updates, strategic recommendations, timelines / expectations for delivery of cyclical and adhoc reporting, QSR information.  • Develops reports and populates presentations with data analysis and recommendations.  • Schedules and maintains support of multiple small to mid-sized clients, delivering on time with current relevant information.  Strategy  • Executes against the strategy as outlined/determined by BI Leadership  Client & Candidate  • Communicates to team and clients, efficiently and effectively, to enhance decision making.  • Represent ManpowerGroup in all, even if limited, interactions with external partners in a high client service manner.  Required  • 3 years of experience developing interactive dashboards using Tableau  • Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience  • Technical: Familiarity with Data Warehouses and Data models  Nice to Have  • Querying large datasets using T-SQL  • Background in statistical model building  • Industry knowledge: Understanding of RPO's business model  • Worked with a global organization / client groups  ManpowerGroup is an EOE/AA/Vets/Disabled Employer

Name: Business Operations Analyst Senior

This position will ensure the strategic objectives of the Integrated Financial Solutions (IFS) Business Operations program are met, including the management and execution of client support technology system improvements, implementation of process efficiency activities, coordination of ongoing program reporting and communications. The ideal candidate will have5-10 years of experience with process improvement, preferably within the Finance or IT space, strong reporting skills (Excel, Power BI a plus), and experience presenting/communicating with C suite personnel. initiatives.Development of cross-divisional action plans designed to address inefficient or ineffective operational process with common methodologies that can be applied within each autonomous offering.Identifies and documents business strategies, objectives and drivers.Other related duties assigned as needed.Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:Broad knowledge of FIS’ products and services, Name: Business Analyst- Intern
Description: The FIS 2019 Corporate Summer Internship: As a 2019 Corporate Summer Intern with FIS, you will benefit from on the job training and mentoringalong with participation in team projects, social events,charity work, and professional development seminars. This is a full time (40hrs/week) paid internship that will begin on June 3, 2019 and conclude on August 9, 2019.  Interns will receive the opportunity to build professional relationships and enhance their interpersonal skills. As an intern, you should expect to own the following roles and responsibilities: Contribute individually and/or as a team member to support a designated functional area, analyze business processes, and work towards goals and objectives assigned byan experienced manager. Interns will also interact with and support business partners and participate in projects that directly impact business value. General Duties & Responsibilities:Performs analyses of the business goals, objectives and needs of the general business environment for appropriate FIS segment, division, group or line of business.Performs research and analysis to support business operations and presents findings to manager or project leader.Plans and designs business processes and make recommendations and changes in order to improve and support business systems and activities and/or to deliver greater effectiveness and efficiency.Utilizes systems and data to resolve business issues in the most effective and productive manner.Identifies and implements best practices and suggests how to improve current practices.Calculates/estimates costs and benefits of alternative actions or solutions to establish their viability.Develops recommendations to solve problems and issues related to business operations.Analyzes and documents business processes and metrics and identifies improvement opportunities.May perform special projects upon request and on occasion.Qualifications:Must be currently enrolled at an accredited university pursuing a degree in a related field of studyDisplays good written and oral communication skillsDemonstrates a strong working knowledge of MS OfficeAbility to work in one of FIS’ strategic locations for the duration of the internshipGPA requirement of 3.0 or higherAdditional skills, knowledge, and experience may be required based on the type of functions the incumbent will perform.

Highly-skilled with extensive proficiency. Develops large and/or complex solutions that require analysis and research. Works on multiple projects as a project leader or frequently as the subject matter expert. Works on projects/issues of medium to high complexity that require demonstrated knowledge across multiple technical areas and business segments. Coaches and mentors junior business systems analysts. Works under minimal supervision on complex projects. Wide latitude for independent judgment. Typically requires six or more years of demonstrated business systems analysis experience with at least one project as the business systems analyst lead on a “large” project, i.e., a project with duration of more than 6,000 hours or spanning more than 4 months.

Name: Business Analyst/Client Service Intern
Description: Summer Intern Position – FIS Education & TrainingBusiness Analyst-Training Solutions FIS is looking for a Business Analyst intern to join our Milwaukee based Unified Banking & Digital Solutions training team. This is an exciting opportunity for someone who likes to contribute new ideas and is willing to put in the work to build their career. While desired, previous business analyst experience is not required. What is required is a “can do” attitude and enthusiasm. If you have banking and/or analyst experience this is a great opportunity to put that to work implementing products and services for FIS.  This individual will work to implement an automated training needs analysis process to better serve our current process and procedures. The candidate must be comfortable working independently and in a team environment. The analyst in this position works closely with solution managers to gain perspective of how a training strategy is developed for FIS clients. Using applications such as Excel create an automated process in gathering and analyzing bank role tasks to better determine the training learning path for specific bank roles.  The ideal candidate: Has excellent written and verbal communication skills.Implements projects delivered on time and within budget.Enjoys collaborating with others.Understands the banking industry.Pursuing a bachelor’s degree from a 4yr accredited universityGP 3.0+Rising senior graduating in December 2019 through May 2020General duties and responsibilities:Formulates and defines scope and objectives through research and fact-finding combined with an understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements available within FIS.Includes analysis of business and user training needs and documentation of requirements.Create a process to organize, explore, and analyze data with tools like Excel.Analyzes the training marketplace, industry, company, technology trends and best practices in supporting a training needs analysis process.Analyzes and documents business processes and metrics, identifies improvement opportunities.Calculates/estimates level of effort and costs.Writes test plans and test cases to ensure changes which are made to the solution meet department needs and can be maintained.Conducts a variety of tests of the data results. Verifies through testing that changes made by the new solution do not impact other parts of a training strategy or training deliverables. Reports and reviews testing results.Trains internal employees on changes, new process and procedure.Considers the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment.Performs other related duties as required.

Name: Business Analyst - SAP Engineering
Description: Komatsu is an indispensable partner to the construction, mining, industrial and forestry industries that maximizes value for customers through innovative solutions. With a full line of products supported by our advanced IoT technologies, regional distribution channels and a global service network, we help customers safely and sustainably optimize their operations. Our Komatsu, P&H, Joy, Montabert, Modular Mining Systems, Hensley Industries, NTC and Gigaphoton equipment and services are used to extract fundamental minerals and develop modern infrastructure.  Job Overview  We have a newly created opportunity to join global IT in Milwaukee, WI location. The Business Analyst will work on a global team to support and implement Engineering related master data and change information. In our team, the Engineering responsibilities center on the ECM, Material master data, BOM, Variant Configurator, Project Systems, CENIT workflow add-in, and interfaces to multiple PDM systems such as Autodesk Vault and SolidWorks. Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Brief DescriptionZurn’s Strategic Plan is committed to delivering industry-leading product and digital solutions and best-in-class customer service. At the core of these industry-leading solutions is an innovation engine in need of additional capacity and design talent within our IT organization. In this strategically-important, growth-oriented position, we are seeking Business Analysts who enjoy inspiring the future and understand how to apply solid development principles and knowledge to create excellent processes and user experiences via software solutions. The ideal candidates for this role are passionate about improving end-user experiences and thrive on the challenges of solving the high-profile needs of a growing business...and will bring a track record of success in building solutions to create competitive advantage. As a member of an expanding cross-functional team, they will work collaboratively to lead top initiatives to implement best practices and deliver ERP, CRM, web and eCommerce solutions that allow internal departments and external partners to use technology solutions and data more productively. This role is geared toward the financial areas of the ERP system, and as an owner of projects, the ideal candidates will also have experience in leading the full system development life-cycle and working closely with key stakeholders in a fast-paced, agile environment. Overall, if delivering innovative, technical solutions to business challenges is your “thing,” then this is the perfect job for you!Key AccountabilitiesDetermine operational objectives by studying business functions, with primary focus on financial centric areas that influence operations, purchasing, inventory, distribution and customer service; gathering information, evaluating output requirements and formatsSuggest changes to organization leaders and additional stakeholders to support solution-improvement recommendations; actively participate in the implementation of approved changes and leverage effective usage of business systems to drive functional those improvementsImprove systems by studying current practices; designing modifications that influence the financial processesDesign and champion the development of custom software integrations and solutions; lead projects and set functional and technical specifications; gather business requirements and write functional design documents for system enhancements; construct workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specificationsCreate rich, user-centric solutions and assist with developing UX/UI requirements along with the business logic and data needsLead projects and set application specifications by reviewing a variety of areas (ex: operations, purchasing, inventory, distribution and customer service)Troubleshoot process and application issues and propose solutions; identify/set test cases and conduct unit/integration testing Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases and elements; forming project teams; establishing project budgetsCreate informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement Capabilities and Success FactorsFlexibility/situational adaptability – love for learning new thingsCustomer focus w/ strong problem-solving skillsProven track record of learning new systems, processes and identifying improvement opportunitiesProven track record of prioritizing requirements and creating conceptual prototypes and mock-upsPossesses a strong financial aptitude Facilitation experience in conducting user design / review sessions and running stakeholder agreement meetingsStrong mastery of strategic business process modelingExceptional organization and delivery skills Ability to operate in a fast paced, agile environmentDemonstrated bias towards innovation and new technologies and solutionsJob Requirements Bachelor’s degree in information systems, business administration, finance, accounting or a closely related field from an accredited college or universityExperience with top ERP and CRM solutions; Microsoft Dynamics AX and Dynamics CRM a plusMicrosoft SQL experience strongly preferredExperience transforming customer requirements into a workable design at the functional and/or technical levelsExperience organizing workload to meet deadlines and work in a fast-paced environment; willing to set strategy and be hands onExperience working and thriving in a team-oriented, collaborative environment while effecting change without being confrontationalDetailed oriented, analytical and inquisitive Understanding of software development conceptsExperience with conducting and creating cost/benefit analyses and business casesProject management experience preferredTop skills & proficiencies:Software-solution designAnalysisTeamworkProcess improvementCommunicationProblem solvingCritical thinkingRelationship building The CompanyRexnord® is a $2 billion multi-platform diversified global industrial company with exceptional and trusted brands that serve a diverse array of global end markets. Founded in 1891, Rexnord is headquartered in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, U.S.A. and employs approximately 8,000 associates worldwide. For more information about the company visit www.rexnordcorp.com. Our Process & Motion Control platform designs, manufactures, markets and services highly engineered mechanical components that help customers increase productivity and prevent downtime. Rexnord aerospace products can be found throughout aircraft from the engine to the landing gear. Our Water Management platform offers water solutions that help protect human health and the environment.The company is operated in a disciplined way with the Rexnord Business System (RBS), a process-based framework for world-class operating performance and continuous improvement. RBS enables speed, scalability and consistency to drive superior customer satisfaction and financial results. By deploying our RBS methodology, Rexnord continues to solidify and grow long-standing, globally competitive businesses, while systematically integrating acquisitions and finding new ways to grow.Doing the right thing has been part of our core values for more than a century. So have volunteerism and philanthropy, and our Rexnord Foundation formalized this commitment more than 60 years ago. We make our communities better with individual and organizational volunteering, matching gifts, grants, scholarships and corporate donations.Total Rewards and BenefitsCompetitive Salary & Variable Incentive Compensation Plan (position specific)Medical, Dental, Vision, STD, LTD, AD&D, and Life InsuranceDiscretionary Personal Retirement AccountMatching 401(k) ContributionHealth Savings AccountEducational ReimbursementMatching Gift Program Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Description:The primary responsibility will be to define, document, implement new processes, complete critical work already in progress related to new projects and to support the transition of workload to other staff members. AMI Operations Business Process Analysts are responsible for providing analytical support within AMI Operations and Meter to Bill Process by executing tactical and strategic goals, supporting changes in policy, regulation and strategy and for being the change agent for process, procedure, and/or program modifications.  The Business Process Analyst is a leadership role that provides support, leadership, direction and assistance to junior staff. Lead process improvement efforts. Ensure projects/efforts are properly administered.• Approach assignments from a system perspective by evaluating the effect of an initiative not only from AMI operations perspective but utilizing knowledge and experience of Customer Service, Regulatory, other business units and supporting computer systems (i.e. systems thinking approach). Understand data flows and how multiple systems are configured and work together to support business processes end to end.• Create supportive document and training materials to be used as an aid during transition of support of processes. Participate in the development, maintenance, communication and execution of the Meter to Bill Process plan.• Act as PMO Liaison to specific assigned projects to help ensure successProvide mentoring and oversight to certain project roles (e.g., Project Manager, Business Analyst, Testing Coordinator) Evaluate and interpret new or revised regulation in the form of tariffs, contracts, or rules and regulations issued by the PSC Wisconsin, PSC Michigan or FERC as well as other legal regulations issued by state or federal government. Identifies and communicates the process, procedure, policy and/or program changes necessary to implement new regulation.Utilize Continuous Improvement, Resource Planning and Training to acquire metrics and to determine best format/methodologies to improve efficiencies of teams and control work.QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS Bachelor's degrees – Business/accounting, MIS or related field and 3-5 years' experience in an occupation requiring analysis of process, procedure, and/or systems including at least 2 years' experience in Customer Service. Previous experience leading diverse teams of people with increasing level of responsibility in the past few years and the ability to anticipate and understand needs of internal as well as external customers. Knowledge of gas, electric and steam utility industry. PREFERRED SKILLS Candidates must possess proven project management, communication, planning and organizing, budgeting and business acumen skills; as well as problem solving leadership and decision making abilities. Understanding of CS software app
