Name: Junior Salesforce Business Analyst - DHQ
Description: Provides critical information for The Salvation Army's planning and decision making using Salesforce/NGOC, third party ETL tools. Reporting to the Divisional Development Director and working closely with the Division's leadership and staff, the Business Analyst will contribute to the development department's effectiveness by supporting end users through consultation and analysis resulting in list production and reporting. Assists, advises, and represents the division by performing select database management duties at the direction of the Divisional Development Director that require initiative, independent judgement, and knowledge of the Division's activities and staff responsibilities. The Salvation Army Mission: The Salvation Army, an international movement, is an evangelical part of the universal Christian church. Its message is based on the Bible. Its ministry is motivated by the love of God. Its mission is to preach the gospel of Jesus Christ and to meet human needs in His name without discrimination.  This job description should not be interpreted as all inclusive. It is intended to identify the essential functions and requirements of the position. Other job related responsibilities and tasks may be assigned. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions. Assist the Development Director in overseeing the development and implementation of vision, policies, plans, procedures, and automated processes for fundraising systems and operations.Assist the Development Director in maintaining the Salesforce/NGOC platform, and provide support for integrated and aligned fundraising tools, subscriptions and services.Extract information from the Salesforce/NGOC platform to support the development mission of senior management, fundraising staff have access to data required to perform their jobs effectively.Ensure that software and business processes run smoothly to ensure efficient flow of data, smooth integration between systems and the confidentiality and security of constituent information.Produce or assist with the production of financial, analytical and demographic queries.Initiate a formal data request process for users that ensures information requests are tracked and completed in a timely manner.Provide guidance and assistance in coordinating database de-duping, address updates, data cleanup, and data batch processing projects.Ensure consistent tracking and evaluating of digital/online strategies via Salesforce/NGOC and other applications.Document procedures for using reporting tools and specific reports, including assisting the Development Director in determining appropriate levels of access and facilitating end user access/security.Assist in training staff and end users in the use of Salesforce/NGOC. The requirements listed below are representative of the minimal education, experience, skills, and/or abilities required for this position.  Education:  Bachelor's Degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field, or Five years of progressively responsible experience managing data for relational and/or multi-dimensional databases.  Experience: Minimum of three years of ongoing experience working with non-profit information systems or Salesforce.Experience with fundraising with fundraising database management systems, database reporting, and office productively packages. NGO Connect experience preferred. Skills/Abilities: Knowledge of File Transfer Protocol (FTP) technologies.Knowledge of Extract Transform Load (ETL) technologies.Knowledge of data migration and implementation.Ability to successfully manage multiple objectives and action steps/tasks in a timely and effective manner.Ability to create, develop, and present new ideas/concepts to meet requirements and needs of system users.Ability to achieve successful outcomes in handling difficult situations and users.Ability to act independently to resolve problems and issues.Ability to train users in a variety of methods and settings.Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with the users at the Corps, Area Command, and Divisional levels of the organization.Ability to develop materials and resources for training purposes.Supervisory Responsibility: None Physical Requirements:The physical requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the duties of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions of this job. Physical requirements include: good speaking, hearing and vision ability, and excellent manual dexterity. Lifting, pulling, and pushing of materials up to 25 pounds. Requires bending, squatting and walking. May stand for extend periods. Travel: Occasional travel in the Territory, some may be overnight. Working Conditions: Work is performed in a typical office environment. Full-time position; may require some weekend and evening work. All employees recognize that The Salvation Army is a church and agree that they will do nothing as an employee of The Salvation Army to undermine its religious mission.

Name: Business Intelligence Visual Analyst
Description: Do you have experience working with very large data sets? Are you highly interested in Business Intelligence, and seeking an important role that allows you to supply trends and analysis to key stakeholders in the business? Do you want to make an impact and believe data can be used to tell a story?  We have just the opportunity for you! The RPO Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for supporting the design and maintenance of Business Intelligence deliverables including Target Performance, Customer Alignment and Predictive Analytics of limited complexity to enhance client business decision making capabilities.  Results  • Create visualized dashboards that tell the story of the RPO data  • Ensures data quality and consistency, managed across the RPO Data Warehouse, and completed in a timely and accurate manner.  • Provides status updates, strategic recommendations, timelines / expectations for delivery of cyclical and adhoc reporting, QSR information.  • Develops reports and populates presentations with data analysis and recommendations.  • Schedules and maintains support of multiple small to mid-sized clients, delivering on time with current relevant information.  Strategy  • Executes against the strategy as outlined/determined by BI Leadership  Client & Candidate  • Communicates to team and clients, efficiently and effectively, to enhance decision making.  • Represent ManpowerGroup in all, even if limited, interactions with external partners in a high client service manner.  Required  • 3 years of experience developing interactive dashboards using Tableau  • Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience  • Technical: Familiarity with Data Warehouses and Data models  Nice to Have  • Querying large datasets using T-SQL  • Background in statistical model building  • Industry knowledge: Understanding of RPO's business model  • Worked with a global organization / client groups  ManpowerGroup is an EOE/AA/Vets/Disabled Employer

Name: IT Business System Analyst, Senior - Epic Experience Required
Description: How You'll Make a Difference: Configures, implements, supports and maintains applications, solutions, and business processes to meet the operational and technical needs of the organization. Provides leadership, technical expertise and work direction to other Business Analysts with activities related to various applications and projects. Serves as a liaison between clinical operations, internal information technology, system users and vendors, and acts as a consultant on moderate and complex issues related to the application. Ensures effective systems operations by monitoring applications and providing user support. Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology.  Conducts business operational/technical needs and workflow analysis and cost impact analyses in an effort to align information technology with business initiatives, as well as formulate practical requirements for operational improvements. Configures, implements and assists in evaluating business information systems, projects, timelines and budgets. Translates business requirements into functional specifications and manages changes to such specifications. Formulates and defines project scope and objectives through research and fact-finding, combined with an understanding of applicable business needs.  Applies project management principles to create project plans for routine projects and utilizes the plan to manage workflow and meet deadlines. Creates tasks, work estimates and recommends assignment of resources to tasks associated with project. Modifies tasks, resources, or timelines to ensure success of projects and communicates changes.  Performs cost benefit and return on investment analysis for proposed systems to assist management in making implementation decisions. Reviews and analyzes effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develops strategies for improving or leveraging current systems. Reviews data integrity, audits reports and performs data analysis to support data requirements and initiatives. Recommends new applications and/or design modifications to enhance business operational needs.  Facilitates communication with stakeholders from initial requirements to final implementation. Ensures successful implementation, administration, and documentation of new and existing applications within defined project scope.  Serves as a liaison between business operations and providers, internal information technology, system users, and vendors within defined project objectives, for coordination, problem resolution, system maintenance activities and case/point resolution. Troubleshoots/ resolves moderately complex, and complex application issues and escalates more complex issues to specialty information technology teams and/or the vendor.  Collaborates with specialty information technology teams and/or the vendor, to facilitate practices and procedures which result in successful conversions, updates, application recovery procedures, and assessments of hardware functionality.  Consults with providers, leadership, physicians, and other clinical/business leaders to identify problems and provide resolutions related to equipment, applications, networks, and functions. What it Will Take:Licenses & Certifications None Required. Degrees Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field. Required Functional Experience Typically requires 5 years of experience in in information technology, applications and related business experience that includes end user experience, functioning as the interface between operational and technical experts, providing operational support for systems, and analyzing business processes. Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Demonstrated ability to work with a minimal amount of supervision with proficiency in the ability to instruct, guide, assign, advise and mentor team members. Advanced knowledge of computer operating platforms, applications software, and network software.Demonstrated analytical skills necessary to make sound recommendations based on data analysis, and business needs, assuring maximum productivity, and continuous process improvement. Demonstrated ability to translate user requirements into system specifications. Proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite or similar products and experience with large scale automated systems. Ability to prepare, import, and manipulate information in spreadsheets and databases.Strong communication skills with demonstrated ability to communicate with key leaders. Advanced knowledge and ability in the use of project management change management software and tools and methodologies.Advanced knowledge and ability to follow change management processes.Demonstrated experience working with clinical and technical customers, vendors, peers, and management. Ability to handle multiple tasks, set appropriate priorities and accomplish assignments in a thorough and timely manner. Department: Events Location Address: 3305 W Forest Home Ave  Milwaukee, WI  53215-2843  Milwaukee At Aurora Health Care: We pride ourselves on taking care of our people. And not just our patients—we mean you, too. We help each other live well. When you work at Aurora, you get the chance to work with a dedicated team that’s as passionate about the work as you are. Here, you’ll find limitless opportunities for ongoing learning, career advancement, competitive compensation and a stable work environment. But more than that, you have the opportunity to change lives—including your own.  Diversity and inclusion matters at Aurora. We celebrate our differences and nurture an environment where everyone feels included. We know that when we reflect the communities we serve, when we embrace differences and bring our whole selves to work every day, we are working as one to build a healthier tomorrow for everyone. Aurora supports a safe, healthy and drug-free work environment through criminal background checks and pre-employment drug testing. We maintain a smoke-free environment at all our locations. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Senior Business Analyst/Product Manager
Description: Job DescriptionSENIOR BUSINESS ANALYST / PRODUCT MANAGERWHO IS SPR? SPR is a digital technology consultancy that develops elegant solutions to transform the way people do business. We're 300+ strategists, developers, designers, architects, consultants, thinkers, and doers. We work with 160 clients in 10 unique industries everything from corporate finance and global logistics to local breweries and startups.  We think about the end users and rigorously apply the latest technologies and frameworks to address our clients' needs. We enable companies to do more with data, engage with other people, build disruptive solutions, and operate productively. To do this, we hire smart technologists and sharp business leaders who are excellent communicators and have an interest in working on multiple projects across industries.  SPR offers a great environment for employees to learn, to build systems that make an impact, and to tackle exciting challenges. With our office's "Maker Space", you can explore your IoT side and develop fun projects with 3D printing and CNC machining. We operate in a fun, casual work environment and have great benefits including: competitive salary, bonuses, generous vacation time, big fitness incentives, and medical/dental/vision insurance.  By joining the SPR team, you'll be using your brain, working hard and making an impact through your projects and you'll be rewarded for it. WHAT IS THE POSITION?  The Senior Business Analyst/ Product Manager is one who is passionate about building the products customers love and the client is proud to own and market. As the business analyst/product manager, you will be interfacing with the client stakeholders, users and engineers and be the one who knows the clients' business problems inside and out. Understand the business the client is in and figure out what works and what needs improvementUnderstand the user needs and figure out how to incorporate the user feedback into the business prioritiesFacilitate workshops needed to gather requirements, user research, backlog prioritizations and sessions needed to drive towards a common solutionTransform the business requirements to a set of actionable user stories for development to consumeBe the trusted partner of the product owner or product manager from the client sideEDUCATION & EXPERIENCEBachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field or over 4 years' experience as a Business Analyst, Product Owner, Product Manager or Solutions ArchitectExperience prioritizing items having competing priorities and getting stakeholder buy inShould be a strong facilitatorAbility to show empathy and be an active listenerStrong problem solverSkills on various business process modelling tools, wireframing tools that are needed to get the job doneExperience in Consulting is a plusExperience on SharePoint, O365, SQL or Power BI projects is a strong plus If this sounds like the kind of challenge you would be up for every day, we would love to hear from you.SDL2017

Name: E2Open Business Analyst Needed ASAP - 1 Opening
Description: Job DescriptionJob  We require a Business Analyst (BA) / Transformation Leader (TL) for one of these projects.  The BA/TL will report to the Project Manager, and lead the change management for an entire business unit, to deploy the E2Open supplier collaboration system.  This may include traveling to various factories to interview and understand current processes & tools, any gaps to the company's E2Open-supported process, and propose how to bridge the gaps.  Work with various IT groups to understand possible solutions, and help the PM formulate the approach for each ERP and plant. Requirements: Bachelor's degree. 5-10 years experience in supply chain, working with complex software systems, including ERPs.  Experience with manufacturing is particularly welcome, including Materials Management, inventory control, supplier management for factories, and shop floor productivity.  Ability to work collaboratively with PM, Business, IT teams and bring people together in global team environment  Excellent verbal and written communication skills, facilitation and presentation skills  Driven, culturally adaptable with positive can-do attitude  Ability to adhere to tight timeline and address competing priorities  Elicit stakeholders requirements (SOR), RTM, Current/Future business processes/diagrams, identify gaps, prepare PowerPoints presentations, Change Management Documents, and Test Plans.  Create and maintain project documentation using multiple Client standards and tools, including Supplier Visibility Playbook  Facilitate day-to-day coordination with various IT and business teams  Prepare business cases and participate in software testing.  Experience developing software would be beneficialCompany DescriptionExperis is the global leader in professional resourcing and project-based workforce solutions. We accelerate organizations' growth by intensely attracting, assessing, and placing specialized expertise in IT, Finance, Engineering, and Healthcare to precisely deliver in-demand talent for mission-critical positions, enhancing the competitiveness of the organizations and people we serve.

Name: Communication & Reporting Analyst
Description: WHO ARE WE? FIS connects consumers to their money through leading-edge payments solutions. We’re the development engine of FIS: the largest, Fortune 500, Fintech company in the world. Our solution is branded by our customers — banks and retailers — so you might not have heard of us. But, if you’ve used a mobile banking app, interacted with an ATM, or used a debit card to complete a financial transaction, you’re most likely using FIS software. Our product is one that touches the average consumer on a regular basis, and makes the financial world go ‘round.  Headquartered in Jacksonville, Florida, FIS serves more than 20,000 clients in over 130 countries, and our technology powers billions of transactions annually that move over $9 trillion around the globe. FIS is a Fortune 500 company, ranked 392 on the Fortune 500 list and is a member of Standard & Poor’s 500® Index. Named a 2016 “World’s Most Admired Company” by Fortune Magazine. WHAT IS THE POSITION? FIS is looking for a Communication & Reporting Analyst to join our Payments team in Milwaukee, WI. This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a solid background in public relations, corporate communication and/or technical writing who likes to contribute new ideas and is willing to put in the work to build their career. General Duties and Responsibilities:Works with management to develop and execute comprehensive communication plans in support of corporate image through researching, writing and editing, press releases, white papers, speeches, internal communications, online communications and other related documents.Performs analyses of the business goals, objectives and needs of the general business environment for appropriate FIS segment, division, group or line of business.Creates and develops visual presentations, graphics, and correspondence such as emails, reports, proposals, charts, tables, and graphs.Timely execution of administrative tasks/projectsMonitor and cultivate communications; both internal and externalManage sales campaigns and marketing projectsCoordinate meetings and including travel, hospitality, agendas, meeting content, and PowerPoint presentationsCreate correspondence and reports as directed; Including meeting minutes and reports using Microsoft Office toolsManage project timelines and budgets; present status updates to project team, management and customersPerforms research and analysis to support business operations and presents findings to manager or project leader.Utilizes systems and data to resolve business issues in the most effective and productive manner.Develops recommendations to solve problems and issues related to business operations.May perform special projects upon request and on occasion.Other related duties assigned as needed.Prepares and documents current information about the organization for appropriate members of the media.Assists with the development and execution of tactical public relations (PR) plans.Handles media inquiries, creates media opportunities and works with public relations agencies to get favorable stories in the press.Represents the organization at internal company or public functions and charitable events in a manner that reflects positively on the development organization.  Serves as a liaison for public relations outside of development.  Writes and edits press materials and responds to press inquiries.  Coordinates internal and external events.  Works to establish and maintain positive organizational representation and social responsibility.May gather and write articles for organization's newsletter.May handle charitable donations and sponsorship requests.Helps coordinate PR activities such as media events and trade shows.Researches and compiles data to forecast and prepare annual and monthly budget projections for a division or similar group of organizations.Performs economic research and studies in areas of rates of return, depreciations, working capital requirements, investment opportunities, investment performance and impact of governmental requirements.Prepares reports for management summarizing results of research, analyses and evaluation of any discrepancies.Other related duties assigned as needed.WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU?You have a passion for public relations, communication, and  technical writingYou understand how to use the Microsoft Office SuiteYou know how to adapt to change and stay organizedYou take good notes and you are willing to ask for help when needed - this is important!If you enjoy learning from a variety of team members, developing new ways to enhance existing processes, are driven by real-world applications and are looking for a great place to grow your career - we want to hear from you! We are looking for smart, driven and dedicated team members to join our team.Required Skills:Bachelor’s degree in Public Relations, Technical Writing, Technical Communications, Business Administration, or a related fieldRelevant internship experienceProven experience staying organized in a fast-paced environmentExceptional written communication skillsStrong technical understandingAbility to travel up to 25%WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM US? At FIS we value new ideas and we pride ourselves on providing a wide-range of opportunities for professional growth in a face-paced environment. FIS offers an open minded collaborative culture with enthusiastic technologists. A true partner. We are dedicated to our team members and our customers equally. We strive to create an environment to help you succeed. FIS Benefits and Perks:A generous paid time off program in which the benefits increase along with your tenure with the companyHealth coverage offered for you and your family through Health/Vision/Dental/Insurance plansTax advantage flexible spending accounts and health savings accounts that allow you to pay for specific health-care and dependent care expenses with pre-tax dollarsTo help you manage your work and life needs we offer a health advocate program, tuition reimbursement and a group legal service plan401K match and Employee Stock Purchase ProgramCompany Paid Volunteer DayOnsite caféOnsite gymCasual dress code (jeans every day if desired)FIS Gives Back Program – supporting our local community **Current and future sponsorship not available for this position**

In addition, promoting healthy lifestyles and community engagement through financial and product contributions, as well as through volunteer hours is core to who we are. But don’t take our word for it – hear it from our employees. Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Through its people and brands, CNH Industrial delivers power, technology and innovation to farmers, builders and drivers all around the world. Each of its brands, including Case IH, New Holland Agriculture, Case and New Holland Construction, FPT Industrial, Capital, and Parts & Service, is a major international force in its specific sector.  CNH Industrial is seeking a motivated Business Systems Analyst to work closely with the business to evaluate complex business requirements and processes, define business functional and non-functional requirements, and produce business process flows and application system specifications. This position can be based in New Holland, PA, or Racine, WI. Our application landscape is centered on MS Dynamics CRM Platform with various integrations to other core applications. Successful candidates will need to build and maintain strong relationships with their teammates and business partners while developing high quality CRM solutions. Responsibilities include: Assist the team in operational tasks related to day-to-day support of MS Dynamics CRM or other team tools, as assigned.  Work closely with the business to identify business requirements and processes.  Translate the business requirements into application system specifications for the development team.  Provide hands on development support for the Microsoft Dynamics CRM platform, version 2015  Support the business in User Acceptance testing and data validation Supports end users by developing documentation and assistance tools The qualified candidate will have: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, or other technical discipline  5 or more years of solution development experience in CRM solutions The idea candidate will have: High degree of self-motivation  Displays a team oriented attitude and an attention for detail  Ability to quickly adapt to new requirements and changing situations  Excellent communication skills, good listening skills, and the ability to generate clear, concise written documentation  Skilled with SQL, MySQL, Java/JS, .NET. Certifications a plus  Skilled in the use of Microsoft office software to include Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook  Good understanding of computer science basics including web application development and database interactions  Knowledge of these is a plus: SQL, SQL Reporting Services (SSMS, and SSRS), Microsoft .NET/C#, HTML/HTLM5/CSS/Bootstrap, JavaScript, Rest / SOAP / Web Services  Experience with Business Applications (CRM, ERP)  Equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: Due to  growth, we have an immediate need for a Business  Analyst to work in our Brookfield, WI office.  This  position is responsible for determining the requirements of a project,  documenting and communicating them clearly to stakeholders. The successful candidate will: Establish  project requirements using interviews, document analysis, business process  descriptions, case scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow  analysis. Ensure all stakeholders are involved in requirements gathering  activities.Develop  both high-level and detailed requirement specification documents, user  documents, functional specification documents, traceability matrices, business  processes and workflows.Facilitate  design sessions with the implementation team to define the solution. This  position requires a minimum of 5 years of experience  performing requirements gathering and documenting as well as requirements analysis. Qualified candidates must also  be able to effectively communicate, both verbally and in writing. We also require: Experience  modeling business processes and conducting requirements gathering for projects  of all sizes and scope.Exceptional  analytical and problem solving skills, including a thorough understanding of  how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application  and operational requirements.Proficiency  with Microsoft Office applications and Visio.Knowledge  in web development or application development.Ability to  develop wireframes and use prototyping tools.Ability to  travel occasionally to project locations to gather requirements (may take several  week long trips). If you would like to work in a  collaborative team environment, where hard work and individual contributions  are recognized, please apply now!  Applus+  Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all  positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national  origin, age, sex, marital status, military status or military discharge status,  sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Auto req ID: 475Title: Financial AnalystJob Function: FinanceLocation: JUNEAUCompany: Harley-Davidson Motor CompanyFull or Part-Time: Full TimeShift: SHIFT1 We are paving more roads to Harley-Davidson by developing exhilarating new products, creating broader access to our iconic brand, and building a stronger dealer network. We can’t do it without the best and brightest. Step one of this strategic acceleration is adding talent who can blow the doors wide open with innovation and creativity while staying true to the Harley-Davidson brand and legacy. We are focused on the next 115 years. Are you in?Job Summary As a Financial Analyst, you will provide financial guidance, direction, and analytical support for appropriate functional areas and all corresponding departments within Harley-Davidson. You will coordinate the development of revenue, cost of sales, expense, capital and headcount budgets and forecasts for your assigned area(s). This position provides comprehensive financial support for assigned departments including, but not limited to, monthly performance reports, financial analysis, revenue, margin and expense variance review, and recommendations for corrective actions when needed. You will also participate in special projects as required allowing for crossfunctional understanding of the Motor Company. Job ResponsibilitiesProvides business analysis with particular emphasis in understanding the supported business. Assists directors and managers with the financial management of their departmental expenses.Coordinates the development and assist in the preparation of all budgets and forecasts for expense, capital, and headcount in accordance with the financial planning calendar.Provides monthly financial support to the business: Record month end journal entries/accruals; Assure all expenses are recorded in the month incurred; Distribute departmental performance reports; and Analyze spending variances.Education Specifications This position requires a Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field is Required. A CPA or equivalent is desired. Experience Requirements This role typically requires 2-3 years of related experience highlight: Demonstrated competency in the use of spreadsheets and accounting systems for the purpose of analysis and financial modeling;Strong interpersonal skills and skills necessary to communicate with all levels of management.Self-motivated and a self-starter continuously looking for process improvements.Strong attention to detail while maintaining the broader, analytical perspective.Excellent organizational skills – ability to balance multiple tasks under time constraints.SAP experience a plus.We offer an inclusive compensation package for all full-time salaried employees including, but not limited to, annual bonus programs, health insurance benefits, a 401k program, onsite fitness centers and employee stores, employee discounts on products and accessories, and more. We believe that employees do their best work when they are free to be themselves. This means our dress code is relaxed, and all types of work styles are welcomed.  Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States. Direct Reports: NoTravel Required: 0 - 10%Visa Sponsorship: This position is not eligible for visa sponsorshipRelocation: This position is not eligible for relocation assistance

Name: Sr. SAP FICO Business Analyst
Description: Title : SAP FICO Business Analyst  Location : Milwaukee, WI  Duration : 6 Month Contract to Hire Overview: TekPartners offers the most sought after Information Technology positions with some of the most well-known companies in the world. - Responsibilities:Lead projects that require the coordination of multiple analysts, developers, other I.T. resources and business stakeholders. Possess an in-depth knowledge of one or more business processes or SAP modules. Have a broad understanding of the workings and requirements of multiple businesses. Demonstrate well developed leadership skills, inclusive of problem solving, relationship building, communications skills and proven ability to positively impact business results. The SBA will combine functional knowledge of business and customer requirements with technical expertise in enterprise information systems, (namely SAP and bolt-on applications), to drive continuous improvement.- The SBA will perform proactive investigations to surface opportunities for process and systems improvement, prepare functional and technical specifications for new development, prepare and execute test plans for all changes and enhancements in their area, and keep all end user training documentation current.- Additionally the SBA will respond with urgency to any system problems impeding efficient operations within the business.--- The SBA will also be responsible for executing projects within their area of ownership, inclusive of new systems implementations and upgrades.-- Ultimately, the Sr. Business Analyst will be accountable for the effectiveness of their processes and systems configuration in meeting the needs of our global businesses, and for working cooperatively across multiple business units and cultures to drive positive improvement in operating efficiency and customer service.Maintains an in-depth and current knowledge of the business process they are responsible for. Provides leadership and support to a cross-business team of individuals in the business, responsible for local process execution. Performs analysis and investigation into root cause of problems, proposes solutions. - Prepares detailed functional and technical design specifications. Reviews requests for add, change or delete of functionality within a process Monitors process adherence and consults with the process owner and user for issue resolution. Supports and enhances SAP with a continued focus on process improvement to meet business case goals. Codes individual SAP modules and / or bolt-on solutions, maintains the SAP business rules configuration.. Participates in System upgrades and new business implementations. Maintains up to date end user and system documentation. Networks with other companies and associations to surface best practice opportunities. Investigates future system releases & enhancements. Collaborates with fellow BA's, Developers and Basis engineers to identify and implement cross-functional improvements. Develops, coordinates and implements plans to test processes and configuration assuring quality of any additions, changes or deletions to the system. Monitors and documents implementation problems & revision requests. Prepares time and cost estimates for completing projects, where needed. Consults with business unit managers and end users to identify & document business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input and output requirements, formatting and security requirements. Provides timely response to end user calls and help tickets assisting in problem resolution. Manage key projects as assigned  Qualifications: Required: Four-year college or university certificate; or two to four years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education & experience. Business process knowledge and SAP experience desired. Candidate must possess strong problem solving and analytical skills to ensure process and system improvements are warranted, and will have the desired effects in the business.- Experience in direct configuration of SAP is highly desired.  -Our benefits package includes:-Comprehensive -Medical BenefitsCompetitive Pay401K Retirement PlanAnd Much MoreAbout TekPartners: TekPartners is one of the fastest growing private staffing firms in the United States. We are a premier provider of highly qualified IT talent, Workforce Solutions and Business Intelligence Solutions to many enterprise organizations across the nation. As experts in the industry, our team continues to match proven talent to the right job opportunity every day. -  TekPartners is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Category: Information Technology,SAP - provided by Dice  Analysis, Analyst, Analytical Skills, Business Analyst, Business Intelligence, CASE, Customer Service, Development, Networks, SAP, Security

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Business Process Analyst  Duration:- 5 Months (Possibly Extendable)  In this role you will develop the skills necessary to complete the evaluation and validation of data, research and resolve claims, and quantify your findings. You will also build and enhance your interpersonal skills that are necessary to build effective business relationships with your clients. Those skills are pertinent because as an associate, you will be responsible for multiple accounts and processes and be responsible for the quality and efficiency of complex tasks. Responsibilities:Evaluate data by searching for trends and understanding customer contracts.Analyze contracts and other documents, perform quality assurance checks on data, and communicate effectively both orally and in writing with customers.Research and resolve Chargeback claims.Ensure accurate and appropriate responses to disputes.Validate appropriate data from internal and third-party systems and ensure appropriate course of action is being pursued.Track job completion and manage deadlines.Participate in departmental process improvement teams and play key role on cross-functional teams.Assist with training projects. Minimum Education, Experience, & Specialized Knowledge Required: Associates Degree in finance, business, statistics, math or related area or equivalent work experience required (1-2 years).Possess strong computer capabilities including word processing, spreadsheet and database entry. (Word, Excel, SQL)Possess strong inter-personal communication skills, both verbal and written.Possess strong analytical, organizational and problem solving skills.Participate productively as a member of team and complete tasks beyond general support level.Identify, prioritize and resolve issues independently, and escalate more complex questions or issues appropriately. Ability to manage tasks and assignments without detailed direction. Comply with contract requirements, business unit rules and related legal regulationsExperience with the following is preferred but not required: o Chargeback Adjudication  o Membership and Eligibility determinations  o Prescription Rebate Processing  o Pharmacy Benefit Management  o Managed Health Care  o Medicaid Drug Rebate Program

Name: Systems Analyst
Description: Broad Description of Duties:The System Analyst is responsible for analysis, design, configuration, and support of theatre systems to improve business efficiency/productivity and support business goals. The System Analyst identifies business needs and works within the theatre technology team to implement those requirements into POS, loyalty, timekeeping, and signage systems.The System Analyst must develop a working knowledge of the theatre business areas and a strong understanding of the overall theatre IT architecture in order to understand issues and implications of proposed system and hardware solutions.Essential Functions/Job Duties:Maintain and troubleshoot theatre POS, loyalty, timekeeping, and signage systems.Perform system development tasks including business requirement gathering,analysis, design, development, testing, and documentation.Integration and report development in MS SQL reporting services and MS SQL integration services.Respond to business support requests ensuring a high level of support for all theatre systems including participation on an on-call rotation.Coordinate support services and act as a primary contact with vendors as needed. Monitor vendor performance and service issue resolution.Function as a problem-solving and escalation point for business leaders in regards to technology.Provide a continuous focus on improving process and flow of information.Implement and ensure the proper execution\operation of all PCI and SOX required technology and processes.Demonstrate verbal and interpersonal skills and be an effective communicator and company representative. Remain abreast of current information system trends and technologies and recommend technology to the business that will meet business needs.Adhere to all of the personnel and application development policies and procedures of the Division as well as the parent company.Education Required:BA/BS degree in Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent experience.Experience Required:Requires 2-4 years systems development or application management related experienceRequires a working knowledge of the MS SQL tool set and development skills1 years of prior experience with project management Strong analytical and organization skills

Name: Vulnerability Management Analyst
Description: What you will love about Johnson Controls:  We'vebeen dedicated to protecting the environment since our invention of theelectric thermostat in 1885, which provided a fundamental shift in the energyefficiency of buildings. Now, all over the world, our products and servicesempower customers and communities to consume less energy and conserveresources. Global, innovative, industry leaderEmbraces diversityGrowth opportunities aboundFast paced, evolving company, always learning, always adaptingGreat benefits; including Healthcare related wellness discounts, great 401k match, company funded retirement program, vacation, sick time, floating holidays and national holidays What you will do  The Johnson Controls Global Information Security (GIS) teamis undergoing a transformation and expansion as Johnson Controls increases itscybersecurity resources and capabilities to address the increasingcybersecurity threat landscape.  The Information SecurityOperations Vulnerability Analyst is a position reporting into the GlobalInformation Security Operations Manager with responsibility of reviewing,recommending and assisting in the implementation of technical security programcontrols including standards, key processes, and best practices. This role willanalyze enterprises business applications, computing, and the informationsecurity environment, make recommendations and drive the implementation ofsecurity strategies.  How you will do it Maintain and improve upon, as necessary, the existing vulnerability management program, including maintenance of scanning tools and licensing, procedures, reporting, and client communications.Provide guidance to clients in support of vulnerability management services, which includes, but is not limited to, establishing goals of vulnerability management and road maps to achieve those goals.Conduct scheduled and ad-hoc vulnerability scans for clients and Company environments.Analysis and validation of scan results communicated to clients through reporting and results-review meetings.Provide clients with remediation recommendations and guidance, up to and including remediation tracking and reporting. This may include working directly with IT resources responsible for remediation on behalf of client Security teams.Coordinate with clients in defining reports that provide the most value based on security maturity and established vulnerability management goals. This requires the ability to be adaptive in report parameters and formats depending on client needs and target audience.Providing remediation support on any potential findingsAssessment, triage and analysis of malwarethreats including reverse engineering What we look for  The successful candidate will bea passionate information security professional with the ability to communicateto different business and IT leaders. The candidate will be able to execute theInformation Security inventory management strategy defined by leaders. Thecandidate will demonstrate drive, intelligence, maturity, and energy and willbe a proven team leader and security strategist. A minimum bachelor's degree in computerengineering, computer security, or computer science discipline, unique equivalentprofessional experienceMinimum of 3 years of progressive experience in information technology with 2 years of vulnerability scanning/management experience.Demonstrated ability to prepare documentation and presentations for technical and non-technical audiences.Knowledge of methods for on-going evaluation of the effectiveness and applicability of information security controls (e.g., vulnerability testing, and assessment tools).Ability to understand information security risks associated with vulnerability testing, patch management, and secure configuration management.Ability to analyze and prioritize vulnerabilities to appropriately characterize threats and provide remediation advice. Familiarity with classes of vulnerabilities, appropriate remediation, and industry-standard classification schemes (CVE, CWE, CVSS, CPE).Knowledge of common attack methodologies; common types of security vulnerabilities;Proficiency in the use of manual and automated techniques for scanning, vulnerability, and penetration testing of networks, applications, operating systems, databases, and email systemsExperience with software internals such as Windows, Linux, OSX, RTOSs, and mobile platformsFamiliarity with and ability to leverage various internal network, IT, and security platforms such as masscan, nmap, SCCM, GPO, Tanium, Qualys, Rapid7, Windows event logs, Splunk, etc.Experience performing security/vulnerabilityreviews of network environments.Influence behavior to reduce risk and foster a strong technology risk management culture throughout the enterprise.Strong verbal/written communication andinterpersonal skills are required to document and communicate findings,escalate critical incidents, to technical and non-technical audiences atdifferent seniority levels and interact with customers.Highly motivated individual with the ability toself-start, prioritize, multi-task and work in a global team setting.Ability to create and maintain good businessrelationships with counter parts, customers and external entities to achievethe security operations management goalsBonus:Understanding of cloud securitySecurity hardening experienceDesired Certifications (but notrequired):Certified Information Systems SecurityProfessional (CISSP)Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) Who we are  JohnsonControls is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer andall qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment withoutregard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteranstatus, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any othercharacteristic protected by law. For more information, please view EEO is theLaw. If you are an individual with a disability and you require anaccommodation during the application process, please visit www.johnsoncontrols.com/tomorrowneedsyou.

Name: Junior Salesforce Business Analyst - DHQ
Description: OverviewProvides critical information for The Salvation Army's planning and decision making using Salesforce/NGOC, third party ETL tools. Reporting to the Divisional Development Director and working closely with the Division's leadership and staff, the Business Analyst will contribute to the development department's effectiveness by supporting end users through consultation and analysis resulting in list production and reporting. Assists, advises, and represents the division by performing select database management duties at the direction of the Divisional Development Director that require initiative, independent judgement, and knowledge of the Division's activities and staff responsibilities. The Salvation Army Mission: The Salvation Army, an international movement, is an evangelical part of the universal Christian church. Its message is based on the Bible. Its ministry is motivated by the love of God. Its mission is to preach the gospel of Jesus Christ and to meet human needs in His name without discrimination.ResponsibilitiesThis job description should not be interpreted as all inclusive. It is intended to identify the essential functions and requirements of the position. Other job related responsibilities and tasks may be assigned. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions. Assist the Development Director in overseeing the development and implementation of vision, policies, plans, procedures, and automated processes for fundraising systems and operations.Assist the Development Director in maintaining the Salesforce/NGOC platform, and provide support for integrated and aligned fundraising tools, subscriptions and services.Extract information from the Salesforce/NGOC platform to support the development mission of senior management, fundraising staff have access to data required to perform their jobs effectively.Ensure that software and business processes run smoothly to ensure efficient flow of data, smooth integration between systems and the confidentiality and security of constituent information.Produce or assist with the production of financial, analytical and demographic queries.Initiate a formal data request process for users that ensures information requests are tracked and completed in a timely manner.Provide guidance and assistance in coordinating database de-duping, address updates, data cleanup, and data batch processing projects.Ensure consistent tracking and evaluating of digital/online strategies via Salesforce/NGOC and other applications.Document procedures for using reporting tools and specific reports, including assisting the Development Director in determining appropriate levels of access and facilitating end user access/security.Assist in training staff and end users in the use of Salesforce/NGOC. QualificationsThe requirements listed below are representative of the minimal education, experience, skills, and/or abilities required for this position.  Education:  Bachelor's Degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field, or Five years of progressively responsible experience managing data for relational and/or multi-dimensional databases.  Experience: Minimum of three years of ongoing experience working with non-profit information systems or Salesforce.Experience with fundraising with fundraising database management systems, database reporting, and office productively packages. NGO Connect experience preferred. Skills/Abilities: Knowledge of File Transfer Protocol (FTP) technologies.Knowledge of Extract Transform Load (ETL) technologies.Knowledge of data migration and implementation.Ability to successfully manage multiple objectives and action steps/tasks in a timely and effective manner.Ability to create, develop, and present new ideas/concepts to meet requirements and needs of system users.Ability to achieve successful outcomes in handling difficult situations and users.Ability to act independently to resolve problems and issues.Ability to train users in a variety of methods and settings.Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with the users at the Corps, Area Command, and Divisional levels of the organization.Ability to develop materials and resources for training purposes.Supervisory Responsibility: None Physical Requirements:The physical requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the duties of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions of this job. Physical requirements include: good speaking, hearing and vision ability, and excellent manual dexterity. Lifting, pulling, and pushing of materials up to 25 pounds. Requires bending, squatting and walking. May stand for extend periods. Travel: Occasional travel in the Territory, some may be overnight. Working Conditions: Work is performed in a typical office environment. Full-time position; may require some weekend and evening work. All employees recognize that The Salvation Army is a church and agree that they will do nothing as an employee of The Salvation Army to undermine its religious mission.

Name: IS Business Analyst

Name: Sr. Process Analyst
Description: Agile is software development and management method that serves as an alternative to traditional methodologies, specifically within the field of software development. As such, Scrum Master lead software implementation teams, often supporting a Coach implementing this new method for the first time, meaning that in addition to performing his servant leadership responsibilities, they are also supporting driving learning and adoption. The goal of a Scrum Master is to serve the Agile team by removing impediments, facilitating ceremonies, preserving and protecting the agile principles and values. Scrum Masters represent their team externally and support them by shielding them from unnecessary external interference with the ultimately goal of enabling continuous delivery of business value.Scrum Master Profile 1. Servant Leader Must be able to garner respect from his her team and be willing to get their hands dirty to get the job done2. Communicative and social Must be able to communicate well with teams3. Facilitative Must be able to lead and demonstrate value add principles to a team4. Assertive Must be able to ensure Agile Scrum concepts and principles are adhered to, must be able to be a voice of reason and authority, make the tough calls.5. Situationally Aware Must be the first to notice differences and issues as they arise and elevate them to management6. Enthusiastic Must be high energy7. Continual improvement Must continually be growing ones craft learning new tools and techniques to manage oneself and a team8. Conflict resolution Must be able to facilitate discussion and facilitate alternatives or different approaches9. Attitude of empowerment Must be able to lead a team to self organization10. Attitude of transparency Must desire to bring disclosure and transparency to the business about development and grow business trustScrum Master Skills 1. Understand basic fundamentals of iterative development2. Understand other processes and methodologies and can speak intelligently about them and leverage other techniques to provide value to a team enterprise3. Understand basic fundamentals of software development processes and procedures4. Understand the value of commitments to delivery made by a development team5. Understand incremental delivery and the value of metrics6. Understand backlog tracking, burndown metrics, velocity, and task definition7. Familiarity with common Agile practices, service oriented environments, and better development practicesResponsibilities 1. Educate and train team members on Agile foundations, values and principles2. Train the team on Scrum3. Train the team on Kanban4. Train the team, ARTS, portfolios and strategists on SAFe5. Work imbedded with the agile teams to mentor and coach team members on the job6. Lead by example in terms of practice and adoption of agile culture7. Ensure Agile adoption of agile team follows Agile CoE guidelines 8. Establish continuous improvement process for agile teams focusing on their processes and outcomes product 9. Collaborate with Agile and DevOps coaching community in the continuous advance of the client agile framework and tools10. Provide guidance and training to leaders and managers11. Advise stakeholders on the proper techniques and methods to rollout agile adoption12. Function as key drivers for facilitating the removal of impediments outside of team control.Certifications- Relevant Agile advanced certifications through Scrum Alliance, Scrum.org, ScrumInc, LeanKanban University, SAFe and Disciplined Agile Consortium B TECH

Name: Business Analyst III

Farmers Insurance also offers extensive training opportunities through the award winning University of Farmers named by Training magazine amongst top 10 corporate training units in the world. Start your career at Farmers today! Skill in process/work flow modeling is desired Familiarity with the Lean methodology is a plus Experience on Agile projects is preferred, including: Participating in the day to day running of Agile projects, including Experience as a ScrumMaster and/or Product Owner Using a decomposition approach to identify epics and user stories, as well as, being able to organize into themes Writing clear and concise user stories that can be understood by both business and development Job Summary Works with Business leaders to identify, propose and influence business decisions; Possesses expertise in the business objectives, processes, and products; Leads large analysis efforts, affecting multiple business and IT departments; Oversees business requirement gathering and analysis, supports business leaders with cost/benefit analysis, risk assessment and project scope; Mentors lower level colleagues. Work with business leaders to socialize the change and act as an intermediate and liaison for the sponsor throughout the project/enhancement implementation while collaborating with project teams, other stakeholders and IT to implement the recommended solutions. Works on projects/programs of higher complexity (impact to multiple business units/applications) and supervises/mentors lower level peers. Essential Job Functions Develops business requirements through analysis on business activities, industry trends and sponsor requests. Works with business leader to define project scope Performs impact analysis of business process changes/enhancements across the organization. Understands customers objectives, processes and products in order to make educated recommendations. Oversees Business Requirement gathering and analysis Acts as liaison between Business Sponsors and IT staff. Supports application testing, implementation, and training activities. Mentors/supervises lower level peers on project tasks by managing the daily and long term work efforts of assigned staff for a particular segment of work. Name: Sr. Financial Analyst
Description: Description Position Summary  The Senior Financial Analyst will work in an area such as our Central Financial Planning and Analysis (FP & A) organization, a business unit, Global Sales and Marketing (GSM)/Function, or Enterprise Analysis.  As an example, a Senior Financial Analyst in Central FP & A will provide value-added financial analysis for the product businesses of the two operating segments of Rockwell Automation: Architecture and Software (A & S) and Control Products and Solutions (CP & S). The role works closely with business unit FP & A, Corporate FP & A, BU finance, and global financial operations to address a variety of issues impacting segment financial results.  A Senior Financial Analyst in a business unit/GSM/Function is a business partner with business leadership involved in setting investment priorities, ensuring accurate reporting and solid financial controls, and providing a clear picture of the key drivers of budget spend. This individual will develop, interpret and implement financial concepts for financial planning and control. They will also perform technical analysis to determine present and future financial performance. The role will gather, analyze, prepare and summarize recommendations for financial plans, trend future requirements and operating forecasts.  A Senior Financial Analyst in Enterprise Analysis will develop analysis to support the development of recommendations and action plans that will be presented to company leadership, including the CEO and CFO, and which will require significant collaboration with the BU, segment and functional Finance teams. Essential Functions: The Senior Financial Analyst across FP & A organizations will be supporting month-end close, review actual financial performance with comparisons to plan, and support of the financial cycle including developing quarterly forecasts and annual plans. Ongoing support includes analysis of current month results, business unit or functional reviews of operating performance and Key Performance Indicators (KPI's), and other analytics unique to the area the Senior Financial Analyst supports.  In addition to a variety of monthly and quarterly planning and forecasting responsibilities, the FP & A Senior Financial analysts work with other members of the team on a variety of ad hoc and process improvement projects. These may include one-off analyses of outliers in financial performance or tracking down details to help a BU or function better understand a key portion of their P & L or other financial metrics. Other projects may include strategic analysis of key geographic or product-specific issues to provide leadership with a better understanding of profitability trends in support of investment or other business decisions.  All Senior Financial Analysts should apply advanced knowledge within finance and draw upon experience to solve highly complex/technical focus areas as identified by the business.  The ideal candidate has a proven track record of strong interpersonal skills demonstrated while working across functions and regions on reporting and analysis. Demonstrate effective communication skills to present formal financial presentation to senior management. Position requires the ability to work effectively as a team member and individual contributor while showing strong self-initiative. EOE, M/F/DISABLE, VET#LI-JB1 Basic Qualifications Bachelor'sDegreeLegal authorization to work in the US is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor's degreein Accounting, Finance, or related area. MBA candidate graduating in May 2019.Minimum of 5 years of progressive finance and/or accounting experienceAptitude to mine data sources for required financial data and the ability to turn it into relevant financial information for decision making. Strong decision making and problem solving skills, leadership skills necessary to provide effective financial support to applicable management team. Strong personal computer skills (MS Excel) The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to the job. They are not intended to be an all-encompassing list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. Reasonable accommodations to essential functions of the job will be made if appropriate.  Rockwell Automation is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Company Overview  Rockwell Automation, the world's largest company dedicated to industrial automation, makes its customers more productive and the world more sustainable. Throughout the world, our flagship Allen-Bradley and Rockwell Software product brands are recognized for innovation and excellence.  When you choose Rockwell Automation, you join countless talented employees who have helped us establish our leadership position in the automation industry over the past century.  You join a diverse, inclusive and global community with a passion for innovation. A place where you can partner with great minds and inspiring people. And a corporation backed by the financial strength that drives growth - and career opportunities.  As much as we focus on our customers, we know our employees are key to our success and future. Helping you develop a rewarding career is a top priority. Because when you succeed, we succeed.  EEO Statement  Rockwell Automation is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.  If you are an individual with a disability and you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process, email our Talent Acquisition representative at ************************************.  Download the EEO is the Law poster and the supplement for more information. Name: Business Intelligence Visual Analyst at Manpower Group Solutions
Description: Are passionate about Business Intelligence? Do you want to revolutionize information delivery across the globe? ManpowerGroup Solutions is looking for a creative, dedicated, and self-motivated Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Global Business Intelligence team in the Milwaukee, WI area. The BI Analyst is responsible for developing and designing innovative dashboards and delivering this insight using transformational technologies ensuring the right information gets to the right people at the right time. The BI Analyst transforms chaotic data into impactful visuals, delivering process optimization through the use of trend analysis, predictive, and prescriptive analytics.  The successful BI Analyst is able to work independently, as well as collaboratively within the Business Intelligence team along with our client delivery teams across a global footprint. The BI Analyst must have initiative and be passionate about learning new processes and innovative technology. We are looking for someone that has a strong desire to find innovative solutions and a willingness to take ownership of the implementation of those ideas. Day to day responsibilities of the Business Intelligence Visual Analyst include:Delivering best in class, next generation visuals and insights using Tableau.Documenting requirements and analytical needs of our clients through structured interviews and in person or virtual meetings.Developing new visualizations to tell a story with information and performing A/B testing with the client teams.Developing self-service, interactive, vibrant visualizations to effectively communicate meaningful insights from large data sets.Embedding machine learning and AI analytics into the BI platform delivery tool that to tell a story to our global client base. If you are interested in being a part of a multidisciplinary and diverse team responsible for having a direct impact on current and future state analytics at ManpowerGroup, then this is your career opportunity! The ideal Business Intelligence Visual Analyst will have:Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science with a background in data science, BI and Analytics, or Talent Analytics3+ years of developing interactive dashboard using TableauExperience with data warehouses and data modelsKnowledge to querying large datasets using T-SQLBackground in statistical model buildingUnderstanding of the talent recruitment business model and industryCollaboration with a global organization/client groups We apply our expertise to provide a suite of proven workforce solutions that improve our clients' productivity, efficiency and cost containment. ManpowerGroup Solutions is a dedicated business unit of ManpowerGroup - a world leader in employment services for more than 60 years, and a recognized pioneer in the industry. If you are interested in joining one of Fortune's World's Most Admired Companies, then please forward your resume!  ManpowerGroup is an EOE/AA/Vets/Disabled EmployerWork Type: fulltime

Recruiting utmost-quality individuals for our clients, CCI fields a workforce of individuals who are selected not only because of their technical qualifications but also for their achievements as substantial, contributing human beings. In government work and in the commercial market, high standards of ethics and accountability are critical. Therefore our people are chosen for their integrity and ability to maintain relationships, as well as expertise in their field. To learn more about CCI, visit us online at www.cci-worldwide.com.Job DescriptionERP/HRIS Implementation Project Consultant Overview: Lead implementation of HR Modules within Infor ERP product. Design, plan, and coordinate work teams. Involve HR COEs (Directors/Staff) as required. Follows standard project management industry practices such as the PMI's framework. Understand business and technical objectives of a project and works closely with project sponsor. Create project charter and work plan and tracks budget and schedule progress via appropriate metrics. Establish project organization and methodologies and define roles and responsibilities. Document risks and develops mitigation plans. Manage scope. Position Summary: Reports to the Human Resources Leadership team and is the technical point-of-contact and business consultant to assist HR subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, design and development of dashboards and reports, report writing and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities. Train HR staff on ERP/HRIS policies, procedures, and systems, within the standards of audit compliance best practice. ERP/HRIS Effectiveness: -Participate in the development of overall strategic plan for HR systems, -Serve as "point person" for the HR divisions on the ERP/HRIS-related project: helping to prioritize, develop, and refine business requirements, -Ensure that all projects are delivering on their stated objectives on time and on budget, -Co-lead with subject matter experts on implementation of new systems features such as Employee/Manager Self Service, Talent Acquisition, Succession Planning, Performance Management, LMS, -Partner with Vendor Implementation team/IT to troubleshoot and correct system or process issues, -Continually monitor processes and develop appropriate metrics to reflect accuracy and efficiency Company Wide HR Effectiveness: -Partner with HR Management to continually refine and improve HR system processes in order to maximize efficiency, cost savings, and enable new HR initiatives, -Help manage ERP/HRIS vendor relationships to ensure the services that Milwaukee County receives meet our needs and provide excellent value, -Communicate system changes as needed to ensure all are implementing policies and procedures consistently, -Provide training to Human Resources employees in regards to ERP/HRIS systems and policies and procedures HR Modules: Integrations and Reporting: -Develops, monitors, and executes "ad hoc" and ongoing requests for data to ensure that the workload is appropriate and that the reports are meeting the business needs, -Create "ad hoc" custom reports based on HR and other departments' needs, -Use experience and best practices to suggest new reports that may be of interest to HR staff and management, -Assure accuracy of all reported data coming out of new systems set-up, -Help troubleshoot issues i.e.: weekly file transfers, unemployment, benefits, and various other vendors -Performs other duties as required and/or assigned -Infor ERP experience is highly desirable, but will accept in-depth knowledge of implementing, optimizing and configuring HR software platforms Required Job Qualifications: -Bachelors Degree in related field and minimum 5-7 years of related HR work experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities -Advanced knowledge of and ability in using various software applications -Knowledge of HR principles, practices, and systems -Experience with system configuration, testing, implementation, and administration of HR software platforms -Advanced reporting and analytics experience Areas of Infor module involvement: Compensation / GHR Structure Talent Acquisition Learning Management Transition Management (Onboard/Offboard) Benefits Administration Were looking for a PM to help the HR department with multiple HR module implementations on the Infor ERP suite. The ideal candidate would have a deep track record with HR software platform implementations; full cycle from vendor interface to team assignments to tweaking of the user interface to production of learning collateral. Ideal product familiarity would be with Infor (formerly Lawson). Ideal candidate would be coming out of a vendor side/3rd party software implementer practice Can start immediately.Period of Performance: 8 - 12 Months with possible extensionQualificationsKnowledge of human resources, financial management, health insurance, retirement benefits administration or similar *Required 5 yearsAdditional InformationFor immediate consideration, please send your resume to career(at)cci-worldwide.com with "Business Analyst/Consultant - 3 (JobID WISCJP00014215) - WI
