Name: Continuous Improvement Analyst
Description: Job Description The successful Continuous Improvement Analyst uses analytical skills to efficiently model, design and develop continuous improvement initiatives across the firm's portfolio of workflow applications. He or she will work with the various business units to define, enhance and implement improvements in a way that adds value, removes inefficiencies and mitigates risk while providing documentation, training and support. The Analyst will utilize workflow software to create process models, build user interfaces and forms. Other responsibilities include prioritizing change requests, managing the maintenance of forms and workflows in the production environment, troubleshooting technical support issues and acting as a liaison between the software vendor and Baird IT.  As a Continuous Improvement Analyst , you will: Provide an expert level of technical support and client service via phone and email to our associates in various business units.Research, troubleshoot and resolve technical issues received via phone calls and emails.Provide accurate and creative solutions to client problems of moderate nature to ensure client productivity.Analyze existing automated processes; work with stakeholders to solve process issues, possibly leveraging automation tools.What makes this opportunity great:Team of associates passionate about achieving great results for clients and give back to the communities where we live and workAbility to work a variety of teams and leaders, proving your ability to be flexible and high adaptableCompelling careers working side-by-side with the best in the businessUnique culture that values diverse backgrounds and perspectives while emphasizing teamwork and a strong sense of partnershipMonitor, track and provide metrics on our automated process support modelWhat we look for:Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience of 3+ years in financial services. Business analysis experience preferred.Working knowledge of Object Oriented Programming (e.g. Java, C#) and JavaScriptWorking knowledge of web based applications. Basic knowledge of IT infrastructure and database interaction.Strong skills in Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN) and Business Process Reengineering.Must be able to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences.Strong analytical skills with a focus on detail. Excellent written and verbal communications skills are a must.Who we are: Baird is an employee owned, international wealth management, capital markets, private equity and asset management firm with more than 100 offices in the United States, Europe and Asia. Established in 1919, Baird has over $200 billion in client assets and more than 3,400 associates serving the needs of individual, corporate, institutional and municipal clients.  Baird has built an environment of trust, respect and teamwork, where associates are our greatest asset. As stated in our Associate Promise, we are passionate about how we achieve great outcomes together for our clients, communities and each other. Committed to being a great place to work, Baird ranked No. 12 on the Fortune magazine 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2018, our fifteenth consecutive year on the list. Baird has also received a perfect score on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation's 2018 Corporate Equality Index. To learn more about Baird's culture, click here. #LI-CH1

Name: Transportation Analyst III
Description: Your Role: Responsible for monitoring performance, quality, and cost of domestic and international shipments performed by freight forwarders, carriers and couriers. Analyzes business needs and identifies logistical/financial opportunities that will improve and or reduce costs associated with domestic and international transportation. Ensures the execution and continuous improvement of standard logistics processes. Build reputation within transportation to be a trusted advisor to the internal business partners for transportation / logisticsEffectively partner with all internal / external clients to ensure all functions are performing at established levels of performanceBuilds relations with strategic customers through logistics initiatives. Must work effectively with internal and external partners responsible for executing daily shipping and receiving operations and freight payment activities.****Position is located in Milwaukee, WI**** Principal Duties: Perform detailed analysis of carrier service levels on a monthly, quarterly, and yearly basis. Oversee the performance of transport business partners including level of service, capacity, systems, and contract compliance through Quarterly Management Reviews including development of standardized templates, scorecards, and metrics in order to drive data integrity to ensure high performing partnerships.Prepare and present analytics and cost studies in support of carrier negotiations and rate proposals.Prepare Cost/Benefit analysis for operations modeling projects.Perform transportation network optimization studiesDrives least cost transportation methodologies by analyzing company needs, researching transportation methods and auditing carrier cost and performance. Provide support and identify strategies to improve service while minimizing freight spend. Develop strategic partnerships with transportation carriers, including enhanced partnerships with regional carriers. Develop policies and procedures to support implementation of regional carriers offering the best service at the most economical price and most effective terms.Provide analytical support for cost and quality impact of proposed lane, rate, or regulation changes.Partner with shipping sites to support carrier handling of domestic and international shipments. Works closely with sites as well as procurement team, buyers, and suppliers to ensure Compliance to routing expectations is met. Addresses non-compliance as needed to avoid recurrence. Participate in design and establishment of new procedures, and make suggestions for improvement of existing processes of methods. Collaborate effectively with internal customers, suppliers and other functions within the businessTroubleshoot, perform root cause analysis, and develop corrective actions for transportation related issuesMonitor industry trends and consult with industry peers to keep abreast of changes affecting transportation Demonstrate adaptability and openness to change Demonstrate a high standard of ethics and integrityWho you are: Basic QualificationsEducation: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent business experience; Preference in logistics or related fieldExperience: 3+ years work experience in areas of logistics and / or transportation. Working knowledge of U.S. Export and Customs regulations, import/export documentation and recordkeeping.Preferred Qualifications Requires frequent use and general knowledge of industry practices techniques, and standards. Develops solutions to a variety of problems, typically of moderate scope and complexity.Refers to policies and practices for guidance.Contributes to the completion of organizational projects and goals.Strong computer skills including experience with Microsoft Office applications and database

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Technical Business AnalystABOUT THE POSITION: Another brand new position at our growing company, and a rare chance to join our IT team!  This position is perfect for the person who is passionate about Business Intelligence! We are looking for someone who can develop a strong data warehouse for our booming manufacturing company. We have multiple sources gathering data throughout our locations, and we want to develop a single source for the truth in this new data warehouse! Its a great opportunity for someone who likes to create and make something their own! OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE: Our ideal candidate will start off with a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Management, or related fields. We strongly prefer candidates with formal training in data warehousing, as experience in this field is a must. Candidates should have 5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence (BI) or Business Process Management (BPM) related areas. SQL experience is a must, as well. Because you will also be working with internal customers at all levels of experience and education, candidates must be excellent communicators and able to drive change. HOW YOU WILL MAKE A DIFFERENCE: You will EXPLORE, INNOVATE, & PERFORM:By deploying and supporting company Business Intelligence reporting systemsBy developing and supporting Business Process Management systemsBy deploying and supporting newly approved technologies with business leadersBy serving as project manager for technical projects with large IT impactBy assisting the Director of IT with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Database Management tasksBy developing standardized technical business processes to support 1st prioritiesBy contributing to system/applications designs with focus on data integrity, ease of use, and reporting/analytics developmentBy researching new technologies to continuously improve our IT prioritiesBy developing and documenting department standard practices Job Type: Full-time  Education: Bachelor's (Preferred)

Name: Recruiting Reporting Analyst, Virtual - RPO
Description: This position is responsible for the ongoing data collection and reporting of Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO) program information, obtained from a variety of data sources. It involves development and preparation of information products for the client and program operations team. This position requires the ability to analyze program data from conceptualization through presentation of the data. It requires proficiency with company software and Microsoft Office Suite, basic knowledge of data analysis methodology, use of presentation software, strong communications skills and a strong commitment and affinity for delivering the highest level of client service. This position will work remote/virtual.The Recruiting Reporting Analyst: Performs routine audits to ensure accuracy and quality assurance of system dataDevelops complex spreadsheets, documents, reports, and presentations including the following: weekly/monthly/quarterly reports, organization specific reports, standing calls, quarterly business reviews, key performance indicators, and historical documentationEnsures, through review and verification, that informational product deliverables meet specifications including timeliness and qualityPerforms basic data analysis in support of ad hoc and standing requests to meet SLA schedulesResearches, analyzes, and responds to one-off data inquiries that are routine in natureFollows up as needed to obtain relevant data and clarifies incomplete or inaccurate dataDevelops and maintains operational process-specific and reporting-specific job aids and templatesProvides system administration support for Candidate Relationship Management (CRM) and Applicant Tracking System (ATS) platforms utilized by RPO program teams. Support activities include user account setup, troubleshooting, configuration, and other tasks as assigned when needed.Performs other duties and special projects as assignedBachelor's degree preferred or equivalent experience in the recruiting or talent acquisition fieldProficiency in Microsoft Office Suite of programs, particularly Excel and PowerPointAt least 1 year of experience with manipulating data using Microsoft Excel, specifically VLOOKUPs, formulas and pivot tables requiredAt least 1 year of experience working directly on, or in support of, the Talent Acquisition functionExcellent organization, problem solving, analytical, verbal and written communication, and interpersonal skills, with high attention to detail and the ability to function under pressure and meet deadlines are requiredManpowerGroup is an EOE/AA/Vets/Disabled Employer

Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: Job Title: Pricing Analyst*DRS Technologies*DRS Technologies* is a leading supplier of integrated products, services and support to military forces, intelligence agencies and prime contractors worldwide. Focused on defense technology, we develop, manufacture and support a broad range of systems for mission critical and military sustainment requirements, as well as homeland security. Headquartered in Arlington, VA, the Company is a wholly owned subsidiary of Leonardo S.p.A. which employs more than 70,000 people worldwide. We offer a competitive compensation package and a business culture which rewards performance. For additional information on DRS, please visit our website at www.drs.com. DRS Company*DRS Naval Power Systems (NPS)* a multi-site operation responsible for $350 million of revenue with locations in Milwaukee, WI, Bridgeport/Danbury, CT, Fitchburg, MA, and High Ridge, MO with an employee base of approximately 900 employees. NPS is structured into four Lines of Business: Power, Machines, Nuclear Instrumentation and Controls, and Marlo Coil, focusing on supporting the power and propulsion needs of the U.S. Navy. We provide engineering, manufacturing and lifetime support of our highly engineered products.Job Location: *Milwaukee, WIPosition Summary* The Pricing Analyst reviews requests for proposals (RFP?s) to identify requirements and assist the proposal team in developing and submitting compliant responses, works with internal organizations to determine anticipated labor and overhead rates, material requirements, equipment costs, and possible bid strategies. This position develops, evaluates and implements pricing, pricing strategies, and models based upon current business and competitive market dynamics. Duties and Responsibilities:*Reviews Requests for Proposals to identify requirements and assist the proposal team in developing proposals compliant with the RFP, company procedures, and government regulations (FAR/DFARS)Works with internal organizations to determine anticipated labor and material requirements, equipment costs, and possible bid strategiesAnalyzes estimates against previous cost experience and recommends adjustmentsConducts payback, risk, cash, and revenue analysisSupport pricing, audit, and negotiation activitiesPartners with Sales/Marketing, Business Development, Program Management, and Finance to correctly position product portfolio and establish pricing programs aligned with product/sales strategy and revenue recognition requirementsCreates/administers pricing databases and coordinates implementation of pricing proposals across the organizationBasic Qualifications:*Bachelor?s Degree in Finance with 5+ years directly related of experience, preferably in a DOD/government contracting environment (or equivalent combination of education/training and experience)Pricing Tool (ProPricer) experienceExperience with advanced data analysis, management, and computational tools including Microsoft Excel pivot tables, SQL, VBAPhysical Requirements:* While performing the duties of this job, the employee requires normal manual dexterity, speech and hearing. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to thirty-five (35) pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job require frequent use of a computer monitor. Physical Demands:* The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  We offer a very competitive base salary commensurate with experience and a business culture which rewards good performance. The Company offers a full range of employee benefits.  Candidates must be a US citizen and meet DRS security standards as imposed by DoD, including the issuance of any necessary security clearance by the US government within a reasonable time after commencement of employment.  DRS Technologies is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital or veteran status, or any other category protected by federal, state or local law. #JS #NPS

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: The Financial Analyst I will assist the Commercial Relationship Managers in the development and analysis of all types of credit information to support lending decisions for the bank. They will maintain and promote a customer service environment to satisfy and exceed customer needs and expectations. The Financial Analyst I is accountable to maintain and support the lending process.Key Accountabilities:Ensure accuracy of financial analysisEnsure adherence to lending directivesAssist in negotiations of terms and conditions of loan agreementsAssist in preparation of loan proposals and commitmentsDevelop credit information for use by commercial relationship managers in making lending decisions on new, renewal and extension loansPrepare and analyze spreadsheets, financial information, financial statements and related materialProduce a variety of reports used to assess credit information such as risk rating reports and loan transaction summaries (LTS). Prepare summary, present facts and offer opinions concerning credit worthiness.Knowledge and Skills:Formalized credit training required with at least two years of underwriting experience on companies in excess of $20 million in revenues One to four years of relevant corporate finance, commercial lending, accounting or due diligence experience, preferably in a bank, finance company or accounting firm environment An undergraduate degree is requiredSolid financial analysis, research and business due diligence skills Experience with analyzing and managing cash flow loans Self motivated with a history of meeting and exceeding goals Strong analytical and written communication skills Excellent interpersonal skills Team playerWe’re here to helpAt BMO Harris Bank we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the center of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.As a member of the BMO Harris Bank team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.To find out more visit us at https://bmoharriscareers.com.BMO Harris Bank is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. BMO Harris Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer for all, inclusive of Minorities, Women, Veterans, and Persons with Disabilities.

Name: Financial Analyst II
Description: Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all fun. JOB SUMMARY: Position targeted as financial analyst covering the Debit platform. Develops, interprets and implements financial concepts for financial planning and control. GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIESPerforms technical analysis to determine present and future financial performance.Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes recommendations for financial plans, acquisition activity, trended future requirements and operating forecasts.Meets with organizational unit/department managers to discuss and establish timelines and methodologies for completing budgets.Researches and compiles data to forecast and prepare annual and monthly budget projections for a division or similar group of organizations.Tracks revenue and expenses on a monthly basis, comparing actual to forecasted figures and makes necessary adjustments.Performs economic research and studies in areas of rates of return, depreciations, working capital requirements, investment opportunities, investment performance and impact of governmental requirements.Prepares reports for management summarizing results of research, analyses and evaluation of any discrepancies.Gathers and analyzes current data to aid in estimating future expenditures.Other related duties assigned as needed.EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s degree in accounting/finance. GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIESGood understanding of generally accepted accounting principles as well as company accounting policies, procedures and standardsCommunicates ideas both verbally and in written form in a clear, concise and professional mannerAbility to analyze and solve problems using learned techniques and toolsAnalytical and statistical examination skillsAbility to understand and apply learned conceptsAttention to detail, accuracy and confidentialityDemonstrated ability to plan and accomplish work to ensure critical deadlines are metAbility to create spreadsheets and demonstrated proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office and accounting softwareAbility to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, clients and publicFIS JOB LEVEL DESCRIPTION Developing level professional role. Moderate skills with high level of proficiency. Works under general supervision with increased latitude for independent judgment. Identifies non-routine issues and routes/escalates to appropriate team member. Works on multiple concurrent projects of medium complexity. Is an active team member, contributes to complex projects to gain experience, shares ideas and suggests process improvements appropriate for level of experience. Consults with senior peers on semi-complex processes to learn through experience. Certification may be required.

Name: Employee Relations Senior Analyst
Description: Job descriptionAccenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions – underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network – Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 425,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.  People in our Client Delivery & Operations career track drive delivery and capability excellence through the design, development and/or delivery of a solution, service, capability or offering. They grow into delivery-focused roles, and can progress within their current role, laterally or upward.  Program Specialist Services professionals provide project-based support services within centers. These professionals support the delivery and execution of our key projects with specialized services.  Job Description  Customer Service Delivery professionals includes the management of customer interactions to increase customer satisfaction and improve service quality.The ER Sr. Analyst assesses and resolves complex investigatory Employee Relations cases that require client facing time, while ensuring consistency and efficiency for the customer. The ER Sr. Analyst develops a strategy for handling each case identification of parties to include in the investigation, create and gather documentation, making the determination and implementing resolutions. The ER Sr. Analyst provides a single point of contact for the service requestor to ensure clear communication with regard to resolution of the request.The role will have the following responsibilities:Must be familiar with geographical region policy differentiation and manages specific districtsIdentify, assess and resolve complex cases that have been assigned by a centralized ER Case Worker, utilizing the tools and processes set forthSeeks advice and escalates issues when appropriateHandle multiple cases and prioritize activities to meet client deadlines and quality standardsExecute processes and advise customers and clients on areas of employee relationsProvide clear communication and follow up to both the requestor and client as appropriateConduct investigations, research policies practices, create and gather documentations, make determinations and implement resolutions as requiredProvide appropriate documentation while utilizing the case management toolsFinalize case work when necessary to close in system as requiredMaintain strict confidentiality throughout conversations, investigations and while handling documentation to meet client requirementsEffectively utilize the case resources i.e. Coordinator to resolve client issues efficiently and effectivelyAdvise Case Worker on improvements to processes+ Basic qualifications Basic QualificationsMinimum of 3 years of experience in Employee Relations Case WorkMinimum of 2 years of experience with Workflow tool managementMinimum of 3 years of experience with case managementMinimum of 3 years of experience with direct client interactionPreferred QualificationsBachelor's degreeProfessional Skill Requirements Proven success in contributing to a team-oriented environmentProven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environmentDesire to work in an information systems environmentExcellent leadership, communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skillsApplicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture.  Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.  Accenture is a federal contractor and an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity  All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.  Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.  Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

Name: SAP Process Business Analyst (TPM)
Description: Job Details: Summary: This role will support the SAP Process Lead, primarily by focusing business process analysis and re-engineering, with an understanding of SAP Trade Promotion Management (TPM) technical problems and solutions as they relate to the current and future business environment. Creates process change by integrating new processes with existing ones and communicating these changes to impacted business process owners and IT organization.  Requires high level understanding of organization's business systems and industry requirements. Liaison with the business to document and create solution designs. Assists with the daily AMS operations and leads general administrative support to the outsourced support partner.  May participate in the development, implementation and maintenance of SAP strategies, plans and projects. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Work with business process owners to understand existing and emergency requirements; research and evaluate alternativesRecommend appropriate SAP solutions while analyzing and evaluating the impact of current processes/businessCreate and review detailed requirement analysis document and functional specifications based on business requirementsWork with the outsourced support partner to identify, develop, implement, test, and support enhancements to the SAP systemPartner with outsourced support partner to ensure optimal deliveryEnsure the system change requests adhere to the SAP Global templatePerform system regression testing for new releases or upgrades to SAPBe the liaison between the business and the outsourced support partnerEnsure disciplined use of SAP systemParticipate in SAP projects as SMERequired Skills / Experience / Competencies:Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Technology, Computer Science or other related fieldMinimum of 5 years’ experience in SAP TPM applications.Strong knowledge of the integration of SAP TPM with other SAP modules.Preferred Skills / Experience / Competencies:Strong written and verbal communication skills including ability to develop presentations and present to managementStrong knowledge and understanding of business principles, practices and proceduresDemonstrated problem solving and negotiation skillsStrong project management skills and experienceStrong demonstrable experience as an application consultant in a significant enterprise applications areaEstablished experience in the orchestration of metrics/management reportingCompetencies: Ethics and ValuesInformingProblem SolvingWritten CommunicationsConflict ManagementProcess ManagementTime ManagementPriority SettingBuilding Effective Teams SC Johnson & Son, Inc. is an equal employment opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, ancestry, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Name: Junior Salesforce Business Analyst - DHQ
Description: OverviewProvides critical information for The Salvation Army's planning and decision making using Salesforce/NGOC, third party ETL tools. Reporting to the Divisional Development Director and working closely with the Division's leadership and staff, the Business Analyst will contribute to the development department's effectiveness by supporting end users through consultation and analysis resulting in list production and reporting. Assists, advises, and represents the division by performing select database management duties at the direction of the Divisional Development Director that require initiative, independent judgement, and knowledge of the Division's activities and staff responsibilities. The Salvation Army Mission: The Salvation Army, an international movement, is an evangelical part of the universal Christian church. Its message is based on the Bible. Its ministry is motivated by the love of God. Its mission is to preach the gospel of Jesus Christ and to meet human needs in His name without discrimination.ResponsibilitiesThis job description should not be interpreted as all inclusive. It is intended to identify the essential functions and requirements of the position. Other job related responsibilities and tasks may be assigned. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions. Assist the Development Director in overseeing the development and implementation of vision, policies, plans, procedures, and automated processes for fundraising systems and operations.Assist the Development Director in maintaining the Salesforce/NGOC platform, and provide support for integrated and aligned fundraising tools, subscriptions and services.Extract information from the Salesforce/NGOC platform to support the development mission of senior management, fundraising staff have access to data required to perform their jobs effectively.Ensure that software and business processes run smoothly to ensure efficient flow of data, smooth integration between systems and the confidentiality and security of constituent information.Produce or assist with the production of financial, analytical and demographic queries.Initiate a formal data request process for users that ensures information requests are tracked and completed in a timely manner.Provide guidance and assistance in coordinating database de-duping, address updates, data cleanup, and data batch processing projects.Ensure consistent tracking and evaluating of digital/online strategies via Salesforce/NGOC and other applications.Document procedures for using reporting tools and specific reports, including assisting the Development Director in determining appropriate levels of access and facilitating end user access/security.Assist in training staff and end users in the use of Salesforce/NGOC. QualificationsThe requirements listed below are representative of the minimal education, experience, skills, and/or abilities required for this position.  Education:  Bachelor's Degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field, or Five years of progressively responsible experience managing data for relational and/or multi-dimensional databases.  Experience: Minimum of three years of ongoing experience working with non-profit information systems or Salesforce.Experience with fundraising with fundraising database management systems, database reporting, and office productively packages. NGO Connect experience preferred. Skills/Abilities: Knowledge of File Transfer Protocol (FTP) technologies.Knowledge of Extract Transform Load (ETL) technologies.Knowledge of data migration and implementation.Ability to successfully manage multiple objectives and action steps/tasks in a timely and effective manner.Ability to create, develop, and present new ideas/concepts to meet requirements and needs of system users.Ability to achieve successful outcomes in handling difficult situations and users.Ability to act independently to resolve problems and issues.Ability to train users in a variety of methods and settings.Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with the users at the Corps, Area Command, and Divisional levels of the organization.Ability to develop materials and resources for training purposes.Supervisory Responsibility: None Physical Requirements:The physical requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the duties of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions of this job. Physical requirements include: good speaking, hearing and vision ability, and excellent manual dexterity. Lifting, pulling, and pushing of materials up to 25 pounds. Requires bending, squatting and walking. May stand for extend periods. Travel: Occasional travel in the Territory, some may be overnight. Working Conditions: Work is performed in a typical office environment. Full-time position; may require some weekend and evening work. All employees recognize that The Salvation Army is a church and agree that they will do nothing as an employee of The Salvation Army to undermine its religious mission.

Name: Data Analyst II
Description: With general direction and some latitude for independent judgement and discretion, this position is responsible for data analysis and technical support for inbound and outbound data quality in accordance with established Service Level Agreements (SLA's). REPORTING STRUCTURE & WORK SETTING This position typically performs work at a WageWorks site and reports to a Supervisor or Manager of Data Integration Services or another leader with responsibility for data integration. ESSENTIAL DUTIES & PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES NOTE: The essential duties and primary accountabilities below are intended to describe the general content of and requirements of this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive statement of duties. Incumbents may perform all or most of the primary accountabilities listed below. Specific tasks, responsibilities or competencies may be documented in the incumbent's performance objectives as outlined by the incumbent's immediate supervisor or manager. Responds to basic and common technical issues to provide support for data issues.Monitors receipt and posting of inbound files.Processes and delivers outbound data files to clients, third parties or vendors within established SLAs.Evaluates and monitors data quality including exception and error handling.Researches inconsistent data loads and addresses issues.Develops, maintains and provides documentation on processes, and case resolution procedures for future reference or use.MARGINAL DUTIES & ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONSPerforms other duties as assigned or apparent.ADDITIONAL PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS WageWorks believes that our success is achieved by its People. Values describe how we work together to achieve our success. It is our employees that drive results through living our Company Values. Every employee at WageWorks is expected to uphold and demonstrate the six Company Values listed below as an additional component of the job description and as a standard of individual performance.  CARING People are the heart of our company. We care about people: our Clients, our Client's employees and their families, our partners, and local communities, and our fellow employees at WageWorks.  CUSTOMER-CENTRIC Our Customer comes first. We aim to serve our Clients and their employees, our brokers and partners, as well as our internal customers.  PASSIONATE We love what we do and are passionate about delivering Consumer-Directed Benefits that save people money and enrich their lives.  ACCOUNTABLE We are dedicated to making our team and the company succeed, and we are open, honest, ethical, and conscientious, as we deliver on our commitments.  LEADING Our actions inspire new ideas and drive change each and every day.  RESPECTFUL We value the diversity of our people, treat them with dignity and respect, encourage their development and reward their performance. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY NOTE: WageWorks leadership will strive to uphold the mission, vision, and values of the organization. They will serve as role models for staff and act in a people-centered and results oriented manner with a focus on customer service.  No formal supervisory responsibility entailed, although this position may serve as a resource for other employees. ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIESEDUCATION: Knowledge of business and technology normally obtained through the completion of a Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Business Administration or a closely related field or equivalent combination of education and experience WORK EXPERIENCE OR RELATED EXPERIENCE: Experience should include at least one to two years of technical work experience including: ability to analyze and monitor data updates to ensure integrity of data, working with electronic files, analyzing and troubleshooting data, working in a client facing environment, and working knowledge of SQL. SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES: Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills are essential. Robust analytical skills and the ability to quickly assess client and systems issues as well as research/investigate technical systems transactions.  Driven for results and able to demonstrate a sense of urgency in a frequently interrupted environment are essential. Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize workload. Basic knowledge of SQL language and ability to read and edit existing SQL scripts.  The ability to interact effectively with team members, customers, developers and other staff is required. Excellent listening, communication and interpersonal skills are required. Excellent writing and editing skills are necessary to transfer information to individuals. A strong customer service orientation is essential. A demonstrated ability to adapt to the changing demands of business is necessary. EQUIPMENT: Proficiency with business and communications software (preferably Word, PowerPoint, common Windows operating systems, and Outlook) is required.. Advanced hands-on knowledge of Excel and a text editing tool (such as Ultra Edit, Notepad++, etc.) is required. TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS & CONDITIONS Infrequent travel may be required. WORK ENVIRONMENT CONDITIONS & DEMANDS Work is generally performed in an office environment in which there is only minimal exposure to unpleasant and/or hazardous working conditions. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & DEMANDS Work requires normal range of hearing and eyesight. Incumbent must be able to use a telephone or headset equipment and operate a keyboard and other office equipment. The ability to perform work at a computer terminal for 6-8 hours a day and function in an environment with frequent interruptions is required. At times, incumbents are subject to sitting for prolonged periods. Infrequently, incumbent must be able to lift and move material weighing up to 20 lbs. Incumbent may experience elevated levels of stress during periods of increased activity and with work entailing multiple deadlines.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions as described.SDL2017

Name: Decision Support Analyst
Description: How You'll Make a Difference: Analyzes and interprets report requests, determines appropriate data sets, develops and tests reports, and distributes results to meet the information needs of physicians, leaders and patient care. Ensures successful implementation, administration, and documentation of new and existing reports. Assists with the development of data models and databases to streamline reporting and enable effective decision support.  Applies advanced reporting tools and techniques to streamline operational reporting processes and provide efficiencies.  Performs data analysis to support ongoing data requirements and initiatives.  Serves as a resource on data models and reporting related tools and technologies.  Develops, implements, and administers new and existing reports. Proactively anticipates reporting needs and offers recommendations for value-added data and reports. Creates effective data collection processes used to report findings. Analyses and manipulates data, interacts with multiple business partners, and develops reports for internal needs.  Collaborates with application support staff to identify and troubleshoot problems with data and reports, including researching workflows and data sources, reviewing data integrity, and implementing solutions.  Maintains ongoing data integrity to ensure accuracy, which includes auditing reports to identify and resolve data integrity issues, proactively developing ways to improve systems and processes, and making appropriate recommendations for changes.  Generates and distributes reports, ensuring consistency and adherence to compliance standards and definitions. What it Will Take:Licenses & Certifications None Required. Degrees Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent knowledge) in Business or related field. Required Functional Experience Typically requires 3 years of experience in data analysis and report development including experience in database structures and/or in billing/operations functions in a health care environment. Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Knowledgeable in integrated electronic healthcare records, practice management systems, health care data reporting, data warehouses, data registries, relational databases, and health care industry product services and operations. Proficiency in Microsoft Office, EHR Clarity, SQL, EPIC, Crystal Reports, queries, and similar products. Experienced in the use of data analysis principles, data manipulations methods and tools, and report development software. Knowledge of health care regulatory and compliance requirements at the local, state, and federal level. Ability to identify and solve problems creatively and to work within deadlines with a high attention to detail. Strong presentation and interpersonal skills. Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language and to influence others to move toward consensus on decisions. Excellent organization, prioritization and time management skills. Scheduled Hours: Full-Time Exempt Department: Med Grp Decision Support Location Address: 3355 W Forest Home Ave  Milwaukee, WI  53215-2843  Milwaukee At Aurora Health Care: We pride ourselves on taking care of our people. And not just our patients—we mean you, too. We help each other live well. When you work at Aurora, you get the chance to work with a dedicated team that’s as passionate about the work as you are. Here, you’ll find limitless opportunities for ongoing learning, career advancement, competitive compensation and a stable work environment. But more than that, you have the opportunity to change lives—including your own.  Diversity and inclusion matters at Aurora. We celebrate our differences and nurture an environment where everyone feels included. We know that when we reflect the communities we serve, when we embrace differences and bring our whole selves to work every day, we are working as one to build a healthier tomorrow for everyone. Aurora supports a safe, healthy and drug-free work environment through criminal background checks and pre-employment drug testing. We maintain a smoke-free environment at all our locations. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Experienced Investment Banking Analyst
Description: Job Description Baird's Equity Capital Markets group includes more than 500 professionals in research, institutional sales and trading, and investment banking. Our Global Investment Banking group provides M&A, debt advisory, and equity and debt financing services to middle-market companies. There are approximately 270 banking professionals serving clients globally.  We are seeking a highly motivated experienced Investment Banking Analyst with at least one year of Investment Banking experience to join our team in Milwaukee, WI.  As an Investment Banking Analyst, you will: Play an integral role on investment banking teams, providing analytical support on mergers and acquisitions, public offerings and other financial advisory services for our clients.Assist in the preparation of company valuations, financial models, company marketing documents and client presentations in addition to performing research and various analyses in support of new business generation.Develop your skills through broad exposure to both junior and senior bankers.What makes this opportunity great:Gain relevant experience in all areas of a transaction, from preparation of marketing materials to facilitation of due diligenceUnique culture that values diverse backgrounds and perspectives while emphasizing teamwork and a strong sense of partnershipAchieve professional development through lean deal teams which provide greater responsibility and daily interaction with senior bankersWhat we look for:Candidates with experience working in a fast-pace professional environment who can hit the ground running.At least 12 months of full-time experience working at a top-tier investment bank.Candidates must have a proven academic record and an interest in Finance.The ideal candidate will have:An enduring work ethic and track record of successThe ability to function equally well in both a team setting and on a self-directed basisExcellent mathematical, writing, verbal and computer skills.Series 63 & 79 licensing preferred or the ability to quickly obtainWho we are: For nearly 100 years, Baird has provided high-quality financial advice and services with clients' best interests in mind. Employee owned and independent, Baird serves individuals, foundations, organizations and municipalities across the country as well as corporations and institutions around the world from more than100 offices in the U.S., Europe and Asia. Baird has more than $200 billion in client assets.  Baird's Equity Capital Markets group includes 500 professionals in research, institutional sales and trading, and investment banking. Baird is also home to a global private equity group, Baird Capital, that has invested in nearly 300 companies over its history.  As one of the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For since 2004, Baird attracts many of the financial service industry's leading and most experienced professionals as well as top talent from the nation's finest universities. From day one, our new associates benefit from collaborative, mentoring relationships, often interacting with senior executives at the companies we cover and getting to know our best institutional clients. The result is a truly enriching experience that provides opportunities to build your existing skills and develop a keen understanding of the industry. Discover a firm with a vested interest in your professional future. To learn more about Baird's culture, click here.

Name: Conversion Analyst II - EFT Debit
Description: Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all fun. About the team EFT Services – New Berlin Solutions are delivered on our award-winning line of software solutions combined with industry-leading third-party products to deliver a comprehensive suite of payments processing solutions to our customers. EFD provides a single source for all your debit payments processing needs including transaction processing, ATM driving and monitoring, and card management.  The EFT Debit conversion team is responsible for the day-to-day planning and management of each project they are assigned. This includes all parts of the project, including but not limited to gathering business requirements for the FIS products sold and analyzing how these FIS products can meet the financial institution’s needs. What you will be doing As a Conversion Analyst on the New Berlin EFT Debit Implementation team, you will be first point of contact for our clients throughout the implementation process. In addition, you will be responsible for managing the overall process, including coordinating FIS, Client, and Third-Party communications. You will also be responsible for the coordination of all network and testing components of the system implementation. Creating and Maintaining project plansProviding high-quality customer serviceAccessing and navigating HP Connects databaseEffectively utilizing in-house tools such as Case Management system (CMS), Commitment tool, Data Navigator, SSG (Self-service Gateway)What you bring:Knowledge of EFT debit ProcessingEFT Banking knowledgeAbility to work independently and as a team playerStrong ability to research and resolve issuesStrong written and verbal communication skillsHigh attention to detailFlexibility, versatility, dependabilityAdded bonus if you have:z/OS system knowledge to verify that files are availableFile Transfer Protocol with SSL - mainframeConnect Direct (NDM) with SSLTCP/IP and general networkingSkilled at creating Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Visio diagramsWhat we offer youA multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunitiesVaried and challenging work to help you grow your technical skillsetA broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technologyTime to support charities and give back in your communityAttractive benefits including private medical cover, dental cover, and travel insurance

Name: Compensation Analyst
Description: How You'll Make a Difference: Responsible for assisting with the development, implementation, and evaluation of compensation programs. Responsibilities include job analysis/evaluation, development of job descriptions, compensation program analysis and administration. Interprets pay practices and policies and assists with the preparation and implementation of the compensation projects.  Conducts job analysis, evaluation and competitive market pricing for assigned business unit(s) and communicates the methodology and results to HR partners and management within agreed upon time frames. Ensures current pricing methodology is established and maintained for each job.  Assists HR partners and management with the development and/or revision of job descriptions. Ensures uniformity, clarity, completeness and proper format.  Accurately maintains job and position information within all human resources management systems.  Audit compensation related data in human resources management system including job codes, titles, FLSA status, structure information and various salary actions. Troubleshoot data issues and works with the HR Systems team, HR and management staff to resolve discrepancies.  Provides advice on policy and practice interpretation and pay decisions. Partners with talent aquisition and HR team on pay offers. Conducts market studies and cost analysis for assigned business unit (s). Monitors the effectiveness of existing compensation policies and practics to ensure cost effective and consistent use inline with the intent of the polices, practices and corporate objectives. What it Will Take:Licenses & Certifications None Required. Degrees Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources or related field. Required Functional Experience Typically requires 3 years of experience in human resources that includes experience in compensation. Name: HRIS Analyst
Description: The HRIS Analyst is responsible for configuration, user security, system table maintenance, reporting and technical support to Veolia HRIS users. The HRIS Analyst develops in-depth understanding of all the system tools supporting HR and Payroll core functions and serves as a technical expert in consulting with stakeholders. They leverage their understanding of HR and Payroll to articulate how technology can enable HR/Payroll processes. Other responsibilities include performing routine data audits and data analysis while working closely with the HRIS Manager to ensure data accuracy and integrity in the HRIS systems. Manages and maintains all inbound and outbound interfaces. Develops and generates reports, as needed to meet internal and external reporting requirements and serves as a project resource for projects as assigned.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES / JOB DUTIES• Provide superior customer service by consulting with HR & Payroll Partners and business stakeholders to define data needs and provide solutions to those needs.• Respond to Shared Services support cases for user assistance, operator or configuration maintenance, reporting or other systems requests.• Provide support for HRIS including, but not limited to, researching, troubleshooting and resolving HRIS problems, unexpected results or process flaws; perform scheduled activities; recommend solutions or alternate methods to meet requirements. Partners with HR & Payroll colleagues to identify impact of product issues across other HR functions. Work with system experts, including suppliers, to resolve technical issues.• Provide ongoing system administration, support system maintenance and technology questions. Ensures ongoing regulatory compliance with company policies and legal controls.• Develop user procedures, guidelines and documentation. Train new and existing internal users on new processes/functionality. • Manage small to medium scale projects/initiatives or serves on project teams. These types of projects include system upgrades, conversions, enhancements, etc. Frequently interface with SMEs, users, management and/or other resources to ensure quality, timeliness and testing of all project/release work.• Create, coordinate and execute test plans for projects, and ensure that test cases and results meet requirements and are documented.• Consult with users/SMEs to define, gather and document functional business requirements. Conduct fit-gap assessments, document current and future state process flows; understand and maintain knowledge of the business areas within HR/Payroll. Create/update process documentation for HR transactions across multiple applications.• Provide analysis and support for system interface modifications, define requirements and work with technical resources to implement new interfaces to both internal and external customers. Partner closely with outsourced and third party providers to create integration and interfaces. Performs troubleshooting, resolving issues and performing operational activities including interfacing data transfers into and out of HRIS. • Provides oversight of processes; assist with security and table maintenance. Collaborates with HR/Payroll teams regarding the proper security needed for creating/modifying security roles. Ensures roles are created properly and contain the proper access to HRIS systems and HR interface systems. Assigns, maintains and regularly audits security for users. Implements safeguards to ensure employee data privacy and protection. • Individual development - Maintain awareness of current trends and best practices in HRIS with a focus on product and service development, delivery and support, and applying key technologies. Examine trends in information systems training, materials and techniques. Through professional associations, training classes, reading, CBTs or other mechanisms, continuously increase both HR and Payroll knowledge and HRIS application/tools knowledge. Participate in user group meetings/conferences.  Educational Background• A bachelor's degree and minimum 5 years’ experience with various HR processes and disciplines (Recruiting, Benefits, Payroll, Leaves of Absence); or equivalent combination of education and experience.Specific Job Skills• Demonstrated knowledge of and experience with interface design and support, and ability to read and write specifications.• Demonstrated strong attention to detail, accuracy, problem-solving, critical thinking. Anticipates problems; sees how a problem and its solution will affect other units; gathers information before making decisions; weighs alternatives against objectives and arrives at reasonable decisions; adapts well to changing priorities, deadlines and directions; works to eliminate all processes which do not add value; is willing to take action, even under pressure, criticism or tight deadlines; takes informed risks; recognizes and accurately evaluates the signs of a problem; analyzes current procedures for possible improvements; notifies supervisor of problems in a timely manner.• Must be very analytical, a quick learner, proactive and passionate about HRIS with the ability to create and deliver high quality, finished work product.• Solid technical skills. Human Resources Information System (“HRIS”) or other related systems experience. • Strong interpersonal skills in dealing with all levels of employees and management.• Effective written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to explain data and findings to non-technical audience; conduct meetings, plan communication, and organize tasks and deployment schedule for technology tasks. Must have a passion for excellence in customer service.• Ability to execute tasks independently as well as collaborating with team members from various business functions; Ability to prioritize work and multi-task. Significant attention to detail required. Ability to maintain confidentiality with sensitive data.• Thorough functional understanding and knowledge of HR processes and workflows.• Ability to read, design analyze and update workflow, process flow or system diagrams.• Data analysis – Understand HR data, provide consulting support for data loading into systems or extraction as necessary.• Reporting – ability to write and analyze reports, review system audit reports and make recommendations on process or technical changes.Work Experience• Must have strong knowledge and proficiency in the use of MS Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access & Google).• A minimum of 2 years of experience as a user of ADP• Sarbanes-Oxley (“SOX”) experience required.• HR business knowledge – Two years directly related experience working in HR, Payroll or Benefits Administration; working knowledge and expertise of HR functions and business rules including payroll, compensation, recruiting and staffing practices and benefits.• Working knowledge of HR system (ADP Global View/SAP, eTime, SuccessFactors Employee Central, etc.), infrastructure and configuration.• Excellent command of English – fluency in Spanish or French desired.

Name: Sr. Process Analyst
Description: Agile is software development and management method that serves as an alternative to traditional methodologies, specifically within the field of software development. As such, Scrum Master lead software implementation teams, often supporting a Coach implementing this new method for the first time, meaning that in addition to performing his servant leadership responsibilities, they are also supporting driving learning and adoption. The goal of a Scrum Master is to serve the Agile team by removing impediments, facilitating ceremonies, preserving and protecting the agile principles and values. Scrum Masters represent their team externally and support them by shielding them from unnecessary external interference with the ultimately goal of enabling continuous delivery of business value.Scrum Master Profile 1. Servant Leader Must be able to garner respect from his her team and be willing to get their hands dirty to get the job done2. Communicative and social Must be able to communicate well with teams3. Facilitative Must be able to lead and demonstrate value add principles to a team4. Assertive Must be able to ensure Agile Scrum concepts and principles are adhered to, must be able to be a voice of reason and authority, make the tough calls.5. Situationally Aware Must be the first to notice differences and issues as they arise and elevate them to management6. Enthusiastic Must be high energy7. Continual improvement Must continually be growing ones craft learning new tools and techniques to manage oneself and a team8. Conflict resolution Must be able to facilitate discussion and facilitate alternatives or different approaches9. Attitude of empowerment Must be able to lead a team to self organization10. Attitude of transparency Must desire to bring disclosure and transparency to the business about development and grow business trustScrum Master Skills 1. Understand basic fundamentals of iterative development2. Understand other processes and methodologies and can speak intelligently about them and leverage other techniques to provide value to a team enterprise3. Understand basic fundamentals of software development processes and procedures4. Understand the value of commitments to delivery made by a development team5. Understand incremental delivery and the value of metrics6. Understand backlog tracking, burndown metrics, velocity, and task definition7. Familiarity with common Agile practices, service oriented environments, and better development practicesResponsibilities 1. Educate and train team members on Agile foundations, values and principles2. Train the team on Scrum3. Train the team on Kanban4. Train the team, ARTS, portfolios and strategists on SAFe5. Work imbedded with the agile teams to mentor and coach team members on the job6. Lead by example in terms of practice and adoption of agile culture7. Ensure Agile adoption of agile team follows Agile CoE guidelines 8. Establish continuous improvement process for agile teams focusing on their processes and outcomes product 9. Collaborate with Agile and DevOps coaching community in the continuous advance of the client agile framework and tools10. Provide guidance and training to leaders and managers11. Advise stakeholders on the proper techniques and methods to rollout agile adoption12. Function as key drivers for facilitating the removal of impediments outside of team control.Certifications- Relevant Agile advanced certifications through Scrum Alliance, Scrum.org, ScrumInc, LeanKanban University, SAFe and Disciplined Agile Consortium B TECH

Name: Financial Analyst

Rite-Hite is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer offering a drug free workplace for our customers and employees.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: What you will do  Under general direction of the Core Returns Group Manager and in conformance with Corporate and Business Group policies and procedures, this position is responsible for compiling, analyzing, and reporting timely monthly financial results and key performance indicators for the US/Canada Core Returns process in addition to supporting launch of various enterprise improvement initiatives. Name: Workforce Analyst
Description: Adelman Travel Group is looking for a Workforce Analyst to join our growing team.  Telecommuting may be considered for the right candidate. Preferred locations include but are not limited to: Scottsdale, AZ; Dallas, TX; Minneapolis, MN; Milwaukee, WI; Madison, WI; Chicago, IL; Raleigh, NC; New York, NY; Austin, TX; Seattle, WA; Portland, OR. POSITION SUMMARY This position will optimize resources to achieve business objectives by designing annual workload and staffing plans for omnichannel contact environment, including building forecasting and staffing models while identifying creative staffing solutions, and utilization of telephony systems to design workflow logic. Additionally, this role acts as Subject Matter Expert for routing of workload types. Essential Functions Statement(s): Develop, execute and maintain workload and staffing plans across an omnichannel environment, in order to improve coverage and achieve client service level agreements as well as business goals and objectives. Utilize Workforce Management Tool to assess staffing levels on a daily basis to ensure a sufficient amount of staff is available to perform all required tasks. Analyze systems and summarize information to highlight trends and forecast staffing needs; Produce reports & collaborate with Implementations, Human Resources, Finance and Operations teams to review staffing levels based on business needs and budget. Identify opportunities to improve efficiency and quality within the team and organization, make recommendations for improvements. Develop and maintain operational performance reports. Serve as first point of contact and subject matter expert for questions regarding routing of workload types. Maintain constant communication with Operations Team to coordinate needed staffing adjustments based on current and forecasted results. Remain current on operational structure & activities, including client business objectives. Update and maintain Workforce Management Tool. Communicate and escalate relevant information to appropriate individuals (i.e. managers, co-workers, etc.) in a timely manner and through appropriate channels. Support and advocate all Adelman policies, decisions, goals, and values.SKILLS & ABILITIES Education: High School Graduate or General Education Degree (GED): RequiredAssociate's Degree (two year college or technical school) or Work Equivalent, Field of Study: Business or Finance or related field Experience: 2 plus years of experience in staffing management in a contact center environment Computer Skills: Solid experience utilizing MS Office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook).Experience with WFM - real time adherence preferred. Other Requirements: Ability to organize & analyze data in a structured manner.Capacity planning experiences preferred.Ability to perform forecasting in a contact center environment.

Name: Business Process Analyst Consultant, Revenue Assurance
Description: Position DescriptionWhat makes an outstanding Business Process Analyst Consultant, Revenue Assurance? As a Business Process Analyst Consultant, Revenue Assurance, reporting into Bank Solutions Professional Services Operations group, your role will be to ensure visibility to fulfillment/delivery activities, and corresponding revenue events by the organization. This role is responsible for providing backlog management oversight, and the facilitation of revenue assurance meetings. Your actions within these activities ensure backlog and revenue alignment across the Professional Services delivery group, Business Units, and our Financial teams. Additionally, you will helps ensure overall revenue priorities for the delivery organization, and influence capacity-planning decisions. As a Business Process Analyst Consultant, Revenue Assurance, you will:Support backlog management oversight and hygiene -- ensuring project records and information used to predict delivery activities/milestones and associated revenue events are accurate and predictable.You will be the primary contact for Finance, Business Units, and Professional Services as it relates to backlog and ensuring these key partners have clear visibility to the revenue activities being delivered by Professional ServicesWe need you to understand revenue velocity with a primary goal of this position being to ensure we are converting orders/sales into revenue as early as possible in the fulfillment lifecycle, and help maintain optimal/healthy backlog levels.Your facilitation of revenue assurance meetings collaborating with Professional Services functional groups, Business Unit, and Finance teams to schedule and prioritize work ensuring financial priorities of the division/organization are achieved.We expect you to conduct ongoing reviews leadership to ensure visibility to their portfolio, including backlog categories and movement.We also want you to support ongoing audits of project status, and assist in the management and maintenance of the financial data in the PPM tools.We will have you collaborating with Project and Portfolio Management (PPM) Manager for master scheduling and prioritization activities.You will also provide leadership applicable dashboards and reports. The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job, and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities. Qualifications for consideration:Minimum 5 years experience working with financial dataAbility to conduct detailed data and financialDemonstrated ability to communicate across all levels of the organization - clearly articulate ideas both verbally and in writing. To do this you will efficiently under pressure, accurately meet deadlines, present a professional demeanor, and work well independentlyAdvanced level computer experience, including skills in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and VisioValidated experience with troubleshooting, organizational, and analytical skills with a can-do and roll up your sleeves attitude; the ability to adjust to changing requirements/environments are criticalanalysisPrior Project, Process Management, and Change Management experienceExperience with data Visualization tools and skillsAbility to travel 10%.Preferred qualifications for consideration:Bachelor's degree in business, finance, related field OR equivalent experience with a High School diplomaFamiliarity with GAAP principles and revenue recognition standardsFamiliarity with Quote to Cash processes, tools, and methodologiesERP (SAP, Oracle, etc.) Financial modules familiarityProject and Portfolio Management (PPM) experience (Clarity PPM experience a plus)About our Business: Our Bank Solutions team delivers technology products and services for community, regional and large financial institutions, whether they process in-house or through an outsourced service center. This group is responsible for product management and development, service delivery and client support related to the Fiserv bank platform Signature. This platform helps clients improve customer service and streamline back-office operations by providing mission-critical banking functionality while also serving as a delivery channel for an array of other advanced, value-adding Fiserv solutions.  Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Vet  Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Vet. Visit http://www.careers.fiserv.com/eeo for more information.

Name: Continuous Improvement Analyst
Description: Job Description The successful Continuous Improvement Analyst uses analytical skills to efficiently model, design and develop continuous improvement initiatives across the firm's portfolio of workflow applications. He or she will work with the various business units to define, enhance and implement improvements in a way that adds value, removes inefficiencies and mitigates risk while providing documentation, training and support. The Analyst will utilize workflow software to create process models, build user interfaces and forms. Other responsibilities include prioritizing change requests, managing the maintenance of forms and workflows in the production environment, troubleshooting technical support issues and acting as a liaison between the software vendor and Baird IT.  As a Continuous Improvement Analyst , you will: Provide an expert level of technical support and client service via phone and email to our associates in various business units.Research, troubleshoot and resolve technical issues received via phone calls and emails.Provide accurate and creative solutions to client problems of moderate nature to ensure client productivity.Analyze existing automated processes; work with stakeholders to solve process issues, possibly leveraging automation tools.What makes this opportunity great:Team of associates passionate about achieving great results for clients and give back to the communities where we live and workAbility to work a variety of teams and leaders, proving your ability to be flexible and high adaptableCompelling careers working side-by-side with the best in the businessUnique culture that values diverse backgrounds and perspectives while emphasizing teamwork and a strong sense of partnershipMonitor, track and provide metrics on our automated process support modelWhat we look for:Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience of 3+ years in financial services. Business analysis experience preferred.Working knowledge of Object Oriented Programming (e.g. Java, C#) and JavaScriptWorking knowledge of web based applications. Basic knowledge of IT infrastructure and database interaction.Strong skills in Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN) and Business Process Reengineering.Must be able to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences.Strong analytical skills with a focus on detail. Excellent written and verbal communications skills are a must.Who we are: Baird is an employee owned, international wealth management, capital markets, private equity and asset management firm with more than 100 offices in the United States, Europe and Asia. Established in 1919, Baird has over $200 billion in client assets and more than 3,400 associates serving the needs of individual, corporate, institutional and municipal clients.  Baird has built an environment of trust, respect and teamwork, where associates are our greatest asset. As stated in our Associate Promise, we are passionate about how we achieve great outcomes together for our clients, communities and each other. Committed to being a great place to work, Baird ranked No. 12 on the Fortune magazine 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2018, our fifteenth consecutive year on the list. Baird has also received a perfect score on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation's 2018 Corporate Equality Index. To learn more about Baird's culture, click here. #LI-CH1
