Name: Experienced Investment Banking Analyst
Description: Job Description Baird's Equity Capital Markets group includes more than 500 professionals in research, institutional sales and trading, and investment banking. Our Global Investment Banking group provides M&A, debt advisory, and equity and debt financing services to middle-market companies. There are approximately 270 banking professionals serving clients globally.  We are seeking a highly motivated experienced Investment Banking Analyst with at least one year of Investment Banking experience to join our team in Milwaukee, WI.  As an Investment Banking Analyst, you will: Play an integral role on investment banking teams, providing analytical support on mergers and acquisitions, public offerings and other financial advisory services for our clients.Assist in the preparation of company valuations, financial models, company marketing documents and client presentations in addition to performing research and various analyses in support of new business generation.Develop your skills through broad exposure to both junior and senior bankers.What makes this opportunity great:Gain relevant experience in all areas of a transaction, from preparation of marketing materials to facilitation of due diligenceUnique culture that values diverse backgrounds and perspectives while emphasizing teamwork and a strong sense of partnershipAchieve professional development through lean deal teams which provide greater responsibility and daily interaction with senior bankersWhat we look for:Candidates with experience working in a fast-pace professional environment who can hit the ground running.At least 12 months of full-time experience working at a top-tier investment bank.Candidates must have a proven academic record and an interest in Finance.The ideal candidate will have:An enduring work ethic and track record of successThe ability to function equally well in both a team setting and on a self-directed basisExcellent mathematical, writing, verbal and computer skills.Series 63 & 79 licensing preferred or the ability to quickly obtainWho we are: For nearly 100 years, Baird has provided high-quality financial advice and services with clients' best interests in mind. Employee owned and independent, Baird serves individuals, foundations, organizations and municipalities across the country as well as corporations and institutions around the world from more than100 offices in the U.S., Europe and Asia. Baird has more than $200 billion in client assets.  Baird's Equity Capital Markets group includes 500 professionals in research, institutional sales and trading, and investment banking. Baird is also home to a global private equity group, Baird Capital, that has invested in nearly 300 companies over its history.  As one of the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For since 2004, Baird attracts many of the financial service industry's leading and most experienced professionals as well as top talent from the nation's finest universities. From day one, our new associates benefit from collaborative, mentoring relationships, often interacting with senior executives at the companies we cover and getting to know our best institutional clients. The result is a truly enriching experience that provides opportunities to build your existing skills and develop a keen understanding of the industry. Discover a firm with a vested interest in your professional future. To learn more about Baird's culture, click here.

Name: Transportation Analyst III
Description: Your Role: Responsible for monitoring performance, quality, and cost of domestic and international shipments performed by freight forwarders, carriers and couriers. Analyzes business needs and identifies logistical/financial opportunities that will improve and or reduce costs associated with domestic and international transportation. Ensures the execution and continuous improvement of standard logistics processes. Build reputation within transportation to be a trusted advisor to the internal business partners for transportation / logisticsEffectively partner with all internal / external clients to ensure all functions are performing at established levels of performanceBuilds relations with strategic customers through logistics initiatives. Provide support and identify strategies to improve service while minimizing freight spend. Develop strategic partnerships with transportation carriers, including enhanced partnerships with regional carriers. Develop policies and procedures to support implementation of regional carriers offering the best service at the most economical price and most effective terms.Provide analytical support for cost and quality impact of proposed lane, rate, or regulation changes.Partner with shipping sites to support carrier handling of domestic and international shipments. Works closely with sites as well as procurement team, buyers, and suppliers to ensure Compliance to routing expectations is met. Addresses non-compliance as needed to avoid recurrence. Participate in design and establishment of new procedures, and make suggestions for improvement of existing processes of methods. Collaborate effectively with internal customers, suppliers and other functions within the businessTroubleshoot, perform root cause analysis, and develop corrective actions for transportation related issuesMonitor industry trends and consult with industry peers to keep abreast of changes affecting transportation Demonstrate adaptability and openness to change Demonstrate a high standard of ethics and integrityWho you are: Basic QualificationsEducation: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent business experience; Preference in logistics or related fieldExperience: 3+ years work experience in areas of logistics and / or transportation. Working knowledge of U.S. Export and Customs regulations, import/export documentation and recordkeeping.Preferred Qualifications Requires frequent use and general knowledge of industry practices techniques, and standards. Develops solutions to a variety of problems, typically of moderate scope and complexity.Refers to policies and practices for guidance.Contributes to the completion of organizational projects and goals.Strong computer skills including experience with Microsoft Office applications and database

Name: SAP EDI with Business Analyst
Description: Duration: 6 to 9 Months Location: Racine, WI Description: This role is for an EDI Functional Business Analyst who will be responsible for the full SDLC lifecycle of a Business-to-Business (B2B) EDI implementations of minor enhancements, and projects. Responsible for gathering detailed business requirements, trading partner requirements, deeper analysis against existing capabilities and business processes, creating functional specifications, setup EDI partner profiles in SAP, testing, and implementation of changes to the existing B2B e-commerce (EC) and EDI tools, transactions, and interfaces associated with our global SAP platform. Plan and coordinate testing and go-live with trading partners and their vendors, and CUSTOMER internal BPT teams. - provided by DiceSAP EDI, Business Analyst, LSP Integration experience

Advanced technological skills including Excel (i.e. pivot tables, advanced functions), Word, experience working in ERP Systems (Oracle, SAP, Siebel, JDE) and related report writing tools is required to support product and pricing analysis.Ability to analyze purchasing data and make data-driven decisions based on the analysis.Experience working in higher education is beneficial.Experience working in scientific or research environment is beneficial.Experience in decentralized purchasing environment is beneficial. About MCW  The Medical College of Wisconsin (MCW) is one of the largest healthcare employers in Wisconsin. We are a distinguished leader and innovator in the education and development of the next generation of physicians, scientists, pharmacists and health professionals; we discover and translate new knowledge in the biomedical and health sciences; we provide cutting-edge, collaborative patient care of the highest quality; and we improve the health of the communities we serve.  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Name: Order Analyst
Description: Order Analyst– ITU AbsorbTech– New Berlin, WIITU AbsorbTech is seeking an Order Analyst at our New Berlin, WI headquarters.This is an exciting time to join the ITU AbsorbTech team! We are growing rapidly as more and more of the worlds biggest and best manufacturing company’s partner with us to support their sustainability and waste elimination goals.The Order Analyst’s main responsibility is to function as a liaison, supporting our internal Operations, Service and Sales, and Accounting departments. Teamwork is a vital component in ensuring that our customers receive 100% accuracy in deliveries as well as billing statements. Candidate Requirements and Responsibilities:Working knowledge of contractual service agreements.Professional verbal and written communication skills are required in working with our internal and external customers.Learn the business practices to understand the how the responsibilities of an Order Analyst function and influence our internal teams and our customers.Accurate auditing of contractual documents to assure adherence to all company guidelines relative to item identification, cost set-up, inventory and delivery frequencies along with approval requirements.Professional communication of service agreement related questions to teams and managers for review and approval.Accurate entry of final drafts of approved documents.Research and problem solving relative to internal and external customer questions and requestsThe ideal candidate will have the following skills/experience:High School diploma, preferably an associate’s degree in finance or related field.Minimum of four years of relevant experience in a similar role.Exceptional skills in problem solving, research and accurate entry.Strength in organizational skills as well as abilities to prioritize and multi-task.Professionalism in team play, all written and verbal communication, articulation of ideas, perspectives and feedback.Desire to learn, grow, support, and above all provide Genuine Service Excellence, which is the strongest trademark of ITU AbsorbTech, Inc.About ITU AbsorbTechITU AbsorbTech, headquartered in New Berlin, WI, is one of the largest family-owned industrial laundry service companies in the nation with 13 locations throughout the US.We help companies eliminate a waste stream and support safety goals with reuse and recycling programs such as printer and shop towels, reusable oil absorbents, garments, and slip prevention floor mats.We offer a balanced work environment where Team Play and personal accomplishment are highly valued. In exchange for these talents, we offer competitive compensation, an outstanding benefits plan (Health, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance as well as a 401k with a company match option), a fantastic work culture, and professional development opportunities through AbsorbU, our award-winning training program.Check out our reviews on Glassdoor.com.

Name: SAP/FI Analyst
Description: Description: Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  · Architects (analyze requirements, design and prototype solutions) business systems that enable the business processes  · Responsible for business process analysis, design of system configuration, design of testing and implementation of business systems to support functional goals, objectives and needs of the business area supported  · Architects “best-value” solutions that meet business needs while adhering to simplicity, business policies and procedures and leveraging current global investments and resources  · Develops knowledge of the supported business systems.  · Provides as-needed (post helpdesk or secondary) production and problem resolution support for systems in assigned area.  · Helps evaluate the business needs and prioritize them in the IT portfolio.  · Writes descriptions of user needs, functional specs and test cases.  · Assist with data conversion/migration  · Adheres to deadlines and schedules as assigned from enterprise-wide projects.  · Must be able to operate in a fast-paced organization and handle multiple projects simultaneously  · Mentors and assists other functional consultants  · Performs other job-related duties as assigned  Knowledge, Training, Skills and/or Experience:  · Knowledge and/or training courses specific for this position:  Ø Specific expertise and understanding of one of the following business processes and the SAP application systems supporting that process ( or demonstrated ability to learn this type of information): Organizational Hierarchy, Materials / Inventory Management / Material Handling, Goods receipt, Goods Issues, Warehouse Management, Material and Vendor Masters, Intercompany Transfers, Subcontracting, Production orders and costing, Production Planning and Detailed Scheduling, Routings, Physical Inventory/ Cycle Counting, Pricing and Conditions, Procurement/Sourcing of Direct and Indirect Materials, Quality Control, Work Flow, BOMs, Plant Maintenance and Services, ABAP, MRP, RFID, EDI, LSMW, Interfaces  Ø Knowledge of functional area applications systems, databases, and programming/data access tools  Ø General understanding of related technologies. Proficient in the use of basic desktop support tools like Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, and Visio.  Ø Experience with SharePoint including using Power view and Power pivots to create dashboards  Ø Utilize query and reporting tools to provide flexible and timely information to system users. Determine the appropriate programming tools to supply information to system users  Ø Basic understanding of multiple business functions and the interdependencies between them. Understanding of plant floor systems, and manufacturing processes  · Skills specific for this position:  Ø Establishes an environment of functional excellence, simplicity in practice, teamwork, integrity, sense of urgency and continuous learning  Ø Leads complex problems solving efforts. Demonstrates mastery of several key problem solving and facilitation techniques.  Ø Promotes new concepts and implements strategies toward the achievement of identified objectives  Ø Ability to successfully work independently with limited instruction  Ø Strong time management skills; ability to manage multiple tasks; superior organizational skills  Ø Demonstrates strong teamwork skills and must be able to work in an agile project management environment  Ø Superior interpersonal skills with the ability to interface with all levels within the organization and with external vendors  Ø Must possess excellent quantitative, written and presentation skills  Ø Must be a continuous learner, learning new technologies and methodologies as they become available  Ø Ability to work under pressure to meet critical deadlines, yet remain flexible in responding to changing requirements  Ø Ability to work independently, effectively coordinating multiple priorities in a dynamic and changing environment and also in a team-oriented, collaborative environment  Ø Strong analytical skills and solid judgment are required  Ø Works well with teams or in a team environment, with the ability to work independently  · Experience specific for this position:  Ø 5 to 7 years of SAP experience (non-configuration)  Ø Practical experience dealing with IT customers  Ø Cross-component integration knowledge  Certifications, Licenses  Ø SAP certification or CPIM a plus

Name: Enterprise Programmer Analyst
Description: Position Description: Position SummaryEnterprise Programmer Analyst PurposeUnder limited supervision, develops and implements business solutions through the full software life cycle. Independently analyzes and defines system scope and objectives through research of customer needs and investigating and implementing the development of software applications and technology. Works as an integral part of the CIT team to deliver and maintain technology solutions that support CIBMTR’s mission to facilitate critical research. Collaborate with scientific and business stakeholders to translate requirements into technology products and services. Develop, deploy, enhance and maintain data analytics applications, other third-party applications and custom developed applications that support data quality and data sharing objectives of CIBMTR.Primary FunctionsWork with stakeholders and as part of a team with other IT staff to identify, analyze, document and transform system requirements into system design.Prepares detailed specifications for project management plan including, but not limited to, estimating, scheduling and instructing on a project basis.Design, develop, test and debug code to implement and maintain new data analytics applications or application components in Commercial Off the Shelf Applications or in custom-developed applications, alike, including--business logic, queries, or stored procedures.Analyze and enhance third party systems to fulfill requirements and design by configuration, or customization application programming interfaces (API).Conduct user testing; create or perform data validation checks to maintain high level of data integrity and data quality and work with data management to resolve data inconsistenciesDocument systems according to established technology standards, and assist functional users in the development of procedures and documentation of processes.Provide end-user training.Work with users, and other IT staff to provide production support, including troubleshooting, diagnosis and problem resolution.Assist with development and maintenance of a comprehensive workflow process to facilitate research from proposal to publication.Support and maintain the SharePoint site collection.• Perform other work-related duties as assigned and appropriateKnowledge – Skills – AbilitiesKnowledge of computers, electronics, digital media, databases, applications, software development, risk management, and information security.Excellent oral and written communication skills are essentialStrong critical thinking, problem experience skills, including logical UI design and data visualization experienceBusiness intelligence or data analytics (QlikView, Tableau, etc.)Microsoft SharePoint development experience.NET development framework with experience in C# and aspxSSIS development experienceExperience using and documenting with UML and DDLSolid understanding of SAS and/or Perl scripting a plusKnowledge of Agile Scrum preferredWork in healthcare, life science or biomedical research setting preferredCustomer support, systems analysis, troubleshooting, problem solving, and listening skills.Organizational Name: Fraud Prevention Analyst
Description: Inspire and deliver exceptional value to travelers around the globe as part of the Apple Leisure Group (ALG) team! Our vision is to be the best-in-class and largest all-inclusive resort management and travel services provider, differentiated by the collaboration of our unique resort and distribution brands.Grow your career as a Fraud Prevention Analyst with Apple Leisure Group. You will focus on mitigating risk for the organization through successful chargeback resolution, fraud detection and implementation of tools and resources to minimize loss. In this role, you will work closely with the chargeback team in elevated cases with consumer and travel agent fraud.A successfulFraud Prevention Analyst will:Eliminate opportunity for fraud through proper reporting and internal controls.Administer ThreatMetrix Fraud Prevention tool to support initiatives and evaluate trends that are occurring. Identify activity and implement processes to prevent reoccurring instances in the future.Seek opportunities to expand understanding trends in fraud activity and ways to mitigate losses.Assess losses and adhere to policies prior to expense write offs.Work closely with outside sources including travel agents, legal community and suppliers to investigate issues.Issue monthly fraud loss reports to leadership team.Handle collection of recoupment through Travel Agent commission, invoicing or collection agencies.Assist in resolution of chargebacks.Lead by example in producing a high level of quality and quantity of workBe able to investigate errors, summarize the impact and recommend a solution to your leaderResolve difficult travel agent and customer issues using corporate resources to achieve a satisfactory outcomeDemonstrate outstanding relationships with customers, travel agents and internal team members through professional communicationBe able to perform functions within Microsoft Office, RezAgent, Threat Metrix and SynapseIdentify opportunities for improvement, cost reduction and system enhancementsRequirements:Associates degree in Accounting, Finance or a related fieldOR3-5 years of related experience in accounting with emphasis on fraud prevention; or an equivalent combination of education and experience1-3 years of fraud prevention and chargeback experience.Experience with fraud prevention software, ThreatMetrix a plus.Ability to work collaboratively across departments.Confident and professional communication skills.Demonstrated commitment to the oversight of methods and procedures to standardize and streamline operations, identify and implement cost-savings and process improvements.Demonstrated understanding of accounting controls and the maintenance of an appropriate control environment.Ability to handle financial detail with a high degree of accuracy and meet time-sensitive deadlines.Ability to work effectively with a diverse population in a fast-paced environment.Strong analytical skills and problem solving capabilities.About Apple Leisure GroupApple Leisure Group® (ALG) is the leading North American travel, hospitality and leisure management group with the only vertically-integrated business model, serving travelers and destinations worldwide. ALG consistently delivers exceptional value to travelers and strong performance to resort owners and partners by strategically leveraging the power of its portfolio of brands across five segments, comprising: the largest seller of vacation packages and charter flights in the U.S. for travel to Mexico and the Caribbean, moving approximately 3.2 million passengers annually through well-established vacation brands, brand management of 5-star and 4-star luxury resorts through AMResorts® award-winning brand portfolio; best-in-class destination management services provided by Amstar DMC and Worldstar®, the exclusive loyalty program Unlimited Vacation Club®; and the innovative technology solutions provider Trisept Solutions®, connecting over 88,000 travel agents with leading travel suppliers. To learn more about the Apple Leisure Group advantage, visit appleleisuregroup.com.Benefits at a GlanceWe offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefit package to our U.S. based employees:Medical, Dental and Vision InsuranceBasic Life InsuranceShort& Long Term DisabilityCorporate Wellness ProgramTravel Discounts& DealsPaid Time Off& Holidays401(k) Plan with Company MatchTuition ReimbursementWe are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free and tobacco-free workplace and perform pre-employment background checks.

Name: TOS Mortgage Systems Analyst
Description: U.S. Bank is seeking a motivated Business Systems Analyst with requirements-gathering and functional-design experience to contribute toward the success of our technology initiatives. Additional responsibilities include:+ Assists users in understanding application functionality;+ Responds to user-escalated issues from the Helpdesk;+ Manages tickets in support system per SLAs;+ Collects functional requirements from the business line;+ Assists application development team in creating functional designs;+ Aids in testing of applications;+ Analyzes and evaluates user needs;+ Assists in developing and maintaining a complete and accurate understanding of how an impacted business unit conducts its business;+ Assists in developing and maintaining detailed knowledge of the business's current technology and infrastructure from a functional perspective;+ Assists in analyzing and documenting business processes of medium complexity;+ Works with business representatives to identify, analyze, document, and refine detailed business needs of medium complexity and scope;+ Designs functional solutions that appropriately meet the business needs; and+ Reviews test plans for multiple projects and ensures that test cases and results meet requirements.**Qualifications:**Basic Qualifications-Associate's degree or equivalent work experience-At least three years of experience with activities, tasks, practices and deliverables for assessing and documenting business opportunities, benefits, risks, and success factors of potential applicationsPreferred Skills/ExperienceBasic understanding in:-IT standards, procedures, policy-IT environmentWorking experience in:-Workflow analysis-Requirements analysis-Modeling: data, process, events, objects-Business process modeling-System testing-System development life cycle-Business assessment**Job:** Information Technology**Primary Location:** Kentucky-KY-Owensboro**Shift:** 1st - Daytime**Average Hours Per Week:** 40**Requisition ID:** 180042462**Other Locations:** Missouri-MO-Earth City, United States, Minnesota-MN-HopkinsU.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: Senior Communication Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce's client, a large advertising/marketing firm in Milwaukee, WI is seeking a high quality Senior Communications Analyst to add to their team.  Summary:  As the analytics lead, the Senior Analyst is heavily involved in designing a communications performance plan from tracking strategies to KPIs to the aligned goals. They work closely with Architects, Activators and others in our Account Management and PR disciplines to provide measurement expertise and guidance.  This person is confident in making recommendations because they have analyzed the data and understand how it sets a direction. They crave measurement challenges to which they develop solutions. They are strong team players because they understand their role is to provide the connective analytical tissue between communications/measurement plan design, implementation and evaluation. They love data.  Main responsibilities:  Deep-seeded curiosity to learn through data analysis Demonstrates strong command of data analysis Working with large sets of quantitative data, including:  Data collection and entry Basic database maintenance Excel-based data analysis Creation of data tables/cross-tabulation, charts, formulas Recognize and uncover insights that inform decision-making Creation of detailed reports based on Translation of data/insights for audiences of all backgrounds and levels of understanding Consultation with teams on developing performance goals and methods/tactics for measurementREQUIREMENTS: 4+ years of experience analyzing communications performance results across multiple channels Experience with communication performance measurement systems (e.g. Google Analytics, Omniture, SilverPop), business intelligence platforms (e.g. Business Objects, Cognos) and/or measurement dashboard platforms (e.g. Tableau, GoodData) Has extensive work experience designing and implementing communication measurement plans Understands how to optimize communication plans Can effectively measure, analyze and evaluate what elements of a communication plan is working and what is not This person will be comfortable establishing best practices for measurement and proactively communicating expectations for team involvement and action towards better measured communications Nice to have:  Preferred: experience with attribution techniques or models Experience with online dashboard platforms such as GoodData or Tableau Complex attribution modeling experience Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Sr User Support Analyst I
Description: What you will do: Provides first and second level support to the field. Creates reports with observations and recommendations on the performance and operation of building systems and equipment. How you will do it:Develops procedures and guidelines to provide high-level technical analysis and provide detailed solutions regarding the use of various tools and business processes used to execute customer work within the North American branches.Has a mid-level understanding of North American business operations, and works closely with Business Leads to troubleshoot issues and provide input for future development and enhancements of software used to execute business.Validate that programs function properly once fixes are deployed by software programmers.Assist in developing documentation for commonly asked questions in order to provide a higher level of closure at Level 1. Assist in developing documentation that can be used by customers as a means of self-help, in order to reduce the number of customer calls.What we look for: Bachelor's degree or equivalent workexperience. (Minimum 3 years)  Johnson Controls is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information, please view EEO is the Law. If you are an individual with a disability and you require an accommodation during the application process, please visit www.johnsoncontrols.com/tomorrowneedsyou.

Name: Cerner Ambulatory Support Analyst
Description: Title: Cerner Ambulatory Support Analyst  Location: United States  Job Number: 18212775  CTG is seeking a Cerner Millennium Ambulatory support analyst. Responsibilities include all support activities such as incidents, service/change request, routine maintenance.  This is a remote position but must be on site for knowledge transfer (3-6 weeks) at the start of project. Support includes being be part of the 24/7 on call rotation.  Preferred candidates will have 5 years of Cerner experience, particularly around Cerner Core build and functionality = order build, preference maintenance, privilege maintenance, ESH, rule setup.  Cerner patient portal and TransChart are a plus.  Candidates should be prepared to be part of a multifunctional team and provide support where needed. Requirements: Experience with the detailed design, configuration, build, testing, and troubleshooting experience in one or more of the following Cerner solutions: PowerChart Ambulatory CPOE (including, PowerPlans, PowerOrders, Order Sentences, Dynamic Documentation, PowerForms, MPages, Workflow, Task Completion, etc.)Cerner Practice ManagementScheduling ManagementCare ManagementCore Measures/QualityCareAware, CCL/Clinical RulesRegistrationPathNet and the Reference Lab NetworkPharmNetRadNetSurgiNetFirstNetSecurity Location: Remote after 3-6 weeks of knowledge transfer in Chicago, IL  Duration: 2 years Qualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).  CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.  CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.  Job: Healthcare & Hospital Implementations

Name: CERNER FSI SUPPORT ANALYST

Review interface design specs and integrate external applications with the Cerner Millennium suite  ? Name: DSSI EVS Category Analyst
Description: Job Summary The DSSI Procurement Services Category Analyst for Environmental Services/Housekeeping will be responsible for collaborating with Procurement Consultants to build, optimize, implement and manage Environmental Services/Housekeeping spend for each of our clients. Working with our client’s operations team, they will be responsible for streamlining operations and driving out operational and product acquisition costs. The Category Analyst will work with multiple suppliers and GPO’s to build best in Class standards that can be replicated and implemented with all customers. Essential Job Functions Responsibilities:Partner with the Procurement Consultant to conduct initial client assessment to determine needs of each client across all Environmental categories of spend – Housekeeping and Maintenance. Products may include, but are not limited to cleaning chemicals, a variety of equipment and textiles/linens.Analyze spend to develop and recommend programs to clients.Develop product and procurement roadmaps for smooth implementation of approved programs.Create and execute client specific change management activities to consolidate suppliers for the client including implementation of the order guide as well as creation of housekeeping guides and standards.Build, execute and maintain order guides across EVS categories of spend that drives efficiencies and savings for client from a variety of suppliers accounting for more than 200,000 items.Partner with Environmental Lead if the provider has a lead in this category.Provide project plans, updates and client facing business review presentation content to Procurement Consultant, to include tracking savings, completed milestones, and suggestions for future savings.Analyze data to drive compliance and realize opportunities to add suppliers on the DSSI platform to drive additional revenuePartner with the DSSI Integrations Team to implement suppliers and order guides on the client’s DSSI platform.Promote the One Direct Supply value to each client, creating opportunities across Direct Supply Inc. in multiple categories of spend including Environmental Capital and Building Services.Create and leverage Housekeeping “how to” and informational guides by provider and standards for each category that can be scaled across multiple customers.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Business or Analytics5 year of experience in corporate database analysis and reporting (e.g. Microsoft Excel, Access, SSRS, or IBM Cognos)Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel (e.g. formulas, formatting, pivot tables, macros, etc.)Demonstrated ability to pull, manipulate, evaluate, and understand data from multiple sourcesDemonstrated ability to simplify business challenges and triangulate solutions from the perspective of people, process, and technologyExperience contributing to cross-functional teams and external clientsDemonstrated facilitation and process skillsAbility to handle multiple projects simultaneouslyStrong interpersonal and relationship-management skillsAdditional Preferred Skills:Experience working with DSSIGeneral knowledge and understanding of long-term care and senior living products and equipmentCompetencies:ApproachabilityPeer RelationshipsCustomer FocusIntegrity and TrustFunctional/Technical SkillsPriority SettingPersonal LearningDrive for ResultsBusiness AcumenCritical ThinkingProcess ManagementProblem SolvingTo apply for this or any other position at Direct Supply, please visit DirectSupply.com/Careers. Name: Senior Commercial Analyst, LCM

Our Komatsu, P&H, Joy, Montabert, Modular Mining Systems, Hensley Industries, NTC and Gigaphoton equipment and services are used to extract fundamental minerals and develop modern infrastructure. Competent in other MS Office programs.SAP experience preferred.Five to seven years of Commercial or customer facing experience preferred, including experience leading cross-functional teams without direct authority.Excellent communication skills, problem solving skills, and drive for results. Name: Business Consultant
Description: Create lasting, positive impact. By considering Wipfli LLP, you’ve decided to go beyond the ordinary public accounting and consulting firm. At Wipfli, we create positive impact and lifetime relationships by leading and working with an outward mindset. As a member of our team, you will be inspired to think freely and follow your passion, grow as a professional by developing your skills and commit to serving our clients and communities with honesty and integrity.  Wipfli has a broad national footprint with offices coast to coast — and we’re still growing! As an associate, you’ll have access to skill development and career opportunities, whether you want to move up or transition into another area of specialty. You’ll also have the flexibility and technology to work wherever you are, whether it’s at home or in our clients’ offices, or switching Wipfli offices if you’re looking to move across the country.  Join a company focused on giving back to the greater good — at Wipfli, we’re committed to supporting the communities we do business in. To learn more about our volunteer efforts, who we are and what we do, visit wipfli.com.  Are you interested in helping companies thrive through innovative thinking, structured problem solving and the implementation of information technology systems? Consider learning more about the Consulting Practice at Wipfli. Our consultants work closely with our clients to help them optimize their value streams – the way they deliver value via products and services to their customers.  More specifically consultants get involved with our clients in the following project experiences: Analysis, design, selection and implementation of ERP and CRM software systemsAnalysis, design and implementation of Business Intelligence systems, enabling our clients to turn data into meaningful information to better serve critical business decisions.Software configuration and development, including mobile application development and engineering, leveraging leading edge technology.Business analysis and project management associated with industry software solutions in Insurance, Health Care, Construction and Manufacturing organizations.Network infrastructure design, configuration and administrationExposure to Lean principles in all that we do.Wipfli is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All candidates will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identify, citizenship status, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristics protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Name: Implementation Consultant
Description: TechCanary is seeking highly energetic and self-motivated Implementation Consultants to join the CanaryServices team, TechCanary's Professional Services division. The ideal candidate will have a knack for engaging stakeholders and building solid relationships of trust to provide the best customer experience - the TechCanary Way. THE 411 ON TECHCANARY: TechCanary is a dynamic software company that is dramatically changing the way insurance agents do business. Founded in 2013 with corporate headquarters in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, we are a proud Milwaukee Future 50 company, a distinction bestowed upon us by the Metropolitan Milwaukee Association of Commerce (MMAC). As the #5 of the 50 fastest growing MMAC companies, we bring the worlds #1 CRM solution to the insurance industry by delivering a full-featured Agency Management System (AMS) built into the Salesforce.com platform.  Agents can now conduct business anytime, anywhere and on any device. In addition to managing their business, TechCanary enables them to focus on managing their growth. Many of the cumbersome and costly manual steps required today for agents to run their agency on legacy software solutions are replaced by an automated, streamlined, and flexible cloud-based methodology. Through the TechCanary solution, agents will realize dramatic operational efficiency gains and cost reductions, as well as a resultant increase in revenue and income.  Recognized as one of the fastest-growing companies in the Milwaukee Region in 2016 and 2017 and #393 on the 2018 Inc. 5000, we're growing in our new downtown digs just steps from the Fiserv Forum, the Milwaukee Bucks' new arena. If you think outside the cage and want to use your creative skills with a growing team, fly with The Flock at TechCanary. THE VIEW FROM THE TOP Under general supervision of the VP, CanaryServices, the Implementation Consultant is a key member of the implementation & support team within CanaryServices, responsible for planning & executing the set-up and training of TechCanarys award-winning insurance solutions products. THE NITTY GRITTY (What will you actuallybe doing?)Consult with client to analyze business model to identify and document client's requirements from TechCanary's productsLead the implementation and optimization of CanaryAMS at client sites or remotelyInterface and meet with prospects and clients as needed for any of the following: software implementation or upgrade, problem resolution, enhancements, specialized reporting, training, pre- and post-sales supportImplement software while adhering to the project management model for smooth delivery of standard implementationsInform client management and relevant personnel of project statusProvide project management responsibilities for life cycle of projectAddress technical questions; occasionally provide backup to existing technical support staff; resolve customer technical issues and concernsDevelop and deliver customer training, both onsite and remoteCollaborate with clients to optimize their Agency Management SystemLearn and master the capabilities of the system and advise customers on how to most effectively use the solution, including modifying customers' existing processes, procedures, work-flow, forms and contentIdentify opportunities to improve the system and disseminate client feedback to the relevant departments within the organizationWork with team members to define, prioritize, and implement selected enhancements.CANARY COMPETENCIES (What you already bring to the table and what you can expect to be competent in after successful onboarding)Ability & enjoyment working with people to build relationships, understand needs, and find solutions to meet needsHard-working, flexible team player able to work across various departments and management levelsAbility to thoroughly learn and understand the industry in which the product competes/servesAbility to thoroughly engage client to understand their business and processes with skill to turn this knowledge into an implementation and training planKnowledge of and experience in insurance agency space within the insurance spectrumTechnical aptitude: high proficiency with web-based systems and SalesforceExcellent communication skills (oral and written) with ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organizationExcellent active listening and presentation skills with ability to understand how the client best learns to tailor a presentation based on learning styleCommunication skills are extremely important: must be able to communicate at all levels within any organization; excellent written communication, verbal communication, active listening and presentation skills.Ability to self-direct work and work independently within a teamStrong problem solving skills and willingness to roll up ones sleeves to get the job doneStrong attention to detailAbility to provide occasional support outside regular business hoursAbility & willingness to travel 7-10 days per month to client sites throughout the US and internationally, as neededStrong business process, time management and analytical skills are essentialTHE CANARY CAGE This job operates in an office environment and routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, copiers/scanners and various online tools. MUSCLES USED While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear and conducts most of their work using computers. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. CANARY MIGRATIONS This bird will be spreading its wings and flying (figuratively we mean, as we're referring to actual travel outside the office) up to 20% of the time to client sites. WHAT'S THE DEALIO This is a full-time position with an expectation of 40 hours of work per week.  TechCanary allows flexible work schedules to meet the needs of both the employee and the business. However, the core (peak) hours this employee should expect to be present and working daily are 9:00am to 3:00pm CST. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required to meet needs and as duties demand. MUST HAVESUniversity degree; preferably in Information TechnologyMinimum of two (2) years of business systems implementation or support experienceNICE TO HAVESPrevious software industry experience a plusPrevious insurance industry experience a plusMS/BS degree in Accounting, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent preferredWHAT YOU CAN EXPECT OF USA team-oriented, supportive environmentAn open-minded office that values contributions from all playersFree snacks!A relaxed and fun work environmentTeam-building and social eventsFree drinks!Challenging workDevelopment opportunitiesFree snacks!A pretty snazzy benefits package on par with the big dogsThe ability to join a growing company and get in on the ground floor to help us mold our futureDid we mentionfree snacks?! That's Snacks on Snacks on Snacks!OK, yes we know snacks are not what make it or break it for an employee. We believe they're just a little added perk on top of the employee experience with TechCanary to ensure our employees are well taken care of.INTEREST PIQUED? READY TO LEARN MORE? Then let's go. Click that handy dandy Apply box.

Name: Sales Operations Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThis position will serve as a key support position for the sales organization. Reporting directly to the Manager, Sales Analysis and Process Improvement, this position will develop and maintain sales reporting information to be used for decision making purposes by sales management and senior executives. Analysis will be performed at many different levels including sales representative, sales region, sales division, distribution channel, and key customer. Excellent skills in Microsoft Excel and data manipulation are a must.Duties and ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities for Sales Analysis-related functions:Analyze data, reports, trends and communicating findingsPresent sales results to Regional Sales Managers, Sales Directors, and Sales & Marketing Vice PresidentsProcess Point Of Sale (POS) data for National Accounts and key regional accountsCollaborate with Sales Management to track and communicate sales programs performance to the fieldEvaluate new reporting ideas and performance to the fieldNational/regional/local promotionsSales successes and failuresEvent/Trade Show activitiesManage/maintain relationships with MET Product Marketing and Channel Marketing:Analyze new product launch and post launch sales successTrack focus product sales performance to targetsCommunicate product sales success tied to individual sales representatives, sales regions, and sales divisions.Facilitate the creation of ad hoc reports as needed. The position will also assist in the creation and maintenance of a suite of standard sales management reports and the rationalization of old reports.Assist the forecasting team in preparation for monthly forecast meetings and presentations to senior executives.Support business unit users in CRMLead segments of Milwaukee's Sales onboarding programContribute to cross-functional projects and process improvement effortsEducation and Experience RequirementsFour year college degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Finance, Economics, or other business related field.Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.), Lotus Notes, Internet, etc.Strong interpersonal and communication skills needed to interface within the Milwaukee sales organization and corporate environment. Strong customer orientation and ability to develop relationships at all levels of the organization.Good organizational skills to manage and balance multiple priorities & workflow. Able to take/give direction and implement/ execute work independently, as well as in a team setting.Ability to manage and balance accountability with relationship building.Ability to travel 10% of time.Apply Now

Name: Process Analyst
Description: Accountable to provide standardized, documented processes and process solutions for North American Collections & SBSA that are cost-effective and timely, and that comply with Bank policies and procedures (P&Ps) and regulatory requirements. Act as the key escalation point for new and/or revised processes, business issues, procedures, processes, and reports of a more complex nature, and apply in- depth process knowledge to ensure consistency and effectiveness of service and support and effective management of risk and controls.  Act as a key control over critical business activities related to the area of expertise, with a significant involvement in analyzing and advising on business implications of options, to facilitate an effective and comprehensive understanding of business decisions and sound risk management. This role meets operational objectives within a six- to twelve-month time horizon. KEY AREAS OF ACCOUNTABILITY Product & Process  Risk & Control  Change Management  Financial Management  Business Performance Management ACCOUNTABILITIES Product & Process Conduct analysis of processes and process design, establish required internal controls, P&Ps, position processes for automation, and identify risk impacts for new processes and process workflows related to medium to high complexity initiatives.Conduct analysis for complex change or business initiatives, using specialized process knowledge.Participate in project meetings to interpret and advise on process implications of planned initiatives and to clarify process steps, as required, post-implementation.Act as a subject matter expert (SME), advising to senior managers on the implications of proposed business decisions related to area(s) of expertise.Lead activities for new work related to the assigned function.Provide timely analysis of information and reports on assigned area(s) of expertise to ensure compliance with terms and conditions and ongoing maintenance of risk within acceptable levels.Oversee and manage process issues and related action items for assigned projects and initiatives.Document process requirements and/or provide input to conversion and implementation strategy plans from a process perspective.Identify opportunities for process improvement and initiate changes.Assess and improve process effectiveness of the portfolio continuously within prescribed limits.Create and apply templates for gathering information on processes, ensuring understanding of risks and support for effective decision-making.Research P&Ps to understand process impact and ensure compliance with applicable topic.Design and create workflow documentation for new and/or revised processes; obtain required sign- offs.Provide input and analysis into the continuous improvement of business processes and procedures, and participate in the planning, testing and implementation of projects and new/ revised products/ services or processes.Initiate, receive, assess and distribute feedback on new and revised topics/circulars, identifying impacted processes and revising, as appropriate.Participate in User Acceptance Testing (UAT), identify potential processing gaps/ impacts and recommend alternative solutions.Advise on training tools for assigned initiatives, ensuring compliance to process requirements.Provide advice to internal business partners and peers to support the completion of a process or activity within established procedures.Resolve process problems within area of expertise. Participate in the resolution of problems outside direct authority.Consult with experts inside and/or outside the business unit regarding complex or unusual transactions and developments concerning area(s) of expertise.Provide coaching to more junior staff and peers, as required.Maintain relationships with industry contacts (internal and external), regulatory officials and external consultants for purposes of enhancing business effectiveness within the scope of accountability. Risk & Control Maintain key controls and review processes, where applicable, to ensure operating integrity and compliance with internal and external regulators, involving an understanding of regulatory and compliance requirements as prescribed for the business unit; provide recommendations and implement corrective actions to ensure adherence, as required.Provide information for regulatory reporting and audit queries.Identify potential risk situations within the scope of work (e.g., risk assessments), make recommendations and/or escalate to the manager, where appropriate, and ensure contingency plans exist.Develop, document and maintain standards, processes and controls in area(s) of expertise in order to minimize loss/ risk, ensure all regulatory requirements are met, and safeguard the assets of the Bank.Understand risks inherent in area(s) of expertise and take appropriate actions, including accuracy and safeguarding of all documentation and any other requirements to ensure operational integrity is maintained within the business.Ensure adherence to all aspects of First Principles, Our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics Corporate Policy, as well as all applicable legislation, regulatory rules and requirements, and Bank standards, P&Ps for such things as potential conflicts of interest, safeguarding of customer information, trading in securities, anti-money laundering, privacy and disclosure of outside business activities.Ensure strict confidentiality is maintained for both customer and Bank information to protect the customer and the Bank and to ensure compliance with Bank P&Ps.Follow security and safeguarding procedures and apply appropriate due diligence in accordance with Bank policy for the prevention of loss due to such things as fraud or defalcation.Contribute to the management of risk and minimize losses through monitoring and controlling various reports and taking appropriate action, ensuring compliance requirements, audits and verifications are completed in accordance with Bank P&Ps. Change Management Not applicable Financial Management Not applicable Business Performance Management Monitor and analyze opportunities for quality improvement; recommend solutions.Monitor service delivery performance and production processes and quality, providing reports and recommendations to the manager for the purpose of optimizing operational effectiveness.Provide coaching and training sessions to team members in area(s) of expertise, and provide feedback to the manager on gaps and opportunities.Support the delivery of exceptional customer service that builds trust through responsive, accurate, consistent, knowledgeable and available services and support.Align individual performance goals to team and organizational goals.Demonstrate behaviours that are consistent with "Our Way" model and aligned with BMO values.KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLSKnowledge:University degree/college diploma or equivalent work experience5 to 7 years of related experienceSolid knowledge of Lean process improvement methodologySolid knowledge of process and/or project managementSolid knowledge of standard desktop applications used by the business unitStrong knowledge and understanding of the business unit's key products and services, processes and controlsSolid understanding of the business unit's risk and regulatory requirementsSolid knowledge of departmental systems and applicationsSolid understanding of internal business partner's business, services and organizationSkills:Strong analytical and problem-solving skillsStrong investigation skillsGood change leadership skillsStrong prioritization skillsService and relationship management skillsGood coaching, mentoring and training skillsStrong conflict management/ resolution skillsStrong process-writing skillsStrong written and oral communication skillsAbility to multi-task in a fast-paced environment We're here to help  At BMO Harris Bank we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the center of everything we do helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the futurethe future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we're changing the way people think about a bank.  As a member of the BMO Harris Bank team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one for yourself and our customers. We'll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we'll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.  To find out more visit us at https://bmoharriscareers.com.  BMO Harris Bank is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other's differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. BMO Harris Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer for all, inclusive of Minorities, Women, Veterans, and Persons with Disabilities.

Name: Risk Analyst, Healthcare Equipment Finance
Description: Role Summary: Responsible for the underwriting of transactions in a structured leasing platform. Support business teams in analyzing, closing, and funding of commercial transactions. Responsible for underwriting process for commercial equipment transactions, from proposal issuance, structuring and pricing, through documentation and funding. Essential Responsibilities:Work with commercial team to expedite efficient transaction decisions, documentation, and  funding. Prepare approval requests for presentation to Team Leader. Participate in customer interviews and due diligence meetings. Work with Capital Markets and outside funding sources on syndication activity. Research and report on the Healthcare industry, gain knowledge of the market and equipment,  and identify trends and opportunities for growth and income. Qualifications/Requirements: Bachelors degree with two years of experience (or High School diploma/GED and six years of  experience) in commercial underwriting, auditing or portfolio management.Eligibility Requirements: Must submit your application for employment through COS (internal candidates) or  www.gecareers.com (external candidates) to be considered for this job opening.  Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for  employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening  Must be willing to comply with pre-employment screening, including but not limited to, drug  testing, reference verification and background check.  Must be willing to travel 10% of the time. Desired Characteristics:Master's degree in business administration or related field. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Description  Under supervision, to perform professional work in the implementation and administration of automated financial, accounting, or budgeting activities on a Countywide basis; and to perform other duties as required.  Example of Duties Assists departments in the development of budget requests, and interprets budget proposals and data to the County Executive and committees of the County Board.Reviews and records accounting or budget transactions, and makes allocations to designated accounts and funds,Prepares, analyzes, and interprets financial and statistical data to determine and recommend budget assumptions, department tax levy targets, the costs of positions, programs, labor contracts, interdepartmental charges, or department operations.Assists with reviews of financial reports and computerized financial systems to ensure that proper accounting or budgeting procedures have been followed.Maintains and updates the budget and financial system utilizing various software applications.Assists external auditors by compiling financial data, and assists in internal audits by performing audit field work.Assists in the preparation of financial and narrative reports analyzing and interpreting accounting or budgetary systems and controls, and may make recommendations for improvements.Assists in the interpretation and analysis of the fiscal impact of new laws, codes, regulations, or accounting standards, and advises department heads and other employees of the fiscal impact.Advises department heads and other employees of generally accepted accounting principles, laws, codes, and regulations and recommends proper accounting and budgeting treatment for financial transactions and procedures.Maintains detailed automated and manual accounts, spreadsheets, ledgers, records, and procedures.Reviews and coordinates the work of clerical and other department personnel in accounting, payroll, budgeting, or billing areas, and provides necessary training.Monitors the execution of operating budgets, investigates variances from projected expenditures or revenues, and recommends corrective actions to department heads and other employees.Establishes and maintains effective working relations with employees at all levels within the county, representatives of other agencies, and elected officials.Performs other duties as required.QUALIFICATIONS Essential Knowledge and Abilities Working knowledge of the modern principles, practices, and procedures of general accounting, payroll management, administration, and management, or appropriation and budgeting, as applied to governmental entities.Working knowledge of the principles of auditing in the public sector, particularly as applied to budget development and control, or accounting.Working knowledge of computer systems as applied to budgeting, accounting, or financial management applications.Ability to plan, organize, and effectively carry out a variety of assignments.Ability to collect, analyze, and interpret data and to prepare and present detailed recommendations and conclusions.Ability to effectively present ideas and concepts to others, both orally and in writing.Ability to establish and maintain effective public and working relationships.Ability to prepare and maintain accurate and complete records and reports.Ability to plan, organize, and review the work of others.Ability to utilize financial and accounting spreadsheet and database applications, presentation tools, and integrated financial systems.Minimum Qualifications You must meet these minimum Training and Experience requirements: Graduation from a recognized college or university with a bachelor's degree in business administration, public administration, accounting, finance, or a closely related field. Preferred, but not required: Two years of experience in an accounting or financial analyst role.  Supplemental Information  This position is part of the Accounting Services unit within the Waukesha County, Department of Health and Human Services, Administrative Services Division. The unit provides accounting, budget, and other fiscal and administrative services to all program divisions and units within the Department. This position reports to the Accounting Services Coordinator.  With guidance and direction from the Accounting Services Coordinator, this position has responsibility to provide financial and analytical support to Waukesha County, Department of Health and Human Services, Division of Veterans Services and Division of Administrative Services. This position collaborates with division staff, supervisors and managers as needed to complete work assignments.  Primary duties include review of AP and AR processes, monthly accounting processes, state/federal reporting, management/operating reports, annual budget development, monthly and quarterly budget monitoring, audit preparation/response, resolution of fiscal issues as needed, and other duties as assigned.  This position requires the ability to prioritize workload, work independently and meet deadlines, and requires strong organizational and communication skills.  Under supervision, to perform professional work in the implementation and administration of automated financial, accounting, or budgeting activities on a Countywide basis; and to perform other duties as required.  Anticipated start date will be in January 2019.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Description  Under supervision, to perform professional work in the implementation and administration of automated financial, accounting, or budgeting activities on a Countywide basis; and to perform other duties as required.  Example of Duties Assists departments in the development of budget requests, and interprets budget proposals and data to the County Executive and committees of the County Board. Reviews and records accounting or budget transactions, and makes allocations to designated accounts and funds, Prepares, analyzes, and interprets financial and statistical data to determine and recommend budget assumptions, department tax levy targets, the costs of positions, programs, labor contracts, interdepartmental charges, or department operations. Assists with reviews of financial reports and computerized financial systems to ensure that proper accounting or budgeting procedures have been followed. Maintains and updates the budget and financial system utilizing various software applications. Assists external auditors by compiling financial data, and assists in internal audits by performing audit field work. Assists in the preparation of financial and narrative reports analyzing and interpreting accounting or budgetary systems and controls, and may make recommendations for improvements. Assists in the interpretation and analysis of the fiscal impact of new laws, codes, regulations, or accounting standards, and advises department heads and other employees of the fiscal impact. Advises department heads and other employees of generally accepted accounting principles, laws, codes, and regulations and recommends proper accounting and budgeting treatment for financial transactions and procedures. Maintains detailed automated and manual accounts, spreadsheets, ledgers, records, and procedures. Reviews and coordinates the work of clerical and other department personnel in accounting, payroll, budgeting, or billing areas, and provides necessary training. Monitors the execution of operating budgets, investigates variances from projected expenditures or revenues, and recommends corrective actions to department heads and other employees. Establishes and maintains effective working relations with employees at all levels within the county, representatives of other agencies, and elected officials. Performs other duties as required. QUALIFICATIONS Essential Knowledge and AbilitiesWorking knowledge of the modern principles, practices, and procedures of general accounting, payroll management, administration, and management, or appropriation and budgeting, as applied to governmental entities. Working knowledge of the principles of auditing in the public sector, particularly as applied to budget development and control, or accounting. Working knowledge of computer systems as applied to budgeting, accounting, or financial management applications. Ability to plan, organize, and effectively carry out a variety of assignments. Ability to collect, analyze, and interpret data and to prepare and present detailed recommendations and conclusions. Ability to effectively present ideas and concepts to others, both orally and in writing. Ability to establish and maintain effective public and working relationships. Ability to prepare and maintain accurate and complete records and reports. Ability to plan, organize, and review the work of others. Ability to utilize financial and accounting spreadsheet and database applications, presentation tools, and integrated financial systems. Minimum QualificationsYou must meet these minimum Training and Experience requirements:Graduation from a recognized college or university with a bachelor's degree in business administration, public administration, accounting, finance, or a closely related field. Preferred, but not required: Two years of experience in an accounting or financial analyst role.   Supplemental InformationThis position is part of the Accounting Services unit within the Waukesha County, Department of Health and Human Services, Administrative Services Division. The unit provides accounting, budget, and other fiscal and administrative services to all program divisions and units within the Department. This position reports to the Accounting Services Coordinator.   With guidance and direction from the Accounting Services Coordinator, this position has responsibility to provide financial and analytical support to Waukesha County, Department of Health and Human Services, Division of Veterans Services and Division of Administrative Services. This position collaborates with division staff, supervisors and managers as needed to complete work assignments.   Primary duties include review of AP and AR processes, monthly accounting processes, state/federal reporting, management/operating reports, annual budget development, monthly and quarterly budget monitoring, audit preparation/response, resolution of fiscal issues as needed, and other duties as assigned.  This position requires the ability to prioritize workload, work independently and meet deadlines, and requires strong organizational and communication skills.  Under supervision, to perform professional work in the implementation and administration of automated financial, accounting, or budgeting activities on a Countywide basis; and to perform other duties as required.  Anticipated start date will be in January 2019.

Name: Technical Consultant
Description: The Technical Consultant will work closely with clients to solve complex technical problems and design ideal configurations for their use of Digital Measures by Watermark. The TC partners with clients to identify and support goals in using Digital Measures by Watermark, providing best-practice guidance and assistance so they can achieve those goals.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities Serve as the primary technical contact for implementations and other client projectsConsult with clients on how to achieve their goals while considering best practices for database design, reporting and data managementComplete configuration work requests for clients using basic programming skillsLead data migration projects, including parsing, mapping, and converting data filesCollaborate with internal team members to ensure client projects are accurately scoped and plannedRepresent client needs and trends internallyParticipate in prioritized projects as assignedOther duties as assigned Experience & Skill Requirements Competence in communication, critical thinking and reasoning, and computer skillsA client service mentality and ability to keep client needs at the forefront of decision makingExceptional multi-taskerQuick learner who has ability to absorb knowledge and understand the software's capabilitiesOrganized, detail-oriented, and self-startingStrong work ethic with desire to grow your professional skill set Educational Requirements Bachelor's Degree with an emphasis in a technical discipline and a 3.5 GPA or higherAt least two years of classes or one year of prior experience using a programming languageFamiliarity with database design concepts desirable (e.g., primary keys, foreign keys, normalization)Familiarity with XML and XPATH desirableAbout Watermark  Watermark's mission is to put better data into the hands of administrators, faculty, and students everywhere to empower them to connect information and gain insights into learning that will drive meaningful improvements. Through its innovative educational intelligence system, Watermark supports over 1,600 institutions around the world in developing an intentional approach to learning so that they can leverage data for a more holistic view of learning, faculty and staff impact, and institutional quality.  For more information on Watermark, visit www.watermarkinsights.com.Watermark is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against an individual based on the individual's race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other protected characteristic or activity.

Name: IT Business Systems Analyst
Description: Doors are opening to a new career, at NABCO Entrances, Inc.  About NABCO Entrances, Inc.  NABCO ENTRANCES manufactures superior quality Gyro Tech brand automatic sliding doors, manual sliding doors, automatic swinging doors, manual swing doors, door conversion units, fire doors, bi-fold doors, activating devices for automated pedestrian doors and specialty doors that are distributed throughout North America. NABCO ENTRANCES is renowned for cutting edge technology backed by dependable service creating viable solutions for the challenges faced in today's commercial environment.  In 1971, Gyro Tech changed the automatic door industry by pioneering the first electromechanical operator. Since then, NABCO Entrances has been dedicated to being the premier supplier of quality entrance system products that meet growing pedestrian needs, and the needs of retail stores, hospitals, schools, restaurants and other commercial and industrial institutions throughout North America.  NABCO openly encourages creative teamwork among employees, management and its independent distributors in order to continually provide timely and effective solutions through the on-going development of a prompt delivery system, shorter lead-times, and the development of new products in response to market needs. Position Summary This position will lead SAP technologist for a manufacturing company operating in the US & Canada.  Essential Functions Work with key department users of ERP and related business systems to understand business needs.Translate business needs into clear requirements for execution by support team or consultants.Define issues and system defects as they arise and coordinate help desk tickets for resolution by support team and consultants.Maintain a high-level ERP software issues list; prioritize and schedule solution search or resolution in organized fashion.Responsible for the daily management of ERP access and user profiles.Identify and define reporting gaps across all functional areas. Knowledge of and experience in B.I./ business intelligence or other ERP reporting tools a plus.Participate in change management, process improvements and project management as needed.Coordinate ERP implementation in remaining off-site branches in Canada.Understand integration points between SAP R/3 in modules SD, MM, PP, SCM; basic knowledge of FI/CO is a plus.Develop process standards and documentation.Evaluate additional ERP-related software tools as needed.QUALIFICATIONS Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Strong problem assessment / analytical skillsCapable of defining process improvementsAbility to work within resource and time constraints through prioritizationAbility to manage numerous competing demandsKnowledge of SAP, ABAP, SAP Query preferred but not required. Education, Training, Experience Bachelors Degree in information technology, computer science, information systems management, or other related field2 to 3 years experience with basic SAP R/3 modules (SD/MM/PP) in either manufacturing or distribution environments preferredBusiness Intelligence or similar ERP reporting experience is a plusMust have a proven track record of coordinating business requirements and delivering solutions in an ERP system. Working Conditions and Physical Demands  Work is performed in a typical office environment, with little or no exposure to outside weather conditions. May be noisy at times due to proximity to factory. May require very limited travel (less than 1 week per month) to work with users at remote locations (U.S. and Canada). Must be available for overtime when required. This may occasionally include Saturdays and extended hours, with a personal commitment to staying later than closing hours to ensure all needed work is completed.  Benefits at NABCO Entrances, Inc.  We offer a highly competitive benefits package, including: paid vacation / holiday / sick time, employer matching 401(k) plan, health, dental and vision insurance, plus 100% employer paid Life, STD and LTD.  Stay Connected  Like NABCO Entrances, Inc. on Facebook at:SDL2017
