Name: Sr. Credit Analyst
Description: Town Bank, a Wintrust Community Bank, has over 20 locations in southern and southwestern Wisconsin. We provide a wide array of commercial and private banking services. Since our inception in 1998, the bank has grown to more than $1.9 billion in assets. Town Bank is a true community bank. Headquartered in Hartland, Wisconsin, we are a locally controlled and managed bank, with the unique ability to make decisions more quickly and provide more customized services and products that truly benefit residents of the area. We can pass the savings on to our customers in the form of better rates because we don't have the big overhead of other banks. That's what hometown banking is really about: friendly service and great products. Banking the way it ought to be.Town Bank is looking for an experienced Commercial Banking Credit Analyst/Underwriter to support the Commercial Banking credit needs for Town Bank in Milwaukee, WI.Manage the underwriting process to ensure all parties have a clear understanding of their respective responsibilities, and to ensure transactions are fully underwritten prior to submission for approvalAreas of ResponsibilityAssign tasks to credit analyst and RM; deals distributed depending on deal size, complexity, timeline, and capacityDevelop timeline and identify the necessary level of credit approvalCommunicate with Lender/Division Head related to timing/tasksMaintenance of the Underwriting Pipeline and pipeline meetings on a weekly basisIdentify key issues/mitigate and make sure underwriting supportsReview/perform cash flow analysisReview/perform collateral analysisIdentify true working capital need, and balance sheet sources/uses of cashSend Credit approval presentations/Memo to Division Head for input – Target the Friday before Credit Committee submissionReview Credit approval presentations/Memo prior to submission to the Credit CommitteeParticipate in Divisional MeetingsPortfolio ManagementManage the Portfolio review processTrain Credit analysts/Junior UnderwritersPerformance reviews for all Credit Analysts/Junior Underwriters5-7 years of experience of Commercial UnderwritingCommercial and Industrial experience is requiredCRE Underwriting experience is requiredManagement of Credit Analysts is preferred Wintrust Financial Corporation (Wintrust) is a financial services company based in Rosemont, Illinois, with approximately $27 billion in assets. We engage in the business of providing traditional community banking services, commercial banking, wealth management services, commercial insurance premium financing, life insurance premium financing, mortgage origination, short-term accounts receivable financing, and certain administrative services, such as data processing of payrolls, billing and treasury management services. We provide community-oriented, personal and commercial banking services to customers located in the greater Chicago, Illinois and southern Wisconsin areas through our 15 wholly-owned banking subsidiaries.  We provide an engaging, dynamic work environment, an excellent compensation package including 401k, employee stock purchase plan, medical/dental, life insurance and more!  Wintrust Financial Corporation (including community banking and financial services subsidiaries) is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action/Veterans/Disability employer.

Name: SAP Business Analyst - ERP
Description: Column Engineering is assisting a premier client in a search for a SAP Business Analyst - ERP in Waukesha, WI. This is a direct hire opportunity.  This position is the primary liaison between various business functions and the Engineering function for setting up customer quotations, configurable products, bill of materials, variant configuration pricing and the underlying master data. The position is responsible for SAP VC configuration initiatives, product configurator, Quick Quote, Acquire Express, Quick Spec, VC pricing, and related applications support. As a business Subject Matter Expert, the Business Analyst provides input to the engineering strategy for business challenges, requirements, and trends. The analyst will also be responsible for implementation of new configured products and systems for quotations. This position will also coordinate and support regression testing and testing of new applications. ResponsibilitiesUnderstands the validity of engineering requests and makes initial determination of severity of impact on currently available systems.Evaluates critical information gathered from multiple sources. Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Associated Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We support a work environment where colleagues are respected and given the opportunity to perform to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors. Applicants with a disability who need assistance applying for a position with Associated Bank are asked to email: colleaguecare@AssociatedBank.com or call: (800) 878-3282. Job Summary The Senior Financial Analyst will possess advanced knowledge of Management Accounting information, the Cognos reporting and analysis tool and data warehouse system and business line systems. Self-directed, the Senior Financial Analyst will collect, analyze and present financial information to help company management make sound business decisions and realize profit objectives. Leveraging the appropriate financial tool for the information and analysis needed is required. This person should provide thoughtful, accurate and precise analysis of data, effectively incorporating both fact and intuition into analysis and decision making. The Senior Financial Analyst uses strong communication skills to clearly explain financial results, profit improvement opportunities and financial analysis outcomes as well as exhibiting effective leadership skills. This individual should exhibit a strong potential for developing project management and problem solving skills. Compliance Statement Operates in full compliance with internal policies and procedures as well as applicable regulations and laws, including but not limited to Bank Secrecy Act/Anti-Money Laundering requirements. Responsible to report any procedure or process that doesn’t meet regulatory requirements including fraud, whether suspected or confirmed, to management. This reporting can be done directly to any member of management, including Human Resources or Corporate Security, or can be reported through Associated’s anonymous Ethics Hotline. Key Result AreasTime Management Leadership Communication Problem Solving Decision Making Documentation of processes and procedures Leadership Other Leadership in the development of report modeling, preparation and distribution Other Support to key line of business customer or finance manager Other Development and maintenance of model, system, process and user documentation Other Identification, validation and reconciliation of key data elements related to corporate, finance and external reporting. Other Ability to understand and convey to others the complex interrelationships between financial data and Financial systems/databases in non technical language. Job AccountabilitiesModel & operational processing, validation & maintenance. Provide research & analysis. Communicate & present in an effective, concise manner. Project Management. Ad hoc Activities. Report development & generation.EducationBachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience Accounting or Finance. Experience in the key results areas and competencies, in lieu of education, is considered., Required Bachelor's Degree Accounting or Finance, Preferred Experience4-7 years Financial services industry, with a background in financial analysis, enterprise reporting, cost accounting or general accounting., Required 4-7 years Financial services industry, with a background in financial analysis, enterprise reporting, cost accounting or general accounting, Preferred SkillsOperate Office Equipment , Organizational , Mathematical , Analytical , Verbal Communication , Written Communication , Microsoft Office , General Physical ConditionLight physical effort; routine handling of heavy objects up to 20 pounds or prolonged standing, keyboard, or CRT work (at least 50> of time)

Name: Senior IT Security Analyst
Description: Auto req ID: 645Title: Senior IT Security AnalystJob Function: Information TechnologyLocation: JUNEAUCompany: Harley-Davidson Motor CompanyFull or Part-Time: Full TimeShift: SHIFT1 We are paving more roads to Harley-Davidson by developing exhilarating new products, creating broader access to our iconic brand, and building a stronger dealer network. We can’t do it without the best and brightest. Step one of this strategic acceleration is adding talent who can blow the doors wide open with innovation and creativity while staying true to the Harley-Davidson brand and legacy. We are focused on the next 115 years. Are you in?Job Summary The Senior IT Security Analyst is responsible for understanding and working with the team in security activities, delivery, innovation, design, architecture, technical management, and service operation functions as appropriate in cybersecurity disciplined fields. The individual will contribute and participate in Disaster Recovery or Business Continuity Planning, Cryptography, Legal, Regulations, Compliance Investigations, Threat and Vulnerability Management, Security Incident Response, NIST Cyber Security Framework, Security Operations, Emerging Technologies security planning, Architecture and Technical Design, and Security Vendor Assessments. This role will actively contribute to complex technical scenarios across an international audience to arrive at a resolution via a methodical standardized process, and be viewed upon as the technical contributor, and provide detailed technical cybersecurity support to peers, other members of GIS and business stakeholders alike The Senior IT Security Analyst will work across a variety of critical business domains including consumer, dealer, corporate and industry lines such as manufacturing, financial services, and general merchandise, etc. Job ResponsibilitiesAssist in maintaining a secure enterprise environment across the HDI technical landscapeManage outcome based delivery model via outsourced partner leveraging technical leadership to pre-defined desired service operations outcomesDemonstrate understanding of cyber security structures, theories, principles and best practicesKnowledge of the best available tools, software, threat hunting techniques, applications and systems for maintaining best-in-class security environment statusDemonstrate expertise with security and information system life cycle methodologies, including remediation of cyber security audit risk mitigation activitiesCommunicate clearly, diplomatically and effectively at all levels of the organization and to audiences with varying degrees of process and technical knowledgeAssist with security testing and vulnerability testing across various technical mediums internationally focusedExecute tasks in a high-pressure environment and multi-taskExperience working in a team-oriented, matrixed, collaborative environment while using analytical and problem-solving abilitiesEducation Specifications A bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, Information Systems or Services is preferred; candidate must be willing to become a Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) (within 12 months of employment). Experience Requirements This role typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience including: 5 years active cyber security domain experienceHands on experience and proficiency in various cybersecurity tools that are common across the information security industryCandidates that have multiple cyber security domain competencies to build in a matrixed environmentBasic knowledge of common network cyber security tools/technologies to support the information security program   We offer an inclusive compensation package for all full-time salaried employees including, but not limited to, annual bonus programs, health insurance benefits, a 401k program, onsite fitness centers and employee stores, employee discounts on products and accessories, and more. We believe that employees do their best work when they are free to be themselves. This means our dress code is relaxed, and all types of work styles are welcomed.     Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States.    Direct Reports: No  Travel Required: 0 - 10%  Visa Sponsorship: This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship  Relocation: This position is eligible for domestic relocation assistance (within posted country)

Name: Sr. SSRS Reporting Analyst
Description: Sr Reporting AnalystWith moderate supervision, this position provides key support to the reporting team, operations and strategic initiatives by maintaining, modifying and querying multiple databases to provide standard and customized reports and analyses of moderate complexity. The position will translate business needs into technical requirements and ensure that requirements conform to overall objectives and specifications; summarize data, develop and maintain key executive level dashboards, develop and maintain corporate wide operational reporting solution, etc; perform data mining, complex programming, and report generation functions; and generate reports utilizing SQL 2007 and SSRS.REPORTING STRUCTURE & WORK SETTINGThis position typically performs work at the central headquarters and normally reports to the Sr. Director, Corporate Applications or another director or VP with corporate applications responsibility.ESSENTIAL DUTIES & PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIESNOTE: The essential duties and primary accountabilities below are intended to describe the general content of and requirements of this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive statement of duties. Incumbents may perform all or most of the primary accountabilities listed below. Specific tasks, responsibilities or competencies may be documented in the incumbent’s performance objectives as outlined by the incumbent’s immediate supervisor or manager.1. Design and develop reporting infrastructure utilizing SQL technologies (SSRS, SSIS)2. Conduct SQL queries and work with other data extraction, reporting and analytic tools to develop management reporting.3. Responsible for development and maintenance of Executive level dashboards and corporate wide operational reporting based on key performance indicators and a clear understanding of operational objectives.4. Collaborate with functional business managers to gather and analyze data, understand data requirements and design and subsequently develop reporting solutions/tools. 5. Responsible for the design, development and testing of API integration between core corporate applications.6. Establish manual and automated production processes for the collection and maintenance of data on an ongoing basis.7. Complete ad-hoc reporting requests as needed.8. Participate in process improvement design, development and delivery.MARGINAL DUTIES & ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONSParticipates in process improvement design, development and delivery.Performs other duties as assigned or apparent.ADDITIONAL PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTSWageWorks believes that our success is achieved by its People. Values describe how we work together to achieve our success. It is our employees that drive results through living our Company Values. Every employee at WageWorks is expected to uphold and demonstrate the eight Company Values listed below as an additional component of the job description and as a standard of individual performance. Clients and Participants Come First: Exceeding client and participant expectations is our highest priorityIntegrity: We are open, honest, ethical and conscientiousPassion: A will to win and a relentless drive for excellenceAccountability: Deliver on commitments and take ownership for solving problems and creating solutionsLeadership and Influence: Our actions inspire vision and clarity of purposeContinuous Improvement and Innovation: We embrace change and drive new ideas into business solutionsDignity and Respect: We value the diversity of our people, encourage their development and reward their performanceCreating Value for Shareholders: Deliver consistent growth and premium returnsSUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITYNOTE: WageWorks leadership will strive to uphold the mission, vision, and values of the organization. They will serve as role models for staff and act in a people-centered and results oriented manner with a focus on customer service.No formal supervisory responsibility entailed.ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIESEDUCATION:Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent combination of education and experience.WORK EXPERIENCE OR RELATED EXPERIENCE:Minimum five years experience applying data mining, data warehousing, and OLAP functionality techniques. Minimum five years experience with SQL Server Stored Procedure development. Minimum five years with SQL Server Reporting Services and SQL Server Integration Services required. Knowledge and experience with ASP.NET and C# web development experience. Knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle including but not limited to table creation, stored procedure development, data transformation services, job scheduler, and performance tuning. Knowledge and experience coding with T-SQL, PL/SQL; MS Access, data normalization and data de-normalization required. Experience with OLAP reporting tools, Crystal Reports or any other enterprise level business analytics software. Knowledge and experience with AJAX, JavaScript and Prototype.SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:Strong healthcare experience preferredAble to translate strategic business logic into technical report requirements and schema designAble to communicate clearly and professionally with all levels of an organizationAnalytical skills and attention to detailSelf-motivated with the ability to work well under pressureThe ability to interact effectively with all levels of stakeholders throughout the organization is required. Good communication skills and a professional demeanor are essentialThe ability to act on own initiative with minimal supervision is requiredThe ability to remain focused and produce outputs while under the pressure of time constraints is also required.EQUIPMENT:Proficiency with business and communications software (preferably Word, Excel, PowerPoint, common Windows operating systems, and Outlook) is required.A strong, technical knowledge and understanding of OLAP reporting tools, Crystal Reports and enterprise levels business analytics software is required.TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS & CONDITIONSTravel is generally not required but overnight and/or successive overnight travel may be required for business needs.WORK ENVIRONMENT CONDITIONS & DEMANDSWork is generally performed in an office environment in which there is only minimal exposure to unpleasant and/or hazardous working conditions.PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & DEMANDSWork requires normal range of hearing and eyesight. Incumbent must be able to use a telephone or headset equipment and operate a keyboard and other office equipment. The ability to perform work at a computer terminal for 6-8 hours a day and function in an environment with constant interruptions is required. At times, incumbents are subject to sitting for prolonged periods. Infrequently, incumbent must be able to lift and move material weighing up to 10 lbs. Incumbent may experience increased levels of stress during periods of increased activity and with work entailing multiple deadlines.Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions as described.

Name: Business Consultant
Description: Create lasting, positive impact. By considering Wipfli LLP, you’ve decided to go beyond the ordinary public accounting and consulting firm. At Wipfli, we create positive impact and lifetime relationships by leading and working with an outward mindset. As a member of our team, you will be inspired to think freely and follow your passion, grow as a professional by developing your skills and commit to serving our clients and communities with honesty and integrity.  Wipfli has a broad national footprint with offices coast to coast — and we’re still growing! As an associate, you’ll have access to skill development and career opportunities, whether you want to move up or transition into another area of specialty. You’ll also have the flexibility and technology to work wherever you are, whether it’s at home or in our clients’ offices, or switching Wipfli offices if you’re looking to move across the country.  Join a company focused on giving back to the greater good — at Wipfli, we’re committed to supporting the communities we do business in. To learn more about our volunteer efforts, who we are and what we do, visit wipfli.com.  Are you interested in helping companies thrive through innovative thinking, structured problem solving and the implementation of information technology systems? Consider learning more about the Consulting Practice at Wipfli. Our consultants work closely with our clients to help them optimize their value streams – the way they deliver value via products and services to their customers.  More specifically consultants get involved with our clients in the following project experiences: Analysis, design, selection and implementation of ERP and CRM software systemsAnalysis, design and implementation of Business Intelligence systems, enabling our clients to turn data into meaningful information to better serve critical business decisions.Software configuration and development, including mobile application development and engineering, leveraging leading edge technology.Business analysis and project management associated with industry software solutions in Insurance, Health Care, Construction and Manufacturing organizations.Network infrastructure design, configuration and administrationExposure to Lean principles in all that we do.Wipfli is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All candidates will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identify, citizenship status, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristics protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Name: Implementation Consultant
Description: TechCanary is seeking highly energetic and self-motivated Implementation Consultants to join the CanaryServices team, TechCanary's Professional Services division. The ideal candidate will have a knack for engaging stakeholders and building solid relationships of trust to provide the best customer experience - the TechCanary Way. THE 411 ON TECHCANARY: TechCanary is a dynamic software company that is dramatically changing the way insurance agents do business. Founded in 2013 with corporate headquarters in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, we are a proud Milwaukee Future 50 company, a distinction bestowed upon us by the Metropolitan Milwaukee Association of Commerce (MMAC). As the #5 of the 50 fastest growing MMAC companies, we bring the worlds #1 CRM solution to the insurance industry by delivering a full-featured Agency Management System (AMS) built into the Salesforce.com platform.  Agents can now conduct business anytime, anywhere and on any device. In addition to managing their business, TechCanary enables them to focus on managing their growth. Many of the cumbersome and costly manual steps required today for agents to run their agency on legacy software solutions are replaced by an automated, streamlined, and flexible cloud-based methodology. Through the TechCanary solution, agents will realize dramatic operational efficiency gains and cost reductions, as well as a resultant increase in revenue and income.  Recognized as one of the fastest-growing companies in the Milwaukee Region in 2016 and 2017 and #393 on the 2018 Inc. 5000, we're growing in our new downtown digs just steps from the Fiserv Forum, the Milwaukee Bucks' new arena. If you think outside the cage and want to use your creative skills with a growing team, fly with The Flock at TechCanary. THE VIEW FROM THE TOP Under general supervision of the VP, CanaryServices, the Implementation Consultant is a key member of the implementation & support team within CanaryServices, responsible for planning & executing the set-up and training of TechCanarys award-winning insurance solutions products. THE NITTY GRITTY (What will you actuallybe doing?)Consult with client to analyze business model to identify and document client's requirements from TechCanary's productsLead the implementation and optimization of CanaryAMS at client sites or remotelyInterface and meet with prospects and clients as needed for any of the following: software implementation or upgrade, problem resolution, enhancements, specialized reporting, training, pre- and post-sales supportImplement software while adhering to the project management model for smooth delivery of standard implementationsInform client management and relevant personnel of project statusProvide project management responsibilities for life cycle of projectAddress technical questions; occasionally provide backup to existing technical support staff; resolve customer technical issues and concernsDevelop and deliver customer training, both onsite and remoteCollaborate with clients to optimize their Agency Management SystemLearn and master the capabilities of the system and advise customers on how to most effectively use the solution, including modifying customers' existing processes, procedures, work-flow, forms and contentIdentify opportunities to improve the system and disseminate client feedback to the relevant departments within the organizationWork with team members to define, prioritize, and implement selected enhancements.CANARY COMPETENCIES (What you already bring to the table and what you can expect to be competent in after successful onboarding)Ability & enjoyment working with people to build relationships, understand needs, and find solutions to meet needsHard-working, flexible team player able to work across various departments and management levelsAbility to thoroughly learn and understand the industry in which the product competes/servesAbility to thoroughly engage client to understand their business and processes with skill to turn this knowledge into an implementation and training planKnowledge of and experience in insurance agency space within the insurance spectrumTechnical aptitude: high proficiency with web-based systems and SalesforceExcellent communication skills (oral and written) with ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organizationExcellent active listening and presentation skills with ability to understand how the client best learns to tailor a presentation based on learning styleCommunication skills are extremely important: must be able to communicate at all levels within any organization; excellent written communication, verbal communication, active listening and presentation skills.Ability to self-direct work and work independently within a teamStrong problem solving skills and willingness to roll up ones sleeves to get the job doneStrong attention to detailAbility to provide occasional support outside regular business hoursAbility & willingness to travel 7-10 days per month to client sites throughout the US and internationally, as neededStrong business process, time management and analytical skills are essentialTHE CANARY CAGE This job operates in an office environment and routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, copiers/scanners and various online tools. MUSCLES USED While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear and conducts most of their work using computers. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. CANARY MIGRATIONS This bird will be spreading its wings and flying (figuratively we mean, as we're referring to actual travel outside the office) up to 20% of the time to client sites. WHAT'S THE DEALIO This is a full-time position with an expectation of 40 hours of work per week.  TechCanary allows flexible work schedules to meet the needs of both the employee and the business. However, the core (peak) hours this employee should expect to be present and working daily are 9:00am to 3:00pm CST. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required to meet needs and as duties demand. MUST HAVESUniversity degree; preferably in Information TechnologyMinimum of two (2) years of business systems implementation or support experienceNICE TO HAVESPrevious software industry experience a plusPrevious insurance industry experience a plusMS/BS degree in Accounting, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent preferredWHAT YOU CAN EXPECT OF USA team-oriented, supportive environmentAn open-minded office that values contributions from all playersFree snacks!A relaxed and fun work environmentTeam-building and social eventsFree drinks!Challenging workDevelopment opportunitiesFree snacks!A pretty snazzy benefits package on par with the big dogsThe ability to join a growing company and get in on the ground floor to help us mold our futureDid we mentionfree snacks?! That's Snacks on Snacks on Snacks!OK, yes we know snacks are not what make it or break it for an employee. We believe they're just a little added perk on top of the employee experience with TechCanary to ensure our employees are well taken care of.INTEREST PIQUED? READY TO LEARN MORE? Then let's go. Click that handy dandy Apply box.

Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: Job Title: Pricing Analyst*DRS Technologies*DRS Technologies* is a leading supplier of integrated products, services and support to military forces, intelligence agencies and prime contractors worldwide. Focused on defense technology, we develop, manufacture and support a broad range of systems for mission critical and military sustainment requirements, as well as homeland security. Headquartered in Arlington, VA, the Company is a wholly owned subsidiary of Leonardo S.p.A. which employs more than 70,000 people worldwide. We offer a competitive compensation package and a business culture which rewards performance. For additional information on DRS, please visit our website at www.drs.com. DRS Company*DRS Naval Power Systems (NPS)* a multi-site operation responsible for $350 million of revenue with locations in Milwaukee, WI, Bridgeport/Danbury, CT, Fitchburg, MA, and High Ridge, MO with an employee base of approximately 900 employees. NPS is structured into four Lines of Business: Power, Machines, Nuclear Instrumentation and Controls, and Marlo Coil, focusing on supporting the power and propulsion needs of the U.S. Navy. We provide engineering, manufacturing and lifetime support of our highly engineered products.Job Location: *Milwaukee, WIPosition Summary* The Pricing Analyst reviews requests for proposals (RFP?s) to identify requirements and assist the proposal team in developing and submitting compliant responses, works with internal organizations to determine anticipated labor and overhead rates, material requirements, equipment costs, and possible bid strategies. This position develops, evaluates and implements pricing, pricing strategies, and models based upon current business and competitive market dynamics. Duties and Responsibilities:*Reviews Requests for Proposals to identify requirements and assist the proposal team in developing proposals compliant with the RFP, company procedures, and government regulations (FAR/DFARS)Works with internal organizations to determine anticipated labor and material requirements, equipment costs, and possible bid strategiesAnalyzes estimates against previous cost experience and recommends adjustmentsConducts payback, risk, cash, and revenue analysisSupport pricing, audit, and negotiation activitiesPartners with Sales/Marketing, Business Development, Program Management, and Finance to correctly position product portfolio and establish pricing programs aligned with product/sales strategy and revenue recognition requirementsCreates/administers pricing databases and coordinates implementation of pricing proposals across the organizationBasic Qualifications:*Bachelor?s Degree in Finance with 5+ years directly related of experience, preferably in a DOD/government contracting environment (or equivalent combination of education/training and experience)Pricing Tool (ProPricer) experienceExperience with advanced data analysis, management, and computational tools including Microsoft Excel pivot tables, SQL, VBAPhysical Requirements:* While performing the duties of this job, the employee requires normal manual dexterity, speech and hearing. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to thirty-five (35) pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job require frequent use of a computer monitor. Physical Demands:* The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  We offer a very competitive base salary commensurate with experience and a business culture which rewards good performance. The Company offers a full range of employee benefits.  Candidates must be a US citizen and meet DRS security standards as imposed by DoD, including the issuance of any necessary security clearance by the US government within a reasonable time after commencement of employment.  DRS Technologies is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital or veteran status, or any other category protected by federal, state or local law. #JS #NPS

Name: Technical Consultant
Description: Job Description The Technical Consultant will work closely with clients to solve complex technical problems and design ideal configurations for their use of Digital Measures by Watermark. The TC partners with clients to identify and support goals in using Digital Measures by Watermark, providing best-practice guidance and assistance so they can achieve those goals.Essential Duties and ResponsibilitiesServe as the primary technical contact for implementations and other client projectsConsult with clients on how to achieve their goals while considering best practices for database design, reporting and data managementComplete configuration work requests for clients using basic programming skillsLead data migration projects, including parsing, mapping, and converting data filesCollaborate with internal team members to ensure client projects are accurately scoped and plannedRepresent client needs and trends internallyParticipate in prioritized projects as assignedOther duties as assignedExperience & Skill RequirementsCompetence in communication, critical thinking and reasoning, and computer skillsA client service mentality and ability to keep client needs at the forefront of decision makingExceptional multi-taskerQuick learner who has ability to absorb knowledge and understand the software’s capabilitiesOrganized, detail-oriented, and self-startingStrong work ethic with desire to grow your professional skill setEducational RequirementsBachelor's Degree with an emphasis in a technical discipline and a 3.5 GPA or higherAt least two years of classes or one year of prior experience using a programming languageFamiliarity with database design concepts desirable (e.g., primary keys, foreign keys, normalization)Familiarity with XML and XPATH desirableAbout Watermark Watermark’s mission is to put better data into the hands of administrators, faculty, and students everywhere to empower them to connect information and gain insights into learning that will drive meaningful improvements. Name: Actuarial Analyst
Description: We Are HiringTitle: Actuarial Analyst City, State: Glendale, WI Location: AW Glendale Office Department: Corporate Transactions 001 Additional Job Details: FT Days Why Join Ascension?Ascension is a faith-based healthcare organization dedicated to transformation through innovation across the continuum of care. As the largest non-profit health system in the U.S. and the world’s largest Catholic health system, Ascension is committed to delivering compassionate, personalized care to all, with special attention to persons living in poverty and those most vulnerable. In FY2017, Ascension provided more than $1.8 billion in care of persons living in poverty and other community benefit programs. Ascension includes approximately 165,000 associates and 34,000 aligned providers. Ascension’s Healthcare Division operates more than 2,600 sites of care – including 153 hospitals and more than 50 senior living facilities – in 22 states and the District of Columbia, while its Solutions Division provides a variety of services and solutions including physician practice management, venture capital investing, investment management, biomedical engineering, facilities management, clinical care management, information services, risk management, and contracting through Ascension’s own group purchasing organization.What You Will Do As an Associate with Ascension System Office-MO, you will have the opportunity to conduct quality data analysis and clinical decision support for designated system(s). You will:Compile actuarial analytical reports as needed.Formulate, define, and recommend scope and format of reportsOversee provision of ad hoc management reports.Assist with the pricing and product development of commercial fully and self-funded productsProduce and reviews insurance filing materialsReview data and reports for accuracy and conduct data reconciliation on a regular basisIndependently creates and maintains actuarial modelsEstablishe efficiency reporting processes and workflowsMonitor emerging experience and recommends corrective actionsCommunicate actuarial results to a wide audience, including non-actuaries and senior level executives.What You Will NeedEducation:Bachelor’s Degree from an Accredited University in relevant area (Epidemiology, Public Health, Statistics, Health/Business Administration) including data analysis, decision support, proficiency with analytical software and IT experience required.Bachelor's degree in actuarial science or related field is preferred.Successful completion of 2 SOA exams is preferred.Work Experience:Three years experience in a related healthcare field with knowledge of healthcare industry required.Two years of experience in Commercial Health Insurance or provider contracting is preferred.Equal Employment OpportunityAscension Health is an EEO/AA employer: M/F/Disabled/Vet. For further information regarding your EEO rights, click on the following link to the “EEO is the Law” poster:http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf”Please note that Ascension will make an offer of employment only to individuals who have applied for a position using our official application. Name: Sales Order Analyst
Description: POSITION TITLE: Outsourcing Procurement Agent  REPORTS TO: Purchasing manager PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Konecranes has an opening for a Sub-Contracting Purchasing Agent and, depending on candidate qualifications, this position could be a senior level to entry level position.  This Candidate will work with our manufacturing and scheduling teams to purchase raw steel fabrication kits as well as subcontracting of outside operations for our Watertown Parts Manufacturing Center (PMC). Create purchase orders daily for our internally fabricated items that need processing outside of our machining capabilities.Obtain Quotes and purchase raw steel fabricated kits for items being made at the PMC.Work with suppliers to resolve non-conforming product issues and expedite orders as needed.Approve PO invoices for payment and reconcile receipt of invoice discrepancies from suppliers.Work with Corporate Purchasing to identify and best utilize a network of preferred suppliers.Identify and implement cost saving initiatives.Responsible for daily review of open purchase requisitions and escalate any delays to the appropriate persons.Act on system generated material exceptions, expediting, delaying or cancelling on-order material as necessary, and communicating results to the required group or individual.Perform continuous system maintenance in SAP at the part number, supplier, and Purchasing Agent levels to assure system integrity is intact and information is correct for all viewers.Evaluate effectiveness of suppliers in terms of (1) pricing and cost reductions, (2) on time delivery performance, and (3) consistent quality.The Sub-Contracting Purchasing Agent is responsible for communicating all component requirements to the potential supply sources, assuring strict conformance to Konecranes product specifications and quality program.Work within the team including customer service, and other internal groups to determine the best methods of supporting customers.Some travel may be required to visit suppliers; other Konecranes locations as well as corporate headquarters for training. Travel can be up to 10%.Other duties as assigned.EDUCATION: Bachelor's Degree strongly preferred in the areas of Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Engineering or related discipline. REQUIRED EXPERIENCE: Knowledge of SAP, manufacturing processes, technical drawings, and Microsoft Office is preferred.  Job Type: Full-time  Experience: Industrial Planning: 1 year (Preferred)SAP: 1 year (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Location: West Allis, WI (Required)

Name: Commercial Credit Analyst Intern
Description: Description Position at First BusinessJoin the winning team at First Business as a  Commercial Credit Analyst Intern! First Business is a locally managed successful, entrepreneurial, and growth-oriented financial services company that specializes in focused financial solutions for businesses, key executives, and high net worth individuals through its operating companies. Our companies specialize in commercial banking, asset-based lending, equipment financing, retirement plans, investment management, and trustee services. We provide specifically tailored solutions to meet our clients’ financial goals.  First Business Financial Services (NASDAQ: FBIZ) is a $1.9 billion Wisconsin-based bank holding company. We are a growing company with opportunities that are vital to the operations and success of the company. We see our growth strategy as an opportunity to not only increase our market presence, but also to add top talent to our team of professionals.  As an intern with First Business you will gain valuable work experience in a professional environment, leveraging your prior experience, education, and involvement. Our interns play an essential role in the departments they are part of, working on important responsibilities, special projects, and networking with our teams. Internship Purpose: This position will provide an opportunity to work closely with the commercial lending team of a Madison based publicly traded commercial bank, including working with a team of credit analysts, commercial lenders and business development officers, and senior credit managers. Specifically as a Commercial Credit Analyst Intern you will:Input financial statement data into company software and analyze to determine the credit worthiness of existing and prospective commercial clients.Prepare Cash Flow worksheets to demonstrate borrower’s ability to repay loans.Gain exposure to the commercial loan approval process by completing credit presentations and memos (which are used to approve new loans, renew existing loans, or report losses and/or covenant violations) for Loan Approval Committee.Develop a working knowledge of loan policy and gain the ability to communicate its interpretation and rationale to other bank employees.Input data, build tables and build borrower relationships into credit presentations.Work on other projects with department manager.Requirements: Desire to pursue a career in commercial banking in a business development capacityBe pursuing a degree in Finance or AccountingStrong technology proficiency (strong skills in Excel a plus)Above average communication skills, both verbal and writtenStrong attention to detail, problem solving skills, and ability to prioritize work to meet numerous levels of deadlinesDemonstrated drive, initiative, and work ethicImportant Information – Internship Length, Hours, & Schedule: Forty hours per week during the summer will be available. We are looking for an individual to 15-20 hours per week during the school year. Flexibility of working hours during the semester will be available. This internship will run through at least the end of Spring semester 2020, with the potential to be extended if the candidate is still a student. The position will start May 2019. The position works out of our Brookfield location with some travel to our Madison headquarters, so ability to travel to/from during the semester is necessary. Please include a list of all applicable coursework on your resume.  First Business Financial Services, Inc. is committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all applicants and employees regardless of their race, creed, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, military service, protected veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. We are strongly committed to this policy and believe in the concept and spirit of the law.

Name: Bank Secrecy Act Analyst I
Description: This is a Full-Time position located near 27th Street and College Ave in Oak Creek, WI.BASIC FUNCTION: Serves as a key member of the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) team and assists in various functions assigned by the Bank’s BSA Officer with compliance of the Bank Secrecy Act, Customer Identification Program (CIP), and Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) requirements. Provides data entry and clerical support as needed. Acts as a resource to all bank departments and employees to enforce BSA Compliance throughout the bank. DESCRIPTION OF MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES: May perform any or all of the following: Collect branch and department logs and reports in order to conduct BSA/AML reviews and reporting.Interdepartmental distribution of the 314(a) search request. Review and processing of search request.Review and processing of OFAC.Perform quality assurance reviews on new accounts opened to ensure compliance with the USA PATRIOT Act and the Bank’s Customer Identification Program AND Customer Due Diligence Program.Conducts annual Currency Transaction Report (CTR) Exemption reviews.Utilize various reports to identify suspicious transactions and activity that is incongruent with the type of business or stated activity at account opening. Report any suspicious activity detected during monitoring to an officer of the BSA Department.Adhere the strict BSA related standards set forth by the Bank, as described through the Bank’s BSA Policy and Procedures. Stay current with all BSA regulations.Assist with preparation of BSA employee training.Perform other duties as assigned.RequirementsKNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:Minimum of one-year banking experience including branch/platform experience and/or direct work experience in BSA/AML area.Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint programs.High degree of accuracy and attention to detail.Strong analytical skills, with the ability to multi-task.Involves regular contact with all levels of bank staff where excellent verbal and written communication skills are required.Requires organizational and time management skills and the ability to work well independently and with others.Develop a working knowledge of Bank policy and procedures.Must be able to maintain the confidentiality of all customer information.SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBLITIES: None. EQUIPMENT TO BE USED: Basic office equipment. TYPICAL PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Requires prolonged sitting. Requires eye-hand coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to operate office equipment. Requires normal range of hearing and vision to record, prepare and communicate appropriate reports. TYPICAL MENTAL DEMANDS: Must complete responsibilities in a timely and accurate manner on a regular basis. Must be mentally adaptable and flexible in dealing with a variety of people. Emotional stability and personal maturity are important attributes in this position. Must be capable of prolonged periods of concentration. OTHER: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Name: Field Tech Analyst
Description: Req ID: 35059     At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.     NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Field Tech Analyst to join our team in Milwaukee, Wisconsin (US-WI), United States (US).       Primary Responsibilities:Responds to customer technical problems/issues related to hardware, software and networking via e-mail/chat and phone.Assists customers by diagnosing problems and providing resolutions for technical and service issues.Uses troubleshooting techniques and tools to identify products that are defective and follow guidelines in issuing service calls/contacts.Advises/educates customers within procedural guidelines to ensure a complete solution to their technical or service questions.Focuses on delivering a positive customer experience according to NTT Data standards.Monitors and tracks issues to ensure accurate resolution.Assumes complete ownership of customer issue until resolved involving multiple inbound and outbound communications. Name: Internship - IT Business Analysis (Year-Round)
Description: Baird Position Title: Internship - IT Business Analysis (Year-Round)  31-Aug-2018 Department IT-Project Services Job Description Are you looking to gain real world experience in a thriving, global financial services firm with an award winning culture? Consider an internship and start building your career at Baird. About our intern program: Our competitive intern program is a robust experience that offers interns exposure to the business world and a meaningful work experience. Interns are treated as valuable team members while learning from experienced professionals in a collaborative, fun, and dynamic environment. Baird’s summer program activities include an Intern Welcome Event in our corporate office in Milwaukee, multiple Lunch & Learns, a Brewer’s game at Miller Park, Baird Night at the Zoo, and many other informal events. Our interns have the opportunity to use a Baird Cares Day and be compensated to volunteer in the community. They are also eligible to apply for $8,000 in scholarships. Our informal mentor program gives interns an opportunity to network throughout Baird and learn about all the areas of the firm. To learn more, check out this video.  The Baird Business Analysis team delivers business analysis, project management and quality assurance expertise to identify and implement technology solutions that meet the business needs and challenges. The Intern will assist in delivering value-add solutions working on small project requests and/or as part of a large project team, while learning and applying agile principles and other project delivery methodologies.  IT has a track record of success with interns across their various teams, all who have the ability to directly contribute to the success of the department. Interns apply knowledge gained in the classroom to develop relevant professional experience while developing meaningful relationships. Interns are treated as valuable team members and are challenged with meaningful work while learning from experienced professionals in a collaborative, fun, and dynamic environment. We look for highly motivated individuals who are proactive, eager to learn and ready to contribute. Internship Location, Availability and Hours: We have year round and summer internships in our downtown Milwaukee office. Year round requires working part-time during the Spring and Fall semesters (15-20 hours/week) and full-time during the Summer (37.5-40 hours/week). We are seeking a student who is able to start in April or May 2019. As an IT Business Analysis Intern, you will:Elicit requirements in conjunction with a mentor by the use of interviews, workflow analysis, requirements workshops, and surveys to provide business requirements, use cases, and user stories.Participate in collaboration sessions with project team members (developers, architects, product owners) to assist in the creation and delivery of the technical vision.Partner with the Quality Assurance (QA) team to define and execute testing strategies.Experience Baird’s culture by shadowing current team members. Receive mentorship from an experienced team member and partner with a manager on professional development.Collaborate with fellow interns to identify and propose a value-driven, firm-wide initiative to Baird Leadership.What we look for:Pursuing a Business or Communications degree with a concentration in technology. Targeting December 2019 or later graduation dates.Working knowledge of Microsoft Office is required and MS Visio is a plus.Exceptional written and oral communication skills with ability to build strong relationships.Possess a natural curiosity in understanding the application of technology to solve business problems.Positive attitude, proactive in seeking additional work, and strong initiative.Detail oriented and exhibits organizational, time management, and problem solving skills.A 3.3 GPA or better is preferred.What makes this opportunity great:Interns apply knowledge gained in the classroom to develop relevant professional experience while developing meaningful relationships.IT interns enjoy a collaborative work environment where they can thrive and reach their full potentialOpportunity to work for a Computerworld Best Places to Work in IT!Who we are: Baird is an employee owned, international wealth management, capital markets, private equity and asset management firm with more than 100 offices in the United States, Europe and Asia. Established in 1919, Baird has over $200 billion in client assets and more than 3,400 associates serving the needs of individual, corporate, institutional and municipal clients.  Baird has built an environment of trust, respect and teamwork, where associates are our greatest asset. As stated in our Associate Promise, we are passionate about how we achieve great outcomes together for our clients, communities and each other. Committed to being a great place to work, Baird ranked No. 12 on the Fortune magazine 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2018, our fifteenth consecutive year on the list. Baird has also received a perfect score on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation’s 2018 Corporate Equality Index. To learn more about Baird’s culture, click here. Name: Sales and Commission Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionARI is growing and we are looking for a Sales and Commission Analyst to report daily sales and the delivery, calculation, reconciliation, and payment of our incentive compensation plans for the sales and customer success departments.  Do you have strong attention to detail? Look no further than ARI! ARI Network Services, Inc. (“ARI”) offers an award-winning suite of SaaS, software tools, and marketing services to help dealers, equipment manufacturers and distributors in selected vertical markets Sell More Stuff!TM – online and in-store. Our innovative products are powered by a proprietary data repository of enriched original equipment and aftermarket electronic content spanning more than 17 million active part and accessory SKUs and 750,000 equipment models. Business is complicated, but we believe our customers’ technology tools don’t have to be. We remove the complexity of selling and servicing new and used vehicle inventory, parts, garments and accessories (PG&A) for customers in the automotive, tire and wheel, powersports, outdoor power equipment, marine, home medical equipment, recreational vehicles, and appliance industries. More than 23,000 dealers, 195 distributors, and 3,360 OEM brands worldwide leverage our web and eCatalog platforms to Sell More Stuff! TM. Headquartered in Milwaukee, WI, ARI maintains offices across North America, the Netherlands and India. The company has about 450 employees worldwide and installs in over 100 countries.  ARI’s strong leadership team executes on the company’s vision, successfully positioning ARI for rapid growth in an exciting, competitive space. Under this leadership, the Company produced in excess of $50 million in revenues in FY17. We expect the Company to more than double revenues in the next three years. Responsibilities · Perform administrative tasks related to commission plan documents.  · Monthly, calculate, record and reconcile commission accruals in the accounting system.  · Calculate monthly and quarterly commission payments and submit proper reports to payroll.  · Maintain an accurate trackable record of commissions and supporting data.  · Summarize and communicate commission data to participants including maintaining dashboards and reports in Dynamics CRM.  · Respond to all commission questions in a timely manner.  · Evaluate commission guidelines periodically and suggest improvement measures.  · Other accounting duties as assigned. What you should bring? · Associates’s degree in Accounting or Finance and/or equivalent experience.  · Minimum 2-3 years of Accounting or Financial Analyst experience.  · Experience in sales compensation administration/operations (preferably in a SAAS organization) is preferred.  · Attention to detail  · Ability to handle change and be effective in a fast-pace environment  · Strong time management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks  · Excellent written and verbal communication skills  · Self-motivated/directed  · Software knowledge: Excel, Dynamics (CRM a plus) Location: Milwaukee, WI ARI Network Services, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.Company DescriptionARI Network Services is one of the fastest growing industry specific, Digital Marketing services companies in the Midwest. Milwaukee Business Journal listed ARI as part of the top 25 Largest Area Software Product Companies in Milwaukee for the second straight year! ARI is a leading provider of electronic catalogs and dealer websites that enable dealers to achieve excellence in selling and servicing their customers.

Name: REMOTE CERNER CLAIRVIA SUPPORT ANALYST
Description: Title: REMOTE CERNER CLAIRVIA SUPPORT ANALYST  Location: United States  Other Locations: US-IL-Chicago  Job Number: 18212361  CTG is seeking a resource to support the ClairVia workforce application utilized for clinical staff scheduling and determining patient acuity. There are three programs in the ClairVia software suite: CVM Client, CVM Web and CVM Administrator. This resource should be familiar with NPAS Assessments imported from Cerner to measure patient acuity.  Responsibilities include all support such as incidents, service/change request, routine maintenance. This position is remote. Must be on site for knowledge transfer (3-6 weeks) at the start of project. Will be part of on call rotation.  Census Mismatch  Due to workflow issues between Cerner and ClairVia, there will be instances where the census (i.e. patient list) in ClairVia will not be the same as the census in Cerner Millennium (i.e. PowerChart). This will present itself to users as ClairVia either having extra patients or missing patients. Resolution involves finding out the erroneous patient?s FIN (AKA encounter number) and checking Cerner records to manually transfer or discharge the patient accordingly.  Interface issues  There are interfaces between ClairVia and Clockwork, Banner / HR Front End, and the production ADT interface. The Clockwork and Banner interfaces deal with new users / employees being imported to ClairVia. The HR import file needs to be checked to ensure the new employees have their correct cost center coming across.  System Down  Multiple users cannot access ClairVia. Confirm if it is one or all ClairVia applications that cannot be accessed (Web or Client ). Ping the relevant servers and gather relevant information to engage the vendor and the sever team.  Patient Acuity? Manage patient acuity based on NPAS assessments? NPAS (Nurse Patient Assessment System) powerform data imported real-time from Cerner? Custom tool developed by UIMC in 2005? Not used by all units, some use Clairvia acuity (such as 8E Psych) while others use different acuity systems (such as Surgical Services and the Emergency Department) while others don?t use an acuity system? Acuity used for patient assignment of RNs and NTs  Common Requests  Access Request of various levels of access and New builds for nursing units/clinics based on user specifications Other applications supported include:Healthstream Morrisey MSOWAllscripts SCMSunquest LISGE MUSE/PowerScribe 360/Provation MDMcKesson EnterpriseRxCerner Millennium/TransChart/Teletracking XTMidas Plus/VizientOptum Computer Assisted CodingQualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).  CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.  CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.  Job: Healthcare & Hospital Implementations

Name: Digital Experience Data Analyst
Description: Experis IT - A Manpower Company is the premier vendor for some of the most prestigious companies in the Wisconsin. We have partnered with a local healthcare company to find a long-term contract Digital Experience Data Analyst assist their team. If you are interested in applying and hearing more about the opportunity, please connect with Missy Gonzales at missy.gonzales@experis.com . Referrals are welcomed and rewarded! Standard Job Description: This person identifies measurement plans and tracking requirements for the business' digital platforms and programs that help to understand consumer behavior and online activities. This person works with team members to define goals and KPI's for digital projects and configures the core systems for tracking and reporting. They will also: Designs reports and dashboards that help to derive meaningful insights from digital activities. With a focus on tier one and tier two digital platforms, ensures proper tracking of business outcomes, return on objectives and return on investments. Collaborates with team members to define goals and KPI's and identify the best way to track metrics within digital platforms. Works in analytics and tracking software to complete system configuration, implement tracking codes, and pull data for use in reports or dashboards for platforms, projects and campaigns. Designs and develops reports for digital programs and collaborate with team members to provide data for integrated marketing reports. Executes A/B, multivariate and other testing, including the interpretation of results and recommendations. Reviews and analyzes digital platforms and websites to identify trends and areas of improvement relative to traffic patterns and conversion activity. Presents complex data, analysis or findings to teams in a way that is clear and understandable. Collaborates with internal and external teams to identify and prioritize recommendations based on insights uncovered from data analysis. Participates in the development of analytical and statistical methods, best practices and systemic processes that enable standardization and automation of tracking and reporting. Qualifications: Typically requires 3 years of experience in this area. Digital analytics and reporting AB testing, Google Analytics and Tag Manager. Knowledge of digital analytics processes, tracking, platforms and reporting. Google Analytics experience and certification preferred. Ability to identify and compare consumer web behavior across distinct platforms of desktop, mobile and tablet. Experience with data tracking, organization and visualization tools such as Excel, Tableau, etc. Experience with site path analysis, conversion funnels and online testing frameworks (A/B, multivariate). Understanding of digital channels: websites, mobile, CRM, social media, email marketing, and SEO/SEM. Ability to work and function in a complex corporate system environment and be a champion of our digital strategy efforts. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to communicate/collaborate effectively with all levels of employees, management, and external organizations. Learns quickly when facing new problems, curious and open to change Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a fast pace, dynamic environment. Experis is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE/AA) - provided by Dicedata analyst, digital analytics, google analytics, SEO, digital marketing, web analytics, web analyst, digital experience, AB testing, data, website, testing, analytics, web marketing, digital specialist, ecommerce

Name: Commodity Analyst/ Manager
Description: DescriptionThe Commodity Manager is responsible for identifying and managing short and long-term sourcing strategies, contracts and relationships with suppliers. The commodity manager will have full responsibility for his/her commodities including improving supplier performance, lead time, new product development, risk management and developing a lean supplier network design focused on improving customer service. ResponsibilitiesSet and reinforce standards for a safe work environment. Supplier relationship management and facilitation of communication across all stakeholders.Regularly submit to suppliers their performance metrics. Discuss and follow up with them on the action plan to improve their key performance indicators (KPIs).Optimize supplier performance and lead times in line with stakeholder requirements, implementing asset management strategies and facilitating supplier cooperation to improve on time performance. Ensure to meet yearly KPI targets and data accuracy in Emerson tracking systems (project tracker tool, Cost impact report) which follows Emerson reporting rules. Work systematically and professionally in a well-documented manner in accordance with the company rules and procedures including adherence to trade compliance (export / import and supply chain security) regulations entirely. Optimize costs through effective use of tools and strategic sourcing processes while meeting engineering, quality, and product management specifications and requirements. Negotiate price, delivery, payment terms, stocking programs and other terms related to supply in compliance with Emerson standard terms and conditions with suppliers. Ensure contract availability and validity. Developing a budget for annual spend and savings targets, performing cost analysis, supplier benchmarking, and selection of projects to decrease expenditures and improve supplier performance. Generate and implement efficient sourcing and commodity management strategies in alignment with global business priorities. Report and present results to stakeholders. Effectively communicate commodity strategies, project time lines, and deliverables with all stakeholders and counterparts in other world areas. Facilitate and maintain stakeholder alignment with these strategies. Inform purchasing departments of plants about any changes in sourcing strategy (price, lead time, prime source change, black list etc.) which can influence their operation. Oversee the proper implementation and execution of commodity strategies, ensuring that manufacturing sites use and follow purchasing strategies. Investigate and recommend new or alternate sources of supply as necessary to support business objectives and mitigate potential supply chain risksAdditional InformationTravel: 10-20"RequirementsBasicFour year technical or business degree. Two years commodity management, engineering or manufacturing experience. Works well in a team environment Strong project management and leadership skills Possess strong negotiating skills and ability to sustain networking relationships Strong Microsoft Office skills Possess strong presentation and communication skills Must have a passion for supply chain management and a sense of urgency in meeting customer needs Knowledge of raw materials and general manufacturing processes Must be able to manage priorities effectivelyComfortable with figures and in collecting, analyzing and interpreting dataPreferredMBA Preferred CPIM or CPM PreferredWork AuthorizationNo calls or agencies please. Emerson will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1, H-1, H-2, L, B, J, or TN or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.Equal Opportunity Employer Emerson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, marital status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status. We are committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment.If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, you can request help by calling 1-314-553-2544 (V/TTY/TDD) or by sending an email to idisability.administrator@emerson.com.

Name: Utility Asset Management Consultant, Gas & Electric Utility
Description: Job descriptionAccenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions – underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network – Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 425,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.  People in our Client & Market career track drive profitable growth by developing market-relevant insights to increase market share or create new markets. They progress through required promotion into market-facing roles that have a direct impact on sales. Industry Solutions and Services professionals play a wide variety of roles related to delivery and sales, maintaining and growing industry as their center of gravity. Job DescriptionIndustry Applications-RESOURCES professionals design, implement and deploy packaged software solutions that have been developed to accommodate unique industry business and management processes, regulatory requirements and other business needs which cross multiple industries. Resources Industry Applications professionals analyze, design, build, test and deploy innovative Resources industry-specific solutions -- including solutions for the Chemicals, Natural Resources, Energy and Utilities industries -- that enable industry standards and processes.  A professional at this position level within Accenture has the following responsibilities:  Identifies, assesses and solves complex business problems for area of responsibility, where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.  Closely follows the strategic direction set by senior management when establishing near term goals.  Interacts with senior management at a client and/or within Accentureon matters where they may need to gain acceptance on an alternate approach.  Has some latitude in decision-making. Acts independently to determine methods and procedures on new assignments.  Decisions have a major day to day impact on area of responsibility.  Manages large - medium sized teamsand/or work efforts (if in an individual contributor role) at a client or within Accenture.+ Basic qualificationsBasic QualificationsMinimum of 5 years experience with Industry Applications for Gas & Electric UtilitiesDeep analytics expertise in development of industry specific risk-informed rate  cases, the development of management strategies for field assets, and operational practicesBachelor's degree or equivalent experienceAbility to travel as necessary to client locations, typical travel is Monday through Thursday.Professional Skill Requirements Proven ability to build, manage and foster a team-oriented environment  Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment  Desire to work in an information systems environment  Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills Excellent leadership and management skills  Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture.  Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.  Accenture is a federal contractor and an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity  All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.  Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.
