Name: Medical Risk Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionPrimary Purpose: The Medical Risk Analyst improves risk management capabilities through claims/medical research analysis, recommends changes to policies and procedures in order to enhance product profitability as well as providing clinical expertise to the company. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time. Medical consultant for all accident/health lines of business including underwriting, actuary, compliance, legal, distribution partners, third party administrators, and other departmentsLiaison to medical director consultants for the Health Management departmentApply clinical expertise and sound judgement in review of medical records in accordance with policy contracts.Monitor the application of policies and procedures to enhance product profitability and improve risk managementAnalyze claims/medical research to identify trends, threats, and opportunitiesMinimum Skills and Competencies: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Bachelor Degree or in-lieu of degree equivalent education, training and work-related experienceCurrent Registered Nurse License5+ years of clinical experienceMust have prior experience in health insurance and underwritingAbility to analyze and interpret medical records, physician office notes, medical literature, CPT/ICD10 coding, EOBs/submitted claims, and medical review dataAbility to apply contract language to review of medical recordsMust be familiar with evidence-based clinical studies, possess an awareness of risk management, and display sound judgmentAbility to analyze medical information (provided, and/or researched and/or known from professional experience) and understand its actual and potential risk as it relates to offering an applicant insurance coverageExperience in data/claims analysis, research and interpretation; the ability to analyze data/claims and draw valid conclusionsMust possess effective verbal and written communication skillsStrong problem solving and decision making skillsAbility to process complex data and information from multiple sources, make decisions based on this data, and effectively communicate the related required actions to a broad audienceAbility to present a professional image and to encourage peers to do the sameAbility to work independently and as a team memberProficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)Desired Skills:Ability to think strategically and conceptually with a focus on impacts and outcomesAbility to deal with ambiguity and the corresponding ability to quickly provide sound decisions and recommendations with less than complete informationCompany DescriptionAbout National General Holdings: National General Holdings Corp. is headquartered in New York City. National General traces its roots to 1939, has a financial strength rating of A– (excellent) from A.M. Best, and provides personal and commercial automobile, homeowners, umbrella, recreational vehicle, motorcycle, supplemental health, and other niche insurance products. We are a specialty personal lines insurance holding company. Through our subsidiaries, we provide a variety of insurance products, including personal and commercial automobile, homeowners, umbrella, recreational vehicle, supplemental health, lender-placed and other niche insurance products.  National General is a fast paced, dynamic, and entrepreneurial organization. Our team members live by and exemplify what we call the 4Es. At National General, we are Energized, Engaged, Empowered, and we Execute every day in order to provide an exceptional experience for our customers! We are passionate about our organization and the value that we add every day. A successful candidate with National General will embody the 4Es. Our team is poised to outperform the competition. We are National General Insurance and with us you can be extraordinary! Come join our team!  Companies and Partners  Direct General Auto & Life, Personal Express Insurance, Century-National Insurance, ABC Insurance Agencies, NatGen Preferred, NatGen Premier, Seattle Specialty, National General Lender Services, ARS, RAC Insurance Partners, Mountain Valley Indemnity, New Jersey Skylands, Adirondack Insurance Exchange, VelaPoint, Quotit, HealthCompare, AHCP, NHIC, Healthcare Solutions Team, North Star Marketing, Euro Accident.  In addition to a phenomenal career opportunity, National General Insurance offers an excellent benefits package including: Paid TrainingMedical, Dental, Vision benefitsWellness ProgramsLife and Short/Long Term Disability Insurance401k w/ Company MatchCompany Paid Holidays & Generous Time-off policyEmployee Discount ProgramCareer Advancement and Development OpportunitiesOn-site Healthcare Clinic (Winston-Salem and Cleveland offices)On-site Fitness Center (Cleveland and Dallas offices)Subsidized parking (Cleveland office) National General Holdings Corp. is an Equal Opportunity (EO) employer – Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of any characteristic protected by law. Candidates must possess authorization to work in the United States, as it is not our practice to sponsor individuals for work visas.  In the event you need assistance or accommodation in completing your online application, please contact NGIC main office by phone at (336) 435-2000.

Name: Application Support Analyst

Since 1958, Copesan continues to deliver quality pest management solutions, incorporating green principles, to protect the brands of our national account clients and consumers.  We are seeking an Applications Support Analyst to support a cloud-based Enterprise Resource Planning system (ERP), Acumatica. This position will work closely with all departments supporting and troubleshooting Acumatica and other supporting applications. This position will assist with department documentation and training needs. In addition, the position will use coding knowledge to work on several in house integrations and systems. Responsibilities:Support cloud-based ERP applicationIdentify and document user and system issuesCreate database queries using T-SQL and reporting toolsEnhance and debug application codeAssist in the maintenance of applicationsConduct application testing, build test scripts, support application testing, and collect and summarize test dataCreate and maintain job schedules, job tracking, team communication, web reports and other documents that may be requiredCoordinate project activitiesProduce organized and informative system documentation, including details of application configuration and installation and infrastructureContribute to and maintain a knowledge base of previous support issuesCreate training curricula and documentationTrain users on applications and help them resolve application issuesQualifications:1-2 years of experience installing, configuring or supporting business applications1-2 years of experience querying and working with relational databases (particularly SQL Server1-2 years of experience with some programming languages preferably C# .NETCompetence in current Microsoft operating systems, Microsoft Office productsExcellent verbal and written communications skills, including the ability to create organized and informative reports, as well as comprehensive, accurate documentationA history of working independently without close supervision and demonstrated time management skillsAbility to participate in multiple projects simultaneously while adhering to tight schedulesComfortable working directly with end usersBachelor’s Degree in computer science related field preferredWe OfferAbility to work for an industry leader in a company with a strong reputation since 1958.Friendly and supportive work environment with active leadershipComprehensive benefits package including: Medical, dental, vision and life insurance, 401k with company match, paid time off, employee assistance program, wellness program, tuition reimbursement, volunteer time Continuous learning and development opportunities available. An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of a disability. Company DescriptionWho is Copesan?  Copesan is an alliance of premier pest management Partner companies providing quality pest solutions to businesses throughout North America. Since 1958, Copesan continues to deliver quality pest management solutions, incorporating green principles, to protect the brands of our national account clients and consumers.  Why work for Copesan?  Environment: a gorgeous open concept corporate office in Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin.  Stability: continuous growth since 1958.  Culture: an energetic, client-oriented culture that is friendly and welcoming.  Pride: a well-respected company in the industry, with active involvement and leadership.  Purpose: A feeling of satisfaction by helping to protect people, property and the environment; making lives more enjoyable and our foods safer.  Benefits: a comprehensive benefits package, including a 401(k) plan with employer match.  Learn more at www.copesan.com.

Name: Bank Secrecy Act Analyst II
Description: This is a Full-Time position located near 27th Street and College Ave in Oak Creek, WI.BASIC FUNCTION: Serves as a key member of the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) team and assists in various functions assigned by the Bank’s BSA Officer with compliance of the Bank Secrecy Act, Customer Identification Program (CIP), and Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) requirements. Provides data entry and clerical support as needed. Acts as a resource to all bank departments and employees to enforce BSA Compliance throughout the bank. DESCRIPTION OF MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES: May perform any or all of the following: Ability to review Customer Due Diligence questionnaires and risk ratings on all customers.Conduct Enhanced Due Diligence reviews for customer's identified as higher risk to the bank.Monitor and track registration renewals for Money Service Businesses (MSBs) and Private ATM owners as well as other annual documentation as required by the Bank’s procedures.Responsible for the account/transaction monitoring through the use of various reports and the Bank’s BSA software system, Verafin.Adhere the strict BSA related standards set forth by the Bank, as described through the Bank’s BSA Policy and Procedures. Stay current with all BSA regulations. Assist with performing BSA employee training.Perform other duties as assigned.RequirementsKNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:Minimum of two years banking experience including branch/platform experience and/or a minimum of one year direct work experience in BSA/AML area, preferred.Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint programs.High degree of accuracy and attention to detail.Strong analytical skills, with the ability to multi-task.Involves regular contact with all levels of bank staff where excellent verbal and written communication skills are required.Requires organizational and time management skills and the ability to work well independently and with others.Develop a working knowledge of Bank policy and procedures.Must be able to maintain the confidentiality of all customer information.Knowledge with FIS and/or Verafin software systems, helpfulSUPERVISORY RESPONSIBLITIES: None. EQUIPMENT TO BE USED: Basic office equipment. TYPICAL PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Requires prolonged sitting. Requires eye-hand coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to operate office equipment. Requires normal range of hearing and vision to record, prepare and communicate appropriate reports. TYPICAL MENTAL DEMANDS: Must complete responsibilities in a timely and accurate manner on a regular basis. Must be mentally adaptable and flexible in dealing with a variety of people. Emotional stability and personal maturity are important attributes in this position. Must be capable of prolonged periods of concentration. OTHER: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Name: Sr Financial Analyst
Description: Position DescriptionFiserv (NASDAQ: FISV), is a Fortune 500 company that now provides information management and electronic commerce systems and services to the financial and insurance industries. Leading services include transaction processing, outsourcing, electronic bill payment and presentment, investment management solutions, business process outsourcing (BPO), software and systems solutions. Headquartered in Brookfield, Wis., Fiserv is the leading provider of core processing solutions for U.S. banks, credit unions and thrifts.  We are seeking a self-motivated, intellectually curious finance professional with a strong work ethic to join our Bank Solutions Finance team as a Senior Financial Analyst FP&A for our Brookfield, WI office As an SFA for Bank Solutions, you will:Help drive profitable business growth by providing strong financial analysis, consolidation support, budgeting, forecasting, and reporting actual results.Coordinate, manage and prepare Bank Solutions financial and management reports accurately and on a timely basis including appropriate variance analysis, evaluation of metrics and commentary for internal review and action. These reports include the Month End Close, Monthly Full Year Forecast, periodic business reviews, the Annual Long Range Plan, the Annual Operating Plan and the Annual Budget. These responsibilities require coordination with various functional departments and peers within Bank Solutions with adherence to Division, Group and Corporate requirements.Analyze variances and trends in sales, revenue, expense, general business conditions and other related areas for the consolidated division. Identify key data points and trends that demonstrate the relationship between the operational, financial and performance goals.Prepare and load monthly forecasts and maintain responsibility for group and division level cost centers and functions.The individual will be relied upon to offer excellent quantitative analysis, qualitative business judgement and to build strong relationships with key decision makers and peers across the business unit.Compile and consolidate financial data from business units to perform adhoc financial and business related analyses to support management reporting and strategic business decisions.Develop dashboards to be used by the Bank Solutions executive management team to drive consistency in reporting across businesses and assist business leaders in making operational decisions that maximize profitable growth.Analyze and assess risks and opportunities, develop key business metrics to drive revenue and reduced costs resulting in increased profitability and business growth.Ensure all financial reports are accurate and prepared in accordance with Company policies and procedures.Provide periodic and ad hoc project and financial support/reporting for executive management within the Division, Group, and Corporate governance structures.What do we need from you?Bachelors degree in Accounting or Finance  2+ years of applicable accounting/finance and/or other related experience  Proficiency with Excel is required, particularly those functions that are used to manipulate large data sets such as pivot tables, lookup formulas, and conditional sum formulasIt would be fantastic if you also have:Experience with Power PivotMBA or CPA Bank Solutions delivers comprehensive bank platforms and value-added products and services for community, mid-tier, and large financial institutions. Fiserv bank platforms Cleartouch, DNA, Precision, Premier, Signature enable banks to efficiently manage a wide range of activities such as account opening, deposits, withdrawals, loans, customer information management, and general ledger and accounting tasks.  With Fiserv, you will create and deliver the Fiserv solutions that drive client satisfaction. You can grow professionally and personally in an environment where intelligence, innovation, and leadership are valued and rewarded. Fiserv holds true to two essential principles: the client comes first, and people make the difference. Fiserv invites you to join us in building on those principles to lead our clients and our company to success.  We are #FISVProud for the fifth consecutive year. We have been named one of the FORTUNE Magazine "Worlds Most Admired Companies®," which is a definitive benchmark of corporate reputation.  Fiserv in an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Vet.  Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Vet. Visit http://www.careers.fiserv.com/eeo for more information.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst - Credit
Description: Improve company profitability by providing relevant information for informed business planning and decision making. Do you love . . . providing visibility to trends and patterns in data? Are you energized by . . . using numbers to influence a business decision? Do you enjoy . . . presenting recommendations and findings? Name: Intern Summer 2019 - Business Intelligence Developer
Description: Concurrency University Summer 2019 Intern Concurrency, Inc. is driven to help clients find better ways to leverage technology to fulfill their strategies and improve their businesses. Key areas for our digital transformation includes Data & Analytics, Cloud Datacenter, Customer Engagement, Modern Applications, and Modern IT Management. We look for inspiring talent that holds him/herself to super high expectations and is ready to set the world on fire!The purpose of the Concurrency University program is to create impactful experiences to enhance the employment opportunities at the start of a Summer Analysts career. The Concurrency University program will provide an opportunity to gain technical knowledge and skills in the consulting space. This top talent should be pursuing a degree in technology or business-related field and have a burning desire to be an IT Consultant. The ideal candidate will be entering their Junior or Senior year OR Master's degree students in the Fall of 2019.We are seeking the following skills:Smart - A thirst for knowledge and resourceful in leveraging the tools to get it doneCharacter A fit for our culture of work hard/play hard, excellent soft skills: can present in front of clients, well spoken, outgoing, etc.Drive (one thing we can't teach)Experience (internship/real business experience, solid track record of interacting with the world, history of going above and beyond). Pursuing a career in business consulting  Self-starter and evidence of a high degree of personal accountability High tolerance for ambiguity, low tolerance for status quo, change agent Below is a list of the teams currently considering interns for the summer.Cloud Datacenter & Customer EngagementOur digital customers expect secure identity and access management along with ease of use. These teams create an efficient, organized and personalized Azure cloud and hybrid datacenter focused solution for our clients. These teams use Azure, Automation & Control, Protection & Recovery, ServiceNow, Windows Server, Dynamics 365, Office 365, and SharePoint.Cloud Application and Data AnalyticsThese teams can turn intelligent insights into prescriptive actions by leveraging a modern data platform and advanced analytics techniques. From production line workers to executives, accessing dashboards and reports should all be part of a days work. Additionally, so should interfacing with corporate, third-party and data recorded by sensors. This team leverages C#, HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Application Security, IoT, Machine Learning, Azure, Power BI, and Visual Studio Team Services. Business Consulting & Modern IT ManagementThese teams use communication and collaboration to enable the quick design, build, testing and release code from concept to market. Automating updates, installations, reporting and more from a single, centralized location. This team leverages System Center, OMS, Enterprise Mobility + Security, O365, Azure, DevOps, ITSM, ITIL, Six Sigma, Lean, Cobit, ISO9000, and Project ManagementOpen 2019 Summer Analyst Internship Positions .Net Software Engineer InternData Scientist InternCustomer Relationship Management Analysts InternBI Developer InternITSM & Automations InternProductivity & Collaboration InternCommunications and Mobility InternEncouraging a healthy work/life balance and providing our colleagues great benefits are just part of what makes Concurrency a great place to work. Concurrency full-time employees receive complete and competitive benefits. We offer a collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, generous work/life opportunities and an comprehensive benefits package that includes paid time off plus holidays. In addition, all colleagues are eligible for a number of rewards and recognition programs, excellent training program and bonus opportunities.

Name: Summer Scholar, Business Analyst - Human Capital, HR Technology Transformation - Cornell University
Description: When companies undergo significant organizational changes, they need a trusted advisor to help them drive decisions and navigate challenges. From talent strategy to organizational design to change management, our consultants look beyond the traditional boundaries within an organization to discover untapped sources of value. We provide guidance to organizations undergoing large-scale transformations; whether they are implementing new technology, about to embark on a merger, or simply changing the way they work. As a dynamic, strategic thinker who understands the big picture, you will work directly with our clients to help align talent and organizational strategies with broader business objectives. *Work You ll Do** While a career in consulting is dynamic and evolving, we look for people who will perform in certain areas, grow those related skills and deliver exceptional results to our clients. We recognize that you have unique skills, experiences, and interests, so we divide the broad scope of the Summer Scholar role into skills-based segments in order to best align each Summer Scholar with a focus area. The profiles function as subgroups that our Summer Scholars leverage to network and enhance their professional development. Setting our people up for success is our highest priority. We are currently recruiting Summer Scholars whose skills and interests align with the following areas:  + **Human Capital Strategy**  + This Consultant identifies efficiencies to enhance organizational performance through innovative talent, leadership and change programs. This Consultant also designs & develops integrated HR & talent management strategies, helping clients adapt to disruption through core service delivery optimization & digital enablement  + Majors: Business, Economics, Psychology, Human Resources, ILR  + **HR Tech & Transformation**  + This Consultant helps clients optimize the value of their investments in HR technology through the selection, design, & implementation of HR solutions & digital applications. This Consultant also builds HR technology blueprints & roadmaps that set clients on a clear path to success  + Majors: STEM  + **Actuarial**  + This Consultant builds financial & mathematical models that can improve organizational performance and help clients make informed business decisions. This Consultant also advises clients on complex business problems by interpreting large data sets using statistical methods to quantify risk  + Majors: Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics *The Team** Our practitioners will be able to maintain the specialization they have built to date in certain areas while also learning how it connects to broader issues in the market. We are committed to continuously supporting our practitioners as they build skills in either one specific part of our business or across the business our Portfolio is structured to facilitate this learning. With Talent & Organization Performance at the forefront of every organization and industry, our people will have the ability to capitalize on some of the biggest trends happening today and support organizations working to leverage their greatest asset: their people. We will continue to help our people deliver world-class services, innovate on new solutions and products, and prepare them to address our clients most difficult challenges in the market. *Qualifications** + Enrollment in a Bachelor s degree program in related field of study  + Strong academic track record (minimum GPA of 3.5)  + Ability to participate full-time for a 10-week internship (June to August 2019)  + Proficiency inword processing, spreadsheet, and presentation creation tools, as well as Internet research tools  + Ability to travel 80-100% *How You ll Grow** Two of the most important tools in today s business world are experience and resources. At Deloitte, you ll find plenty of both.During this 10 week long learning experience, you ll gain first-hand insights into the technical skills, critical professional behaviors, standards, and mindsets needed to be effective as part of the Human Capital practice. You ll work with a wide variety of talented leaders, learn how to tackle business issues and design strategies that are aligned with our clients objectives, and experience the day-to-day challenges and opportunities presented inthis exciting, forward-facing career.Your tailored training program will start on day 1 and be supplemented with learning opportunities throughout the summer, whether on the job, virtual, or in the office on Fridays. The summer will also feature networking opportunities with firm leadership and interns across the organization during the national summer intern conference at Deloitte University. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center. at https://zoomforth.com/s/deloitte/du#home *Deloitte s Culture** Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte. *Corporate Citizenship** Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte s impact on the world. at http://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/about-deloitte/articles/deloitte-corporate-citizenship.html *Recruiter Tips** We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you re applying to. We also suggest that you brush up on your behavioral and case interviewing skills and practice discussing your experience and job history with a family member, friend, or mentor. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals. at http://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/careers/topics/recruiting-tips.html  Category: Management Consulting  About Deloitte  As used in this document, Deloitte means Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Name: Lead Financial Analyst, SAP Projects
Description: Eaton in Waukesha, WI is seeking a Lead Financial Analyst, SAP Projects to be an active member on a project team with efforts to move from non-supported systems to supported systems. The Financial Analyst will be based at our Badger Drive location in Waukesha, Wisconsin. Position Overview:The primary function of the role is to provide accounting, financial and impact information for SAP Projects.Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each and every day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours.Essential Functions:You will lead/Co-lead and coordinates both financial and non-financial related projects, process documentations, root cause analysis, Value Stream Mapping, implementation plans and results.You will work on projects and teams to drive improvement in processes through tools/systems such as SAP, automation, and standardization. Cross-train with other analysts to build skills and experience across the division and site team (SAP and Financial). You will work collaboratively with team to create annual profit plan budgets, investigate spending variances, forecast monthly spending trends and prepare action plans to achieve project targets by providing forward-looking analysis and insight to business leads.You will coordinate financial impacts with the project teams by working collaboratively with division and local managers, updating forecasting models, conducting budget reviews and updating systems.You will support the projects based accounting process including overseeing cost allocations, labor, material, services, cost savings, balance sheet reconciliations and other impacts against projects. You will analyze key performance drivers of project investigating variances. Performs root cause analysis to resolve problems. Interprets financial results and communicates opportunities for improvement to division and impact site. You will troubleshoot, diagnose, resolve, and respond to inquiries & questions by end-users utilizing the SAP FICO module.You will identify opportunities for improving business processes in partnership with process owners and management through SAP Financial and associated information systems.You will provide cross-training and process documentation of best practices with other Finance team members.When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we- as individuals and as a company – are stronger.Basic Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business or Economics from an accredited institution is required.Minimum of 2 years accounting experience in operations environment is required.No relocation benefit is being offered for this position. Only candidates that currently reside within a 50 mile radius of the Waukesha, WI facility will be considered.Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship now or in the future.Preferred Qualifications:MBA or Master’s degree in Finance or AccountingExperience with SAP (SAP R/3 4.7 to ECC 6.0) focused on the FICO modules is preferred, but training can be provided for candidates who lack the needed SAP experienceMust be able to work in the United States without corporate sponsorship now and within the future.No relocation benefit is being offered for this position. Only candidates within a 50 mile radius of the work location will be consideredPosition Criteria:Understand the business functions of Finance and Accounting and evaluate how IT changes may impact and improve the operation of these business functions. Areas of expertise including but not limited to general ledger, costing, accounts payable, accounts receivable, financial analysis and corporate accountingMust have attention to detail and sound analytical skills, ability to interpret/communicate financial information.Must be able to see detail and big picture so that resulting communications and reports describe key risks and drivers as well as details and are prepared and presented in a manner consistent with data reporting.Team-oriented, flexible, must be able to work closely with all levels of management.Requires ability to communicate effectively with financial and non-financial colleagues to drive business partnering relationship at multiple levels of the organizationBusiness process improvement focus required to drive deployment of world class processesExcellent professional written and oral communication skillsMust work well under pressure and be good at meeting deadlinesPrior working experience with, production Order costing; material cost controllingAbility to architect solutions in the Finance (FICO) functional areas by seamlessly integrating with MM, SD, PP, WM and BW functional areas

Name: Programmer Analyst
Description: Doors are opening to a new career, at NABCO Entrances, Inc.About NABCO Entrances, Inc. NABCO ENTRANCES manufactures superior quality Gyro Tech brand automatic sliding doors, manual sliding doors, automatic swinging doors, manual swing doors, door conversion units, fire doors, bi-fold doors, activating devices for automated pedestrian doors and specialty doors that are distributed throughout North America. NABCO ENTRANCES is renowned for cutting edge technology backed by dependable service creating viable solutions for the challenges faced in today's commercial environment.  In 1971, Gyro Tech changed the automatic door industry by pioneering the first electromechanical operator. Since then, NABCO Entrances has been dedicated to being the premier supplier of quality entrance system products that meet growing pedestrian needs, and the needs of retail stores, hospitals, schools, restaurants and other commercial and industrial institutions throughout North America.  NABCO openly encourages creative teamwork among employees, management and its independent distributors in order to continually provide timely and effective solutions through the on-going development of a prompt delivery system, shorter lead-times, and the development of new products in response to market needs. Position Summary As Programmer Analyst, the main responsibilities of this position will be to update and support the corporate web site, support and improve our new ecommerce web site, help with creation of a sales configurator, integration points with the ERP system (SAP), and maintenance and creation of other custom programs. This position will report to the IT Manager and will require regular interactions with internal Sales and Engineering departments to fully understand application requirements. The work requires knowledge of the policies, procedures and methods in the field of Information Technology and programming. Essential Functions Administer and update the corporate web site (Wordpress/php) Fine tune and support of new eCommerce solution (Wordpress/php) Support of legacy VBA applications crucial to running the business Involvement in creating a sales configurator Advise on and write integration points between key business systems Solve complex problems on own and proactively identify new solutions to problems Work Independently with minimum supervision Minimum off-hour support is expected of this position Other duties as assignedQUALIFICATIONSKnowledge, Skills, AbilitiesGood communication skills are a mustStrong analytical and critical thinking skillsKnowledge of Microsoft programming platforms (VB, VBA)Experience with phpExperience with SQL Databases and T-SQLKnowledge of SAP ABAP is a huge plusKnowledge of Solidworks Engineering software is a plusEducation, Training, ExperienceBachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Management Information Systems or related field.Working Conditions and Physical Demands Work is performed inside, with little to no exposure to weather conditions. May be noisy at times due to proximity to factory. Occasional trips out to the factory floor may be necessary. Benefits at NABCO Entrances, Inc. We offer a highly competitive benefits package, including: paid vacation / holiday / sick time, employer matching 401(k) plan, health, dental and vision insurance, plus 100% employer paid Life, STD and LTD. Stay Connected Like NABCO Entrances, Inc. on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/NABCOEntrances/  Follow NABCO Entrances, Inc. on LinkedIn at: https://www.linkedin.com/company/nabco-entrances

Name: Business Continuity Specialist, Advisory
Description: Job TitleBusiness Continuity Specialist, AdvisoryJob PurposeAbout the Role:The Business Continuity Analyst - Advisory will direct business continuity and resilience efforts, with a concentration in planning and testing that meets the expectations of the Division leadership and corporate requirements, as well as regulatory guidelines. This role affords the opportunity to work with various levels of leadership and numerous teams within and outside the division, as well as our partners at the enterprise level and our financial institution clients.About our Business: The mission of the Audit Risk & Compliance (ARC) team is to deliver world-class governance services that enables the Bank Solutions division and Fiserv to achieve superior performance. We primarily serve the Bank Solutions division which entails a wide variety of hosted and in-house products and solutions, most notably a financial institution’s core banking solution.Reporting Relationships:Reports To: Director, Information SecurityPeers: This role has team members in similar rolesDirect Reports: NoneEssential Job Responsibilities:Provide oversight in the coordination, assessment, development, maintenance and implementation of business continuity and disaster recovery plans that minimize the financial, operational and reputational impact to our organization and support the resumption of operations in the event of a disruption.Drive business continuity and disaster recovery planning efforts that are aligned and compliant with the planning guidelines established by the risk management stakeholders (ERR).Understand the businesses applications and infrastructure.Identify and convey business continuity gaps which place our organization at risk.Facilitate annual risk management program with business leaders.Analyze and determine potential gaps or risks in our controls and processes that could result in non-compliance and have a possible effect on business unit and customer operations.Develop and recommend changes to policies and procedures to ensure compliance.Work with those areas of the division and the lines of business that are affected by changing standards, laws and regulations to confirm that appropriate changes are implemented.Recommend appropriate actions based on analysis of customer/client compliance issues and questions.Assist with audit activities, including internal and 3rd party audits, and bank regulatory examinations.Serve as a contact point for compliance activities, including risk assessments and business continuity, both internally and for clients.Coordinate the efforts of other departments to arrive at common goals related to risk assessments and business continuity planning and testing.Facilitate the planning and documentation of business continuity exercises.Document and maintain business continuity plans.The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job, and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities. Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university is preferred, equivalent work experience will be considered as appropriate.7 years of business continuity leadership experience or equivalentProfessional certification (e.g., CBCP, CRISC, CRISM, CISA, CISSP, PMP, etc.) or the desire and determination to pursue such.Extensive interpersonal, written/verbal communication, organizational and leadership skills.Proven experience in business planning, resource allocation and project management.Ability to confront conflict and difficult issues in a professional, assertive, and proactive manner.Ability to interact across all levels of management.Demonstrated ability to influence and work effectively within a highly matrixed organization with associates at all levels.Attention to detail with a commitment to high-quality standards.A successful track record for delivering results in a timely manner.Strong organizational and time management skills.Strong PC skills (Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and SharePoint).Preferred Qualifications: Financial services experience, including working in highly regulated environments.Experience with Incident Management.Experience with FFIEC requirements.General understanding of laws, regulations (GLBA) and standards (PCI DSS, PA-DSS) governing high tech and the financial services industry.Knowledge of COBIT, ISO 27001, ITIL.Travel Required:Ability to travel 10-20%.Fiserv Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and maintains a Drug-Free Workplace.Thank you for considering employment with Fiserv. Please:Apply using your legal nameComplete the step-by-step profile and attach your resume (either is acceptable, both are preferable).Fiserv is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer, and it is the Company’s policy to make all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability (as long as the individual is able to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation), and any other characteristic protected by Law.

Name: Production Control Analyst
Description: Production Control Analyst  Business Group Operations & Engineering Services  No. of Positions 1positions","  Requisition Number 81723BR  Job Category Supply Chain and Operations  Position Type Full Time  Relocation Eligible No  Position Summary The Production Control Analyst (PCA) is responsible for procuring material and scheduling a production line to meet business and customer service goals. As an individual contributor, the expectation is that you will use proven leadership and change management skills to drive improvements in business performance related to inventory investment and production scheduling to meet customer expectations and business goals.  The following activities fall under the PCAs responsibility and are a main focus in this position: Managing inventory planning parameters (Safety Stock, Re-order point quantities, Lot Size, Lead-time, etc..) such that the component and finished goods availability levels are in line with the monthly Sales & Operating Plan expectations.Develop plan to reduce lead-time to stay competitive in market place.Scheduling a production line to meet business goals of 95% on time to request met compliance.Monitor inventory levels and planning parameters in the distribution centers to ensure the stocking program will meet goal of 95% fill rate.Provide customer care with timely and accurate ship dates for expedites.Reschedule Production Orders with realistic finish dates to ensure customer has updated acknowledgements on expected ship date.Monitor aging sales orders and work with appropriate groups to resolve issues impacting shipping, production or procurement of materials.Maintain clean master data on all parts related to assigned Material Requirements Planning Controller numbers.Work closely with Production Managers to review Finished Goods inventory and options for reworking into new parts.Convert purchase requisitions daily and action PO pull in and push out MRP exception messages.Work with suppliers on a daily basis to return non-conforming materials.Review open log of problem Purchase Orders and resolve issues so Purchase Orders can be received.Work with accounts payable to ensure timely resolution of invoice problems related to quantity issues. EOE, M/F/Disabled, Vet  Basic Qualifications BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelors Degree, preferably in Supply Chain or OperationsLegal authorization to work in the US is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSA minimum of two years production planning experience or equivalent, preferably in an electrical/electro-mechanical manufacturing environment.Extensive use of SAP or ERP system functionality and parameters preferred.Strong interpersonal skills, as well as clear written and verbal communication skills required.Intermediate skills in Excel and quantitative analysis.Basic knowledge of lean/six sigma or manufacturing continuous improvement techniques. Country(s) United States  EEO Statement Rockwell Automation is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.  If you are an individual with a disability and you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process, email our Talent Acquisition representative at ************************************.  Download the EEO is the Law poster and the supplement for more information.  Company Overview Rockwell Automation, the world's largest company dedicated to industrial automation, makes its customers more productive and the world more sustainable. Throughout the world, our flagship Allen-Bradley and Rockwell Software product brands are recognized for innovation and excellence.  When you choose Rockwell Automation, you join countless talented employees who have helped us establish our leadership position in the automation industry over the past century.  You join a diverse, inclusive and global community with a passion for innovation. A place where you can partner with great minds and inspiring people. And a corporation backed by the financial strength that drives growth and career opportunities.  As much as we focus on our customers, we know our employees are key to our success and future. Helping you develop a rewarding career is a top priority. Because when you succeed, we succeed.  Work State/City Mequon - Wisconsin

Name: Supply Chain Analyst B
Description: Yaskawa America, Inc. - Drives & Motion Division is a U.S. corporation, created to provide Automation Solutions and Support to our customers in North America, Central America, and South America. Yaskawa is the world's largest manufacturer of AC Inverter Drives, Servo and Motion Control, and Robotics Automation Systems. Products are marketed through direct sales, partners, representatives, dealers, and distributors. Yaskawa America, Inc. - Drives & Motion Division is a wholly-owned corporation of Yaskawa Electric Corporation of Japan. Since 1915, Yaskawa Electric has served the world needs for products to improve global productivity through Automation. Yaskawa is currently seeking a Supply Chain Analyst responsible for all planning, buying and/or production scheduling related activities to maintain optimal inventory levels within assigned product lines. As well as communicating requirements to internal and external customer base, monitoring performance to targets and working with supply base to achieve short lead times with high inventory turns and high customer fulfillment rates. In this role, the Supply Chain Analyst will: Perform MRP on assigned product lines to obtain inventory and resolves related issues including expediting product to meet customer expectations.Review and analyze demand plan for all items assigned. Identify and resolve deviations among the APO and SAP forecasts. Works within the S&OP and APO processes to synchronize the demand and supply plans.Create and present S&OP Supply Planning Data to include: inventory position, service levels, capacity issues, production issues, supplier base issues, plant to plant transfer issues etc.Prepare production schedules within SAP, communicates to required parties, monitors and reports performance as needed. To include SAP generated missing parts lists.Prepare purchase forecasts as negotiated with suppliers, monitors performance of forecasts, redesigns agreed to fit needs of both organizations.Maintain ongoing communications with supplier base in relation to purchase order placement, expedites, product quality (MRN’s), CPAR’S, ECO’s, lead-time reductions, and vendor performance. Assist Strategic Sourcing in supplier selection, and cost down initiatives.Recommend process improvements and implements same with Manager.Participate in Product Launch Meetings and performs related tasks (phase-in/phase-out, initial order, forecasting, etc.). The ideal candidate will possess:Degree in Operations Management or business preferred and/or minimum 2 years equivalent work experience.Minimum of two years’ experience in supply chain as a planner, buyer or production schedule as well as two years of experience in materials requirements planning systems.APICS certification (CPIM/CIRM/CSCP) and/or ISM certification (CPM).Proficient PC skills including word processing, spreadsheet, and database software. Creative problem solving abilities, attention to detail and accuracy, commitment to internal and external customer service.Professional interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.We offer the opportunity to experience the excitement, challenge and rewards of working in an entrepreneurial, fast growing, and industry-leading company where you will be challenged to manage projects and apply your skills to a wide variety of applications. Some key advantages to working at Yaskawa include: a global environment with interactions to numerous cultures, career opportunities in diverse areas, a highly competitive benefit package, including a generous 401(K) plan, profit sharing, corporate wide bonus plan and educational assistance programs offering up to $10,000 a year for graduate courses. Yaskawa is an equal opportunity employer.If the Supply Chain Analyst role sounds like a fit for your background and career goals, we would like to hear from you!!If the Supply Chain Analyst role sounds like a fit for your background and career goals, we would like to hear from you!!

Name: Financial Systems Analyst - Wauwatosa, WI
Description: BOSTIK is hiring! We are currently looking for a Financial Systems Analyst for our Wauwatosa, WI location.  The Financial Systems Analyst will perform various routine and non-routine functions within the Financial Operations department with minimal supervision. The position works internally with all business units and functional areas to coordinate the financial close as well as the budgeting and forecasting processes.  We seek people who want to be part of a growing, world-class organization. We also offer comprehensive benefits effective DAY 1! “Stick” with us!Job Activities:Coordinates and participates in the monthly and annual Financial close processAssists with monthly, quarterly, and annual internal and parent company reportingLoads and evaluates monthly results in consolidation databasePrepares account reconciliations and variance analysisCoordinates and participates in the budgeting and forecasting processesPrepares Government reports as requiredAdministrator of Financial reporting systems and Movex access securityOther special projects as identifiedReview and analyze policies and procedures to assure compliance with Financial Standard of Common Practice and Bostik WW internal control framework.Provide support to internal and external auditors.Work collaboratively within Financial Operations Team and Bostik Organization in support of goals and objectives.Communicate effectively and timely on project status and resource needs in order ensure commitments are met. Practice safe work habits in accordance with OSHA and EPA guidelines, and Bostik specific EHS expectations.Job Dimensions:Average monthly Accounts Payable balance is ~ $29M.On a monthly basis, Bostik, Inc. processes approximately 2,500 supplier invoices.On a daily basis, Bostik, Inc. processes an average of $2.0M cash receipts.Approximately 250 vital record types are retained for governmental and legal purposes.Supports eleven manufacturing sites, a combined R&D and administration location, and multiple functional departments.Supports Bostik Americas Region and three Global Business Units: Nonwovens, IBU, and C&C. Utilizes a fully integrated ERP system and multiple reporting systems.Context and Environment:This position performs various routine and non-routine functions within the Financial Operations department with minimal supervision. The position works internally with all business units and functional areas to coordinate the financial close as well as the budgeting and forecasting processes. However, the position serves as a support and back up for other Financial Operations’ functions and may be assigned to and lead special projects. This job involves the complexity in dealing with other countries/cultures with English as their second language as well as across multiple time zones.Accountabilities:Provide accurate and timely financial information to parent company, management, and others as required. Appropriately apply current accounting principles and documented policies and procedures.Job Qualifications:Bachelors degree in related area, CPA/MBA a plusMinimum of 5 years experience in accounting and /or system administration in an international manufacturing environmentStrong PC Skills (Microsoft Office and, ERP systems); experience with SAP, Movex, Hyperion Enterprise and TM1 a plusExperience working in a multi-location environment preferredStrong analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to detailAbility to work independently and as part of a teamAbility to balance multiple priorities and meet deadlines.About Bostik- Smart Adhesives With our eyes on the future, Bostik is driven to develop smart adhesives – enabling us to anticipate needs, create value, and shape new capabilities. We are not the right place for everyone. We ARE right for those who work collaboratively to think and act boldly beyond today. Put your potential to work to increase our collective expertise, powered by a spirit of innovation.  As one of the largest adhesive and sealant companies in the world, Bostik designs, manufactures, and markets bonding solutions within a variety of Global Business Units: Industrial Adhesives (Converting, Assembly, Packaging, Transportation, Flexible Packaging and Industrial Laminations); Consumer and Construction (Flooring Installation Systems, Construction Sealants and Adhesives); and Nonwovens (Disposable Hygiene).  Bostik is well positioned as part of Arkema's High Performance Materials segment. A global chemical company and France’s leading chemicals producer, Arkema is building the future of the chemical industry every day.  Make a difference with Bostik. Build a career with purpose. Experience the impact powerful bonds can make – at a place where you can feel at home.  Compliance: Bostik is an EEO/AA/Drug Free Workplace.Disclaimer: The above information had been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications

for license compliance and support bi-monthly change control quality review process. •Administer the auditing process for company software Conduct software license audits for high and medium risk Management and other related software processes. •Management and implementation of the software maintenance process – including pre-work reviews for large $, large risk renewals and responding to and Request Management processes for software and hardware management. •Management and support of the software retirement process. •Provide ongoing supplier relationship management for ongoing blanket software and hardware suppliers

Name: Senior Data Analyst - ACL Lead - Corporate Audit Services/Professional Practices
Description: The Senior Data Analyst – ACL Lead is responsible for leading ACL efforts across CAS: providing ad-hoc coaching to over 100 CAS ACL Champions, knowledge-sharing, setting documentation standards, maintaining documentation, coordinating and rolling out upgrades, managing the technical aspects, monitoring and reporting on usage, facilitating training, and managing license onboarding and transfers.  The Senior Data Analyst – ACL Lead is expected to apply well-developed knowledge and expertise in ACL, have a high level of expertise in one or more additional software tool(s), develop complex data analytics routines, liaise with the audit teams to enable more comprehensive audit testing, and test and document work in conformance with internal audit policies and procedures.  Duties Coaching 100+ CAS ACL Champions by guiding the ACL users in completing their work products, selecting and coaching ACL Mentors, brainstorming ACL usage ideas, troubleshooting ACL issues, assisting with automation, and performing ACL Quality Assurance Reviews.Liaising regularly with the CAS audit teams to enable more comprehensive audit testing and to increase the use of data analytics overall. Includes assisting CAS audit teams in understanding the data analytics results, offering innovative data analytics solutions, and providing technical assistance as required.Developing complex data analytics across multiple platforms. Includes performing thorough testing and fully and accurately documenting work performed to support conclusions reached.New ACL license on-boarding, and coordination of license transfers.Facilitating ACL Beginner and Intermediate/Advanced training to new and developing ACL Champions,Interfacing with Technology Operations Services (TOS) and the lines of business.Supervising less-experienced Data Analytics staff on data analytics and other projects.Keeping CAS informed of ACL product enhancements, resources, and best practices.Maintaining the ACL Champion repository and other documentation.Coordinating, testing, and rolling-out version upgrades.Monitoring, and reporting on, ACL usage.Performing other duties as requested by CAS Management. The Senior Data Analyst – ACL Lead is responsible for leading ACL efforts across CAS: providing ad-hoc coaching to over 100 CAS ACL Champions, knowledge-sharing, setting documentation standards, maintaining documentation, coordinating and rolling out upgrades, managing the technical aspects, monitoring and reporting on usage, and license onboarding and transfers.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications Bachelors degree, or equivalent work experience (preferably in Computer Information Systems, Management Information Systems)Seven to ten years of experience in an applicable risk management environment (preferably in data analytics, including advanced expertise in ACL)  Preferred Skills/ExperienceAbility to independently translate unique and complex business scenarios into efficient and effective data analytic solutions.Strong data analytic, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, with the ability to extract, collect, organize, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in large and/or complex data sets.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Ability to translate technical concepts into non-technical terms.Proven adaptability to changing priorities.Ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously.Familiarity with the concepts of automated process automation, data visualization, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.Familiarity with statistical programming languages such as R, Python and SAS.Seven or more years of experience in internal auditing, public accounting or other relevant experience.Basic understanding of IIA Standards and the common definition of internal controls.CIA, CISA, ACDA, or other relevant professional designation.

Name: Fraud Prevention Analyst
Description: Inspire and deliver exceptional value to travelers around the globe as part of the Apple Leisure Group (ALG) team! Our vision is to be the best-in-class and largest all-inclusive resort management and travel services provider, differentiated by the collaboration of our unique resort and distribution brands.Grow your career as a Fraud Prevention Analyst with Apple Leisure Group. You will focus on mitigating risk for the organization through successful chargeback resolution, fraud detection and implementation of tools and resources to minimize loss. In this role, you will work closely with the chargeback team in elevated cases with consumer and travel agent fraud.A successfulFraud Prevention Analyst will:Eliminate opportunity for fraud through proper reporting and internal controls.Administer ThreatMetrix Fraud Prevention tool to support initiatives and evaluate trends that are occurring. Identify activity and implement processes to prevent reoccurring instances in the future.Seek opportunities to expand understanding trends in fraud activity and ways to mitigate losses.Assess losses and adhere to policies prior to expense write offs.Work closely with outside sources including travel agents, legal community and suppliers to investigate issues.Issue monthly fraud loss reports to leadership team.Handle collection of recoupment through Travel Agent commission, invoicing or collection agencies.Assist in resolution of chargebacks.Lead by example in producing a high level of quality and quantity of workBe able to investigate errors, summarize the impact and recommend a solution to your leaderResolve difficult travel agent and customer issues using corporate resources to achieve a satisfactory outcomeDemonstrate outstanding relationships with customers, travel agents and internal team members through professional communicationBe able to perform functions within Microsoft Office, RezAgent, Threat Metrix and SynapseIdentify opportunities for improvement, cost reduction and system enhancementsRequirements:Associates degree in Accounting, Finance or a related fieldOR3-5 years of related experience in accounting with emphasis on fraud prevention; or an equivalent combination of education and experience1-3 years of fraud prevention and chargeback experience.Experience with fraud prevention software, ThreatMetrix a plus.Ability to work collaboratively across departments.Confident and professional communication skills.Demonstrated commitment to the oversight of methods and procedures to standardize and streamline operations, identify and implement cost-savings and process improvements.Demonstrated understanding of accounting controls and the maintenance of an appropriate control environment.Ability to handle financial detail with a high degree of accuracy and meet time-sensitive deadlines.Ability to work effectively with a diverse population in a fast-paced environment.Strong analytical skills and problem solving capabilities.About Apple Leisure GroupApple Leisure Group® (ALG) is the leading North American travel, hospitality and leisure management group with the only vertically-integrated business model, serving travelers and destinations worldwide. ALG consistently delivers exceptional value to travelers and strong performance to resort owners and partners by strategically leveraging the power of its portfolio of brands across five segments, comprising: the largest seller of vacation packages and charter flights in the U.S. for travel to Mexico and the Caribbean, moving approximately 3.2 million passengers annually through well-established vacation brands, brand management of 5-star and 4-star luxury resorts through AMResorts® award-winning brand portfolio; best-in-class destination management services provided by Amstar DMC and Worldstar®, the exclusive loyalty program Unlimited Vacation Club®; and the innovative technology solutions provider Trisept Solutions®, connecting over 88,000 travel agents with leading travel suppliers. To learn more about the Apple Leisure Group advantage, visit appleleisuregroup.com.Benefits at a GlanceWe offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefit package to our U.S. based employees:Medical, Dental and Vision InsuranceBasic Life InsuranceShort& Long Term DisabilityCorporate Wellness ProgramTravel Discounts& DealsPaid Time Off& Holidays401(k) Plan with Company MatchTuition ReimbursementWe are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free and tobacco-free workplace and perform pre-employment background checks.

When you choose Rockwell Automation, you join countless talented employees who have helped us establish our leadership position in the automation industry over the past century. And a corporation backed by the financial strength that drives growth – and career opportunities.  As much as we focus on our customers, we know our employees are key to our success and future. Helping you develop a rewarding career is a top priority. Because when you succeed, we succeed. Work State/City Mequon - Wisconsin
